Hawking up of a quantity of bloody mucus (fifteenth day), [1].
Pain in the tendons at the ankle, as if too short, when walking, [1].
A very painful fissure in the middle of the upper lip, which lasted several days (third day), [18].
Stitches in the knee, [1].
Taste insipid and bitter, and yet good appetite for dinner (forty-third day), [22a].
Expulsion of ascarides, [1].
Dry feeling in the mouth and throat (first day), [20], [20a].
Pressing pain in throat, in upper right side, [2].
Prickling in the tip of the little finger (after three days), [1].
Tired pain in the small of the back, [1].
Transient aching in right side of forehead (soon), [18d].
Violent digging pains in a right healthy molar tooth; strong pressure on the tooth diminished the pain; cold and heat had no effect on it, [17e].
Dizziness, with sticking in the head
After coition, first an erection, then weakness of thought, vertigo, discouraged, relaxation of the body, and in the evening, low-spirited and inclined to start (fourteenth day), [1].
In the afternoon, while walking, itching tearing in the left temporal bone, which came on by fits some five or six times, and was so violent that it made him stand still (first day), [39].
Severe cutting in right eye (first day), [17b].
Tearing in the left temple to the upper part of the left side of the head, [2].
At night, a grumbling in the molar teeth, [1].
Lame feeling in the knee-joints (seventh day), [38].
Sticking pain in the ear as far as the pharynx, [1].
Pressing pain in the right side of the abdomen, [1].
When falling asleep startled by an oppressive ebullition of blood, [1].
Pressure in the liver generally when taking a walk, [1].
While eating, pulsations in pit of stomach, the more he eats the worse it becomes, [1].
Felt sleepy and must lie down; relief from lying down (after five hours and a half), [33].
Right eye looks red and feels sore, left eye normal (third day), [37].
Complete loss of appetite, [65].
Hawking up of phlegm, in the morning (after four days), [1].
Stitches in the weak ear, over which she laments loudly, [1].
Continuous stitches in the left chest, without any relation to the breathing, [1].
Dryness in the fauces (after eleven days), [1].
Roaring in the ears, [1]; (in two hours), [25].
Cough, from tickling in trachea, toward morning, without expectoration, [1].
A suppurating pimple on the hairy scalp near the nape (sixteenth day), [45a].
Burning of the eyes, with great sensitiveness to daylight, [3].
Contractive headache in the forehead, [1].
Drawing-tensive pains in the right side of the lower jaw (seventeenth day), [29].
Drawing in the corns, the whole night, [1].
Severe cough, with little expectoration, but mostly with bitter vomiting, yet only evenings, when lying in bed, [1].
Tearing in the right upper jaw, in the evening, [1].
Scraping sensation in the throat, when swallowing, [2].
Bruised pain and lassitude in the legs; she sank unavoidably into a slumber full of anxious dreams, [1].
Inclination to sneeze, that shook her almost spasmodically, [3].
Feverish shivering, even of the head, with icy-cold hands, yawning and great weakness, [5].
Pains shooting through the right eye, and through the head generally, [64].

Dull pain in the root of the tongue, which increased towards evening and obstructed speech; it looked somewhat red and swollen (after two hours, sixth day); in the evening the pain in the tongue returned, and that more severely than yesterday (seventh day); in the evening the pain in the tongue again came on severely; he cannot describe the pain; the tongue feels much swollen, inflamed, and as if it were strongly pressed upon; on pressing the finger on the left side beneath the tongue backwards, he felt a very painful hard pimple of the size of a pea (eighth day); in the afternoon, violent pain occurred in the tongue; it was swollen, and the speech, in consequence difficult; the pain of the tongue lasted until late at night (tenth day); forced to leave off taking the Sulphur on account of the pain in the tongue; during this time the pain, swelling, and pimple disappeared (eleventh to sixteenth days); slight feeling of the pain of the tongue (eighteenth day); same pain in the tongue (twentieth day); the pain and swelling of the tongue increased so much that he could not be persuaded to continue the proving (twentieth to twenty-fourth days); in three days tongue again quite normal, [24].
Hoarseness, she cannot sing high notes, [1].
Dull aching pains in region of kidneys and small of back (thirty-second day), [38].
In the morning, on awaking, arid, wrinkled lips (third day); lips dry and shrivelled (fourth day); dryness of the lips and palate (tenth day), [29a].
Violent squeezing pain, first in the left, then in the right auricle, close to the meatus (first day), [18a].
Pain in the roots of the hair, especially when touched, [1].
Puffiness beneath the eyes (twentieth and twenty-third days), [20].
Very bad odor from the mouth, in the morning, and also afterwards, [1].
After emission, burning in the forepart of the urethra, [1].
Oppression of the chest, morning and evening, [1].
In the evening a fine burning, like sparks, on some parts of the skin of the right upper lid (third day), [25g].
Itching and burning in the nostrils, as if sore, [1].
Febrile excitement, immediately after dinner, [1].
Laziness after a meal, [1].
Very heavy and drowsy, [9].
Creeping in right ear, [1].
Stitches radiate at intervals from the region of upper abdomen, just under the pit of stomach, obliquely up into left side, [2].
Frequent awaking at night, on account of throbbing in the molar teeth, extending over the cheeks back towards the occiput, [1].
Pressure in the eyes, especially on working in the sun, [2].

The appetite, which had been increasing for some days, is uncommonly good to-day (twenty-first day); increased appetite, so much so that, contrary to custom, he must eat at other times than the accustomed meals (twenty-sixth and twenty-seventh days); appetite diminished (thirty-first and thirty-second days), [35].
Very sleepy during the day, and averse to everything, [1].
Drawing in the arms from above downward, extending to the fingers (after twenty-four hours), [1].
Ulceration, with agglutination of the eyes, in the morning, [1].
Tongue thickly furred with a dirty-yellow coating (fourteenth day); thickly furred tongue, morning, noon, and evening (twenty-seventh day); in the forenoon, tongue furred (thirty-first day), [29].
Red swelling of the cheeks, without pain, [1].
Eyes congested and dry (thirteenth day), [21].
Some blood discharged with the stool, daily, for a long time, [1].
In the morning, seized with profuse nosebleed; had four attacks during the day, a bright-red flow suddenly appearing, and disappearing as suddenly (third day), [25].
Headache as if the head would burst, also when coughing, [1].
About 2 A.M., violent throbbing of all the arteries of the head (third day), [25g].
Astringent smarting in the forepart of the urethra, in the morning when awaking, [1].

Fever, with pressing first in the temples, at intervals of several minutes; short breath, as from internal heat, the whole night through; following this in the morning, weak in the lower limbs, thirst, want of appetite, sleepiness; during the day feverish shivering, pain in the throat, and swelling of submaxillary glands, [1].
Stitching pain in the right chest, during inspiration (after ten days), [1].
The itching changes to burning, [1].
Menses came on a week too soon, scanty, and lasting only one day, [8].
Complete loss of appetite; he desires only acids, [1].
Cracking or feeling, as of the bursting of a bubble in the upper part of the nose, [1].

Hot flush over face and whole head, lasting but a few seconds, instantly followed by slight perspiration (after forty minutes); flush over the head, with the headache (after two hours and three-quarters); slight flush, with slight perspiration and slight increase of pain in the head (after five hours); flush of heat in face and head, followed by perspiration on the same parts (after nine hours, third day, and after eleven hours, fourth day), [44].
Drawing jerking in the left lower jaw, [1].
Jumping-aching pains in lower molars, [11].
Intermittent drawing pressure directly over the right buttock, [2].
Towards evening, in the open air, there were several dull shoots through the right external meatus (one hundred and twenty-seventh day), [45b].
Pressure on the bladder, with burning after micturition, in the evening, [1].
Pain in the upper part of the back, every morning, if she laces herself at all tightly, [1].
When she cannot expectorate with the cough, her breath almost leaves her, [1].
Tolerably severe pressure at a small spot between the scapulæ, [2].
Boring above the root of the nose (twentieth day), [34].
Headache, as if the eyes would fall out, [1].
Painful drawing, now in the right, and again in the left side of the occiput, inferiorly (after five hours), [2].
Jerking in the nape of the neck, with shaking of the head, [1].
Headache, especially in the forenoon, as if the head were drawn forward and downward, [1].
No appetite for supper (third day); little appetite for breakfast; loathed his dinner (fourth day); more appetite, at noon (sixth day), [45c].
Collection of saliva in the mouth, even after eating, [1].
Spasmodic cough, [1].
Pain in the gall-bladder, [7a].
Pains like knives shooting through the uterus spasmodically, [10].
The right foot goes to sleep (after two days), [1].
Stitching, headache, outward through the eyes, the entire day, [1].
Darting pains in the vagina, on left side, from below upwards (after five hours, second day), [44a].
Aching in the legs and ankles (first day), [22].
Headache externally on the left side, painful to touch, as if suppurating, [1].
The hands go to sleep frequently, at night (sixth night), [1].
Remains wakeful late in the evening, [1].
A feeling as if the eyes were plucked back into her head, [66].

A sharp stitching pain in the prepuce and frænum prep.; a smarting raw feeling, causing me to examine if it were not abraded; found only a congestion of the integument; these symptoms are new to me (twelfth and thirteenth days), [30].
Very frequent sneezing, in the evening and morning, [1].
Burning of the lids, that are inflamed and red and tense on motion, [1].
Boring pain in the knee-joint, when at rest, [1].
Severe itching smarting at the inner canthi of the left eye, with lachrymation and somewhat reddened conjunctiva, [2].
A general good-for-nothing feeling (fourth day), [44].
A feeling as of sand in the eyes, [56].
Pain in the hæmorrhoids after a natural stool (after four days), [1].
Aching in tibia (thirtieth day); in lower part of both tibiæ, 12 to 1 P.M. (thirty-first day), [38].
Itching in the upper part of the cheeks, and after rubbing it, a burning smarting, [1].
Icy-cold feet, particularly in the evening, even for a long time after going to bed, cannot warm them, [41].
Before the stool the beginning of a flatulent colic, accompanied with groaning and sobbing, [1].
Otalgia (after twenty-four days), [1].
Pain in the tibia and fibula, particularly, however, in the malleoli, as if the bones would be forced apart, [1].
During the menses, severe pressure in the forehead, with discharge of hardened offensive matter from nose, [1].
Hypersensitiveness of the auditory nerves in one who hears with difficulty, so that playing the piano causes nausea, [1].
Eruption on the head, back, and shoulder; it itched badly during the evening and all night (fifth and sixth days), [22].
Swelling of the lower lip, with eruption upon it, [1].
Heaviness of the head, every, morning when rising, which is better after two hours, [1].
Violent rising of heat to the head, every five minutes, [1].
Drawing pain in the right wrist-joint, [2].
Fine quick gurgling in the right side of upper abdomen, [2].
Flushes of heat, she feels in a kind of glow, [9].
Stitches in the forehead, with nausea (she cannot eat), better from lying down, [1].
Pale face, [7a]; (after twenty-four hours), [1]; (second, fourth, and fifth days), [44].
The menses, which were usually accompanied by cold and aching pains in lower bowels, came on without the least distress), [9].
Crampy pain in the bones of the face, [1].
Looseness of the teeth and bleeding of the gum, for three weeks, [1].
Slight frontal headache (second day); dull frontal headache (third and fourth days), [26].
Chilliness, with thirst, towards evening, followed by nightsweat, [1].
Appetite for only soft food, not for bread or meat, [1].
Great burning and lachrymation of the eyes, [11].
Stiffness in the back part of the neck (after two days), [28].

Several pimples on cheeks and wrists, which are very sore, and of a pustular character at first, then resemble chicken-pox (sixth day); pimples still on cheeks (for ten weeks); pimples on cheeks just before and during menstruation (for three months); the pimples were attended by burning and soreness; when opened; pus and blood were discharged, and a small pit was left at the seat of the pimple, [24].
Short pain in the right thigh, in the evening after lying down, so severe that she had to lie without being able to move, sixteen evenings in succession (after two days), [1].
Sweat every morning, in bed, after awaking, mostly on the lower limbs, [1].
Burning in the forepart of the urethra (after nine and twenty days), [1].

Throat dry and hot, with paroxysms of pain, attended by lachrymation, in the afternoon; worse at 8 P.M.; a raw feeling in the posterior nares, with dryness and rigidity in the throat below; throat so dry as to seem like a board; in swallowing it seemed as if the opposing parts would not blend, they were so dry and rigid; frequent paroxysms of pain in throat, with lachrymation; fauces red (twenty-second day); throat worse after sleeping, with paroxysms of pain, attended by lachrymation, relieved for a time by detaching mucus, which had to be swallowed; throat bright red; feeling of dryness and rigidity in the throat, and of rawness in the posterior nares (twenty-third day), [20].
Frontal headache during the day; queer feeling in the head (third day), [36].
Soon after dinner, great flow of saliva into the mouth, and sudden softly digging pain in the right parotid gland (fifth day), [25a].
Painful stitches in the left thigh, when walking (after eleven days), [1].
Intermission of beats of the heart, mostly after a meal, [1].
Intolerance of noise (second day), [33].
The eyes seem blinded, in the morning, [1].
Teeth very much on edge, for seven days, [1].

Feeling of bearing down of all the pelvic organs (second and fourth days); weight and bearing down (fifth and sixth days); some bearing down (seventh and eighth days); on rising, in the morning, with the leucorrhœa (ninth day); some pressure and bearing down after rising (tenth, eleventh, and thirteenth days), [44].
Itching biting in the outer canthus (after six hours), [1].
Voluptuous dreams, with pollutions, [1].
Constipated, [19].
Pain and tingling all through the head, [56].
Dull feeling in the head with the pelvic distress (sixteenth day), [20].
Waked at 3 A.M.; a rush of ideas prevented sleep for an hour, when I broke out in profuse sweat; followed by quiet sleep (twenty-seventh day), [20].
Itching in various parts of the body, relieved by scratching, after which there is a pinkish color (after two days), [28].
Herpetic blotches around the mouth, [1].
Swelling of the head above the temples (after forty-eight hours), [1].

In the evening, dulness and confusion of the sinciput (soon, third day); in the morning, after awaking, vacancy and confusion of the sinciput (fourth and fifth days); in the evening, vacancy of the sinciput (ninth day), [29a].
Goneness, principally located in stomach (after two hours and a half, second and third days), [42].
At 11.30 A.M., occasional violent shooting in the right cheek-bone (sixth day), [37a].
Sore pain of the tongue (after seventeen days), [1].
Headache worse in the open air, better in the house, [3].
Sensation as if the nape of the neck were swollen, [1].
Smarting of the eyes, in the evening; the candlelight seems to be a red ring, wherewith he cannot see, [1].
Severe tearing in the urethra, [1].
Palpitation of the heart, with stitches in left side of chest, [1].
Falls asleep late on account of wakefulness, [1].
Supper relieved all the symptoms except dryness of the throat; sick all day until supper (twenty-fourth day), [20].
Painful stiffness, apparently in the region of the uterus, [1].
Restless sleep, with vexatious dreams; he calls loudly, stamps with the feet, raises his arms, which he then slowly lays down again, [1].
Anxious dreams, which drive him out of bed (after nineteen days), [1].
Pressure on the right chest in paroxysms, relieved by empty eructations, [2].
Stomachache in the morning in bed, [1].
Left side of throat and tongue and corner of mouth covered with vesicles (seventeenth day), [21].
Dull tearing in the forehead, immediately after a meal, [1].
Whizzing before the ears, in the evening when writing, interpolated with whistling, [1].
Desire for vinegar, [1].
Purring in the lower limbs, arms, and hands, [1].
Burning of the eyelids externally, [1].
Painful nodes on the forehead, [1].
Burning on the skin of the arm on the outside just below the shoulder-joint, as from a blister, [2].
Violent formication in the abdomen, [2].
Violent pressure in the ears on swallowing and sneezing, [1].
Cough, mostly in the evening, in bed, with vomiting, [1].
*Vertigo, to falling forward, on suddenly rising from a seat, [1].
Stitches transversely through the abdomen, just over the hips, [1].
Drawing in the left upper jaw and zygoma, about 5 P.M. (eighth day), [44a].
A red herpetic spot on the upper eyelid, scaly and peeling off, [1].
Stitch continuing one minute in the region of the lowest right rib, toward the pit of the stomach, passing off from eructations, [2].
Epigastrium tense, pressing pain in it one hour after dinner, and after walking in the open air, [2].
Accumulation of saliva in the mouth, when beginning to eat, [1].
Dull drawing pain in the suprascapular region, on the right side (second day), [36].
Slight attack of vertigo and palpitation of heart, when walking in the open air, [1].
Yellowness around the mouth, [1].
Pressive headache in the occiput, in the evening till midnight, [1].
Smarting pain on the outer side of the right hand (fifth day), [38].
Beating headache with every movement, [1].

About 8 P.M., tickling in the left nostril, immediately followed by the discharge of bright-red thickish blood, to the extent of about half a drachm, which contained a proportionately large quantity of sulphates (forty-eighth day), [2
Blisters on the hard palate, which prevent talking and eating, [1].
Coming from college, felt a light sensation in the left limb, from the hip down (third day), [27].
Frequent dryness of the mouth, as if the tongue would cleave to the mouth, without thirst, [1].
Soreness and pain in the back, in sacral region (first and second days), [44a].
Sensation of many burning sparks in the eyelids, that are immediately drawn together, [1].
White flickering before the eyes, [1].
Awoke feeling very hungry; could not go to sleep again because of the gnawing hunger (twelfth day), [21].
Sweat in the morning, after awaking, which continues very profuse the whole day, and makes him so weak by evening that he could not stand on his feet (after thirteen days), [1].
Frequent starting when falling asleep, [1].
With the earache after midnight, a cold sensation all over the head, relieved by warmth and sleep (nineteenth night); sensation of coldness on the head, especially at night (twentieth day), [20].
Palpitation of the heart, in the evening, for a quarter of an hour, [1].

Slept from 10 to 11 P.M., and then woke, feeling as if a load were resting across the epigastrium; she took a dose of Aconite 3d, according to her custom, when disturbed in her sleep, and slept until morning (eleventh night), [23].
Numb feeling in the nerves, also in the tongue, with dulness of the head and absence of thought, in the evening, [3].
Stitching pressure between the scapulæ, [1].
*Very painful hammering in the head, [1].
Burning of the eyes, in the morning, with weakness of the eyes, [1].

Intermittent fever, returning frequently during the day, at indefinite periods, first general heat, with sweat in the face, violent thirst, and bitterness of the mouth; then chill, with general coldness even in the face, with inclination to vomit, pressure in the forehead, extending into the temples; during the heat, vertigo, as if he would fall, [1].

A weak feeling all over (ninth day); quite weak (tenth day); wakened weary (twentieth morning); after sleeping, afternoon, no disposition to move or talk, but to sit quietly and wonder what is the matter (twenty-third day); with fulness in the temple (twenty-ninth day), [20].
While seated at breakfast, felt a cutting pain in the hypogastric region, at the same time an imperative urging to stool (fifth day); I seldom have pains in bowels, [27].
Drawing in all the limbs (almost immediately), [1].
Moist pimply eruption at the margin of the vermilion border of the upper lip, [2].

Prolapsus uteri, with inclination of the fundus to the left side, producing a numb feeling in the entire lower half of the left side of the body, with dull aching pain constantly; also the same aching pain in the pelvic region, somewhat relieved by the recumbent posture, especially when lying on the right side; tenderness of the os uteri (first and third days), [42].
Beating in the left chest (after six days), [1].
*Headache, as from a weight pressing upon the top of the brain, and as from a cord around the head, [1].
Great uneasiness in the limbs, at night, [1].
Flexion of the index finger since morning; he could not straighten it, [1].
Fatigue and powerlessness in both arms, on awaking, [8].
Sleeplessness at night, with fancies during slumber, [1].
Pressure in the abdomen a few days before the menses, and after this had passed off, soreness in the perinæum and swelling of the pudendum before the discharge of blood came on, [1].
*Pressure externally on the vertex, extending to the forehead, [1].
Heaviness of the limbs, [7a].
Aching pain in the forehead, [8].
The slightest exercise, even writing, excites sweat, [1].
Pressure on the upper part of the sinciput, [2].
Stool consisting of light-colored fæces, thin, looking almost like grits, [7a].
Sharp pain in the left side, near the heart, in the middle of the afternoon, and again about 10 P.M. (tenth day), [22].
Woke with a dull headache, which ceased on rising; at 9.45 P.M., a dull headache through both temples (slight), (second day), [40a].
Inclined to take a long breath (after three hours and a half, second day), [42].
Drawing in the left side of the lower jaw, towards its articulation, about noon (sixth day), [44d].
Profuse coryza, [56].
*Jerking headache, [1].
Vertigo, when lying on the back, at night, [1].
During the menses, nosebleed, three successive evenings, [1].
Very salt tasting expectoration from chest, [1].
Burning and hot feeling in the loins (region of kidneys), when taking a long breath, [1].
A smarting blister on the right side of the tongue, [1].
Tension in the tendons over the knee, when going upstairs, [1].
Thick yellow discharge from the nose (seventh day), [37].
Vertigo, while walking, as if every object were in motion, [1].
Stitching pain in the third toe of the right foot, at the same time as the pain in the left lung (tenth day), [27].
Mammæ sore and tender to touch (eleventh day); even moving, turning, or stepping aggravates the soreness (twelfth day), [20].
Anxious dreams, as if the body were disfigured, [1].
Water runs from the mouth, and hawking up of mucus, [1].
Unaccountable feeling of weariness (third day), [40a].
Itching blisters and blotches on the face, hands, and feet, [1].
Bleeding of the gum, [3].
Tension of the lower lip, [1].
Great falling out of the hair (after one and eight days), [1].
Coppery taste in the mouth, in the morning on waking, [1].
Profuse sweat, while walking, [1].
Biting in the eyes, as from Ammonia, [1].
Paralytic sensation in the arm, then throbbing in it, [1].
Tearing and jerking toothache, from 6 P.M., until after midnight, about 1 or 2 A.M., on four successive days, [1].
Stiffness in the back, which passes off when walking, [1].
Great weakness (after twenty-four hours), [1].
Stitching in the dorsum of foot, especially painful when walking on the pavement, [1].
He blows a piece of yellowish-green skin with blood at the edges from the nose (after four days), [1].
Drawing in the right molar teeth (eighth day), [44d].
Inclination to vomit, when washing the mouth, in the morning, [1].
Painful swelling of the gums, [1].

After midnight, excessively violent pains in the left lower jaw; the pains were drawing pressing, proceeding from a healthy tooth, spreading over the whole lower jaw, extending to the temple and ear, and lasting till he got up the following morning (two hundred and seventy-seventh day); some tenderness of the left lower jaw (two hundred and seventy-ninth day); towards morning, severe pain in the left lower jaw, sometimes with drawing into the left ear; in the forenoon, in the open air, the pain increased; it was a very painful drawing, which extended not only over the jaw, but over the whole of the left side of the face; one spot on the lower border of the under jaw was especially painful, also when touched; in the evening, in the open air, the pain extended in an aggravated degree all over the lower jaw; occasional pain in the left lower jaw, in the morning (two hundred and eightieth day); drawing in the lower jaw, in the morning (two hundred and eighty-first day); towards morning the pain of the left lower jaw, especially about a loose tooth, extremely violent (two hundred and eighty-second day); pain in the lower jaw during the day, occasional sharp tearing in the left lower jaw (two hundred and eighty-third day), [45b].
Cold sweat at night on the breast, back, and thighs (after thirty-six hours and on sixth day), [1].
Hæmorrhoids without constipation, [1].
Ineffectual desire to urinate, at 11 A.M. (fifth day), [26].
Small severely itching pustule on the occiput toward the nape of the neck, which became an ulcer of an inch in length, with rough scabs beneath, which for a long time was moist, [1].
Great excitement of the whole body, [1].
Toothache, which is renewed by cold rinsing of the mouth, [1].
Great weakness of the arms; they go to sleep when at rest, [1].
Jerking of the head backward, in the morning when rising, [1].
Profuse sweat during exercise, smelling almost like elder blossoms, [1].
It is painful within the ear, when cleaning, [1].
Jerking in the lids, [1].
Constrictive pain in the temples, several mornings, [1].
Pressure and tension in the forehead and eyes, with burning, [1].
Great weakness of the knees, [1].

Frequent sneezing, discharge of fluid mucus from the left nostril, a very severe catarrh, although that which dated from 20th October, had only quite ceased a few days previously (seventeenth day), [28c].
Constrictive pressive sore throat, just above and on the larynx, [2].
Fulness in temples and forehead, and throbbing of carotids (twenty-third day), [20].
A cicatrix on the tip of the index finger commences to bleed spontaneously, [1].
Skin seems tender; the least scratch heals slowly (twenty-fourth day), [20].
Much cough, with expectoration, day and night; the cough wakes her at night, with sensation in the chest as if hollow, and smarting therein as if sore, [1].
Swelling of the gum about an old stump, [1].
Itching on the tip of the nose, [1].
Tearing in the head more in the afternoon than in the forenoon, with weakness and thirstless heat; is obliged to lay the head upon a table to get relief, [1].
Pressing stitching-tearing pain in the groin, extending into the thigh, when stepping out while walking (fourth day), [1].
She becomes paralyzed from vexation, [1].
Violent feverish headache in the crown, occurring several mornings and lasting several hours, [1].
Drawing-tensive pressure in the abdomen, [2].

About 5 P.M., dull digging pain in the left side of the forehead, with confusion of the whole head (second day); towards noon, dull drawing frontal headache, which, after a few minutes, alternated with a similar pain in the right wrist (fourth day); in the afternoon, frequent alternation of frontal headache with the pain in the joints, described the day previous (seventh day), [25a].
Burning in stomach and pit of stomach, [1].
Sense of smell more acute than usual (eighteenth day); increased acuteness (twenty-third day), [20].
*Boring headache on the top beneath the vertex; the spot is also painful to touch externally, [1].
Very mawkish taste, sour taste after eating, [8].
Coryza, with chilliness, catarrh and cough, [1].
Before going to sleep, shooting pain in the upper border of the left orbit (first day), [33a].
Profuse sweat, with the eruption, [23].
Stitches here and there in the forehead, [1].
Anxious oppression in upper part of chest, [8].
Four hours after taking the medicine, when in bed, he felt a rubbing dry sensation (like sand) in the mucous surface of the eyelids (fourth day), [25].
Tearing pressure in the orbits of the eyes, particularly of the left eye, [2].
Hoarseness, with dry cough, from tickling in the throat (after five days), [1].
Hot, oppressed, and anxious from tobacco-smoking, to which he was accustomed, [1].
A leucorrhœa, from which she had suffered a very long time, left her completely while under the proving), [8].
Pressure in the eyebrows and balls, [1].
Sneezing, with moisture in the nose, about 9 A.M., [46a].
Bone pain in the ball of the great toe, [1].
Agglutinated eyes, in the morning (after burning, in the evening), [3].
Periodically recurring, but not very severe pains in the temples, followed by acute drawing pains in the temples, [17a].
Vertigo, lasting some minutes, followed immediately by slight shooting in the anus (fourteenth day), [45b].
Great uneasiness in the evening in one lower extremity, as from a sort of internal imperfect itching, [1].
Cramplike pain in the stomach and abdomen, [1].
Pressure and burning in the cheeks and cheek-bones, [1].
Tingling and pulsation in the ears, [1].
Pressure over the eyes if he goes into bright daylight (after eleven days), [1].
Throbbing drawing toothache, [1].
Sudden stitches in the pit of the stomach, when swallowing the food very quickly, [1].
Bleeding of the nose when blowing it, in the evening, [1].
A small painful spot, covered with papulæ, on the right temple (two hundred and seventy-fifth day), [45b].
Cracking in the articulation of the jaw on chewing, [1].
Yellowish-brown spots about the neck, that scale off on rubbing, [7].
Headache in the morning, with nausea, until noon, [1].
Pulse 120, with rash, [10].
Much pressure and tension in the upper abdomen, at times relieved by an internal fermentation, together with pressure and sticking in the umbilical region, [2].
*Vertigo (eighty-first day), [45a].,
Want of erections (after several days), [1].
Cutting pain in the throat, with raw feeling, and accompanied by the accumulation of much phlegm, [9].
Tenderness of the upper lip after rising (second day), [45a].
Teeth on edge, [1].
Headache all day; worse from 5 to 6 P.M. (fourth day), [38].

Distress in the pelvis, with the sick feeling, at 9 A.M., increasing during the forenoon; waked from a nap, at 4 P.M., with the distress aggravated and feeling somewhat gloomy, but battling against it; after supper, at 6 P.M., all my bad feelings left me; at 9 P.M., the bearing-down feeling in the abdomen returned (second day). At 9 A.M., the dragging and pressing sensation in the abdomen returned; pressure as though the contents would issue through the genital organs; pressing outwards in the hypogastric region, as if the bladder would fall out over the os pubis, partially relieved by hard pressure (third day). The pelvic distress was noticeable through the whole night, at waking intervals, and relief only momentary by lying on either side with the legs flexed on the thighs and the thighs on the abdomen (third night). I waked this morning without the distress, but it returned on stirring, and increased before breakfast; distress in the hypogastric region through the day, as of overdistended bladder, that could not be endured; worse by continually sitting and lying; better on walking about; it disappeared on eating supper; better when walking in the open air (fourth day). Pressure downwards, as if the uterus would issue through the vulva; complete cessation of distress in uterus from supper to 9 P.M., when it returned (fifth day). A load or weight in the lower part of the abdomen, in the morning; at 9 A.M. suddenly ill, with the bearing-down feeling greatly increases in the abdomen; pelvic symptoms aggravated, at P.M., after sleep; the distress was relieved on eating supper, and returned at 9 P.M. (ninth day). The pelvic distress and bearing down have returned; they last all day, with dull feeling in the head and desire to sit or lie still with eyes closed; amelioration after supper; sick in my room from 9 A.M. to 6 P.M. (sixteenth day). Bearing-down sensation, with the menses (eighteenth day). Feeling of crowding and pressing downwards (nineteenth day). Downward pressure in abdomen; the only way in which I could fall asleep was by assuming the knee-elbow position for a time, causing slight eructation, relief, and sleep (twenty-first night). In the afternoon pressure in the uterus, as if everything would issue through the vulva (twenty-third day). Through the day, occasional bearing-down sensation in abdomen (twenty-seventh day). Pressing down in abdomen (twenty-ninth day), [20].
Drawing cutting toothache, [1].
Cough, from tickling in the larynx, without expectoration (after five days), [1].
Smarting of the eyes, with a feeling as if they watered, [1].
Unsuccessful desire for stool, passes only wind and mucus, with sensation in rectum as if a plug were in it, [1].
Nose swollen, [1].
In the evening, headache, with several momentary attacks of oppression (ninth day), [15].
Tongue sticky and coated a dirty yellow; a very putrid taste, which causes nausea (third day), [21].
Aching in the small of the back (ninth and sixteenth days), [20].
Seems to be averse to smoking tobacco (secondary effect?), [1].
Heat in the face, after a meal, [1].
Dryness in the throat, in the evening, before going to sleep, which is not relieved by drinking (after eight days), [4].
*Violent headache at night, which disturbed sleep; she had rest in no position, [3].
Bad smell from the mouth, [1].
Great dryness of the lips, [29].
Red, salt-sour water is exuded from a left lower hollow back tooth, [3].
Chilly sensations in the back, with the sleepiness, at 8 P.M. (twentieth day), [20].
Vertigo, with cold hands and feet (after thirty-four days), [1].
Menses two days too early, [1].
Sleep sound, yet with many vivid dreams, [3].
The epidermis peels off in large and small, mostly roundish spots, particularly on the hands and fingers, without pain (after a few days), [1].
Stye on the upper lid by the inner canthus, [1].
Colic from the navel to the pudendum, mostly when touching the abdomen, [1].
Pimples on the chin with ulcerative pain, when touched, [1].
In the afternoon, burning heat in the throat, with a fulness and pressure in the head (second day); increased (third day); continued four or five days, [32].

9 A.M., 9 ounces of urine, sp. gr. 1028; 2 P.M., 9 ounces, sp. gr. 1022; 7 P.M., 10 ounces, sp. gr. 1024; midnight, 10 ounces, sp. gr. 1024; total, 38 ounces (first day); 9 A.M., 8 ounces, sp. gr. 1027; 2 P.M., 6 ounces, sp. gr. 1027; 7 P.M., 7 ounces, sp. gr. 1028; midnight, 8 ounces, sp. gr. 1028; total, 29 ounces (second day); 9 A.M., 9 ounces, sp. gr. 1028; 2 P.M., 7 ounces, sp. gr. 1026; 7 P.M., 7 ounces, sp. gr. 1032; midnight 4 ounces, sp. gr. 1025; total, 27 ounces (third day); 9 A.M., 9 ounces, sp. gr. 1025; 2 P.M., 6 ounces, sp. gr. 1027; 7 P.M., 7 ounces, sp. gr. 1027; midnight, 8 ounces, sp. gr. 1031; total, 30 ounces (fourth day); 9 A.M., 8 ounces, sp. gr. 1028; 2 P.M., 7 ounces; 7 P.M., 7 ounces, sp. gr. 1026; midnight, 7 ounces, sp. gr. 1032; total, 29 ounces (fifth day); 9 A.M., 8 1/2 ounces, sp. gr. 1026; 2 P.M., 7 ounces; 7 P.M., 9 ounces, sp. gr. 1021; midnight, 11 ounces, sp. gr. 1022; total, 36 1/2 ounces (sixth day); 9 A.M., 13 ounces, sp. gr. 1024; 2 P.M., 7 ounces; 7 P.M., 10 ounces, sp. gr. 1024; midnight, 4 ounces, sp. gr. 1032; total, 34 ounces (seventh day), [36].
Congestion of blood to the eyes, [1].
Violent nosebleed (after twelve days), [1].
Smarting-boring pain to the right of the navel (after eighteen days), [1].
Severe stitching pain through the left ovary, at 4 P.M. (fifth day); at 4.30 P.M., through left ovary and acetabulum, I can scarcely bear the pain (sixth day), [21].
Bruised pain and weakness in the hip-joint, worse when rising from a seat, so that she cannot walk without holding on to something; it became better from continued walking, [1].
Stitching pain in the soles, also from touch, she can scarcely walk, [1].
Pain as if burned on the tongue, when smoking (his accustomed) tobacco, [1].
Tearing in the sole of right foot, close to the toes, [2].
Violent headache (seventeenth and following days), [27].
Disgust for tobacco after smoking, [29a].
After drinking coffee, burning of the right cheek and auricle, with chilliness of the rest of the body (third day), [18].
Tearing in the head, over the forehead, and in the eyes, from 2 P.M., until evening when going to sleep, [1].
Stoppage of both nostrils, with frequent sneezing, [1].
At 5 P.M., fever, first thirst, and after drinking cold water, chilliness and inclination to lie down, then sleep and inclination to general slight sweat, [1].
A sharp shooting pain through the heart, like an electric shock, about noon (eleventh day), [58].
Eyes sunken, surrounded by blue rings, [1].
Aching in left eye (soon); in the evening, aching in the left eye (second day), [20].
The skin of the whole body pains as if sore, [1].
Roaring and pulsative blowing in the right ear, at night, [3].
Burning tearing at inner part of left buttock, [2].
Dull pain in the sacrum (thirty-fifth day), [21].
Tearing in the whole thigh, particularly in the knees, after dinner and supper, [1].
*Pressure in the temples and tension in the brain, on reflecting and on mental work, [1].
Thirst, with dryness and agglutination of the mouth, [3].
Woke at 7 A.M. with darting-pressing pain in the right eye, lasting about fifteen minutes, when it ceased in the right eye and appeared in the left eye (second day), [31].
After lying down, fine drawing shooting in the left side of the occiput (twelfth day), [28c].
Much salivation, in the evening, [1].
Tremulous shaking motion of the whole body, [1].
Burning, as from pepper, in the mouth, day and night, causing thirst, not relieved by drinking, [1].
Pain in both sides of the chest, passing around to the interscapular space, [9].
While walking, vertigo like an obscuration before the eyes, a reeling to the left side, lasting a few minutes, [1].
Discharge of prostatic fluid with every difficult stool, [1].

Continuous dry fever heat, with redness of the face, great thirst, painful swallowing, stitches in the left scapula, arresting the breathing, tearing in the upper and lower limbs (after thirteen days), [1].
Stitching-scratching sore pain in pharynx, during empty deglutition, [1].
Nosebleed just before and after the menses, [1].
Nausea several minutes every morning, at 10 oclock, without eructations, [1].

A painful spot in the red part of the upper lip, in the forenoon (first day); a small pustule on that spot; after this was opened and the matter discharged, it disappeared in a few days (second day), [45b].
Discharge of blood with stool, which is not hard, [1].
Constipated (sixth day), and for ten weeks after first taking Sepia, [24].
For the last two days have had the contractive pain in the back of the neck, mostly on right side (fifth day), [36].
Even at night he must arise to urinate, and as often as he woke he had to urinate, with much thirst, even at night, [1].
Feel better when out of doors (third day), [37].
Burning pressure in the spinal column (after thirteen days), [1].
Nausea, with the chilly sensation (thirty-sixth day); less severe (thirty-seventh day); considerable nausea (thirty-eighth day), [21].
Smoking tobacco is not relished by one accustomed to smoking, [1].
Accumulation of flatus in the abdomen, when walking in the open air, [1].
Painful swelling of the knee, with tension in the knee during rest and motion, [1].
The vomiting (during pregnancy) frequently strains her so that blood comes up, [1].

Vilent sneezing (immediately); frequent sneezing, which increases the pain under sternum (seventh day); few sneezes (forty-second day); frequent sneezing (forty-fifth day); occasional sneezing and hawking of mucus (fifty-fifth day); occasional violent sneezing, in the forenoon (fifty-ninth day); frequent sneezing and dry tussiculation (sixty-seventh day); occasional sneezing, in the morning after rising (eighty-fifth day); occasional sneezing and coughing up of thick mucus (one hundred and tenth day); frequent sneezing (one hundred and forty-seventh day); violent sneezing, in the evening (two hundred and seventeenth day); very violent sneezing, at noon, ten successive times, followed by frequent dry tussiculation (two hundred and nineteenth day); occasional sneezing (two hundred and thirty-first and two hundred and thirty-second day); occasional violent sneezing (two hundred and seventy-ninth day); occasional sneezing (two hundred and eighty-second day), [45b].
Violent toothache, [7a].
Beaten bruised feeling of the lower limbs; every nerve therein was painful; also painful when touched; pain removed by dancing, [1].
Dimness of vision, with giddy confusion (first day), [25g].
Contraction in the region of the stomach, [1].

At noon but little appetite; he ate more from habit than from necessity (third day); at noon little appetite, and no desire to drink water while eating, which he was always in the habit of doing (sixth day); at noon no appetite (ninth day), [29a].

Pressure in the uterus, causing oppression of breathing; the pressure downward is as if everything would fall out, accompanied with pains in the abdomen; she must cross her limbs in order to prevent the protrusion of the vagina, yet nothing protruded, but there was an increase of gelatinous leucorrhœa (after ten and twenty hours), [1].
She eats without hunger or appetite, only from habit, with natural taste to food, [3].
Very frequent sneezing always preceded by nausea, [1].
Frightful dream; she screams aloud at night, [1].
Roaring in the ears, in the evening in bed, with rush of blood to the head, [1].
Heat in the face in the morning, pale face in the evening, [1].
Violent pain in the middle of the head, caused by coughing and sneezing, [1].
Flushes of heat, in the evening, then itching, [1].
Jerking in the lower lid, [1].
Stool after several days, first hard, then soft, [1].
Heaviness of the legs, as far as the knees, as if they would fall asleep, [1].
Ringing in the ears, with deafness, during dinner, [1].

Urine, sp. gr. 1022, A.M.; 1005 (due to eating a sour orange), P.M. (twenty-fifth day before the proving); 1012 A.M., 1026 P.M. (twenty-fourth day); 1026 A.M., 1028 P.M. (twenty-third day); 1020 A.M., 1022 P.M. (twenty-second day); 1022, A.M. and P.M. (twenty-first and twentieth days); 1022 A.M., 1012 P.M. (nineteenth day); 1020 A.M., 1024 P.M. (eighteenth day); 1012 P.M. (seventeenth day); 1024 A.M., 1026 P.M. (sixteenth day); 1012 A.M. (fifteenth day); 1028 P.M. (fourteenth day); 1022 A.M., 1028 P.M. (thirteenth day); 1022 A.M., 1026 P.M. (twelfth day); 1020 A.M., 1012 P.M. (eleventh day); 1014 A.M., 1028 P.M. (tenth day); 1020 A.M., 1016 P.M. (ninth day); 1014 A.M., 1024 P.M. (eighth day); 1020 A.M. (seventh day); 1020 P.M. (sixth day); 1018 A.M., 1028 P.M. (fifth day); 1024 A.M., 1026 P.M. (fourth day); 1020 A.M., 1026 P.M. (third day); 1020 A.M. (second day); 1020 A.M., 1022 P.M. (first day before the proving); 1012 A.M.; smarting pain in urethra (first day of proving); sp. gr. 1022 A.M., 1026 P.M. (second day); 1024 A.M., 1032 P.M. (fourth day); 1022 A.M., 1028 P.M.; sharp pain along canal of urethra (fifth day); sp. 1024 A.M., 1030 P.M.; urine high-colored; quickly gets turbid, and stains bottom of vessel; occasional stitches along urethra (sixth day); sp. gr. 1024 A.M., 1030 P.M.; smarting and tingling pain in the urethra (eighth day); sp. gr. 1026 A.M., 1032 P.M. (ninth day); 1024 A.M., 1026 P.M. (tenth day); 1022 A.M. (eleventh day); 1028 A.M., 1030 P.M. (twenty-eighth day); 1030 A.M. (twenty-ninth day); urine remained high-colored; became quickly turbid, and a fine reddish sediment was noticed, in the morning, in the urine passed the previous evening (twelfth to twenty-third day). The quantity of urine was so small as to alarm me; not more than 8 ounces in twenty-four hours; constant irritation and desire to urinate (thirty-eighth to fortieth day), [38].
*Beating of the brain against the skull on moving the head, with pressive pain, [1].
Heavy sweat, as from a cold, [9].
The eyes are painful on looking at the flame of a candle, [1].
A dizzy condition of the head prevented sharp and clear thought
Flushes of heat, after slight exercise, [9].
Frightful dreams, as if she were falling from a high mountain, [1].
Tearing under the nail of the right index finger, [2].
Ringing in the ears, and roaring, as from a wind, especially after lying down, [1].
Drawing pain in the left side of the face, as if in the skin, above the eye, on the temples, and on the malar bone as far as into the lobule of the ear, mostly in the morning, [1].
Shooting pain for a short time, as if a needle were driven into left cheek, [19].
Stitches in the forehead, as from needles, daily, when walking fast, with nausea, [1].
Red tongue, with white papillæ, like fungi, [1].
Very hungry at noon (twenty-first day), [20].
Pressure in the lower part of the abdomen, to the left of the navel, and at times quite in the left side, [2].
Cramp in the calves at night (after a cold), [1].
Scraping sensation in the anus during stool, [1].
A red pimple on the margin of the red of the lower lip, with sticking pain only on touch, [1].
Tenderness of upper lip (eleventh and forty-first days), [45a].
Intolerance of sunlight, [1].
Drawing pain in both sides of the abdomen, in repeated attacks, [1].
Hoarseness and fluent coryza (after four days), [1].
Head tired and full, with a feeling as if I were just on the point of falling asleep; head symptoms aggravated after sleep (ninth day), [20].

Stitches posteriorly over the right hip, for four days almost continuous; she could not lie on the right side on account of the pain, and when touching the part it pained as from subcutaneous ulceration, [1].
Penetrating shooting and drawing in the left zygoma (one hundred and forty-third day), [45b].
Eyes slightly adhering, in the morning, on awaking (fourteenth day), [45].
Pimples in the face, which itch somewhat, [1].
On blowing my nose, I notice blood mixed with mucus (eighth day), [37].
Obstruction of the nose and difficult breathing (after eleven days), [1].
Drawing pain in the bones of the orbits, [1].
Burning constrictive pain in the shoulders, chest, and throat, evenings, [1].
Mouth sweetish, and foul all day, [1].
Pressive toothache, with pain in the submaxillary glands, [1].

A peculiar wavelike sensation extending through the body; a wavelike motion down the arms and legs to near the extremities; then a sudden interruption of wave and an expansion, with sharp rheumatic pain, lasting but a minute and then subsiding (after four doses), [28].
Tearing pains now in the left and again in the right forearm, near the wrist, [2].
Great dragging in my right side (fifth day), [37].
Tearing in the malar bone, also at other times in the lower jaw, as if the parts would be torn out, [3].
Sensation as of a knife plunged into the left hand, just on the ball behind the little finger, for a few minutes (seventh day), [27].
Bloody slimy discharge from the vagina, [1].
Violent pressure in the head the whole day, with vertigo, tearfulness, and severe coryza, [1].
In the afternoon, tearing and aching pain in the frontal region, which sometimes extended into the temporal region, and lasted an hour (first day), [39b].
During menses, drawing from the teeth into the cheek, which becomes swollen, [1].
Pain in the left ear, as if it were being torn out, [1].

Dimness of vision of both eyes, with great sensitiveness to bright daylight (second day); great dimness of vision (on reading), as if the cornea had lost its transparency; at the same time feeling of dryness (as from fine sand) between the eyelids (after one hour, seventh day), [25a].
*Headache, as if screwed together, in and over the forehead, [1].

One sharp darting pain in the right ovarian region, (seventeenth day); pain in the right ovarian region, as of a thread running downward to the uterus and drawn tightly (eighteenth day); pain in right ovary; the dull ovarian pain is sharper on inspiration (nineteenth day); pain in right ovary, worse in the afternoon (twentieth day); dull pain in the right ovary, with occasional sharp shooting pains (twenty-second day); steady pain in the right ovarian region and backache (twenty-third day); pain in right ovary, soreness on pressure after sleep, in afternoon. Felt too badly to move (twenty-fourth day), [20].
Catamenia appeared the second time after an interval of only eighteen days, instead of the customary twenty-six days, [20].
In the morning, on awaking, feeling of sand in the eyes, with raw pain on rubbing them (second day), [25d].
Stitches in the parietal and occipital bones when coughing, [1].
Itching of the nipples, that at times bleed and seem about to suppurate, [7].
Emptiness of stomach, with nausea, as soon as she thinks of food, which she would like to take, [1].
Cough, with expectoration, [7].
Pain in the vertex, like a tingling, and pain beneath the right ribs from the (short) cough, [1].
Frequent itching, burning, and smarting in the canthi of the eyes, making him rub them (third day), [30].
Before and during hard stool, excessive contractive pain in rectum (after four days), [1].
Heat in the head, evenings (after three days), [1].

Roughness of both cheeks, heat and burning in them, and sensation as if they had been exposed for several days to a severe cold; this lasted several days, and was followed by a branlike desquamation, which also lasted several days (twenty-third day), [28c].
Severe itching in the nape of the neck, [1].
Sudden obstruction of both nostrils, in the morning, [1].
Cramplike pain in the left lower jaw and in the glans penis (first day), [18a].
Vertigo, with qualmishness to falling sideways, while walking in the open air, [1].
Stitches just beneath the pit of the stomach, during inspiration, [2].
The eyes feel heavy and the lids are inclined to close, [8].
Compression of the head, immediately after eating; every covering is oppressive, whether hat or cap, [1].
Stiffness in the left shoulder; she cannot raise the hand to the head (after thirteen days), [1].
He wakes at night with contraction and oppression of the chest; he had to breathe heavily and deeply for an hour, also on waking in the morning felt some contraction (after two days), [1].
The hair falls out a great deal; a bald place is formed (two hundred and forty-ninth day), [45b].
Voice like that of a person with a cold in the head, in the evening, [33].
Chest a little sore, [19].
Drawing pain first in one then in the other upper arm, [1].
Much pain when walking, on account of excoriation from the leucorrhœa, [1].
About 4.30 P.M., felt very hungry, and after eating a little felt satisfied, and the stomach felt full (second day), [35].
*Stitch in the head, [1].
Weak feeling in the rectum in the evening in bed, causing restlessness, so that he cannot sleep, [1].
Pressive headache; every step is painfully felt in the forehead, with perspiration on the forehead, [1].
Towards evening, headache, and shooting in the throat (first day), [26].

Slight soreness of the outer corner of the left upper eyelid; slight itching of the inner surface; at 5 P.M. (seventh day); increased soreness of the eyelid (eighth day); lid much swollen; eye half close; swelling beneath the lower lid; œdematous, looks as if stung by a bee; lid sore to touch and on closing the eye; slight itching of the inner surface, causing the eye to water (ninth day); eye somewhat better (twelfth day), [26].
*Violent pain in the vertex, in the evening, as if the hair would be torn out; it bristles on the most painful spots, [1].
A sharp piercing pain in the lower lobe of the right lung, coming on in paroxysms, and so severe as to almost make me cry out (third day), [42].

Sensation of bearing down in the pelvic region, with a slight dragging pain from the sacrum (fourth and fifth days); pelvic symptoms increase; more weight and bearing down; more pain extending into the loins and down the thighs in front, with constriction of the sphincter (sixth day); symptoms of the pelvic region last the longest (seventh day), [44].
The tip of the tongue feels scalded, [29].
Inflammation of the corns, [1].
Pain in the whole head on external pressure; for example, by a tight hat, [1].
Drawing pain in the occiput, touching it causes pain, as if from subcutaneous ulceration, [1].

Sudden and uncontrollable thirst, at 9 P.M., but water tastes insipid, unless very cold (fourth day); a very unusual thirst appeared, at 9 P.M.; I must have water (sixth day); a peculiar thirst, which lasted all the evening; water tastes natural if cold (ninth day); marked thirst, at 9 P.M. (tenth and following days), [20].
Collection of saliva in the mouth, sour and bitter, [1].
Painful blister on the tip of the tongue, above and below, [1].

At noon increased appetite (fifth day); at noon uncommon appetite, which, however, he did not satisfy, but left the table before he was satiated (sixth day); good (seventh day); increased rather than diminished, and he relished breakfast, dinner, and supper amazingly (eighth and ninth days); diminished (tenth day); dinner taken with considerable appetite (eleventh day); appetite much increased (thirteenth day); ate dinner with the best appetite (fourteenth day); uncommon hunger (twenty-third day), [35b].
Tingling in the feet (after four days), [1].

In bed every place appears too hard for his head, which, on account of this disagreeable feeling, he must keep moving hither and thither, without succeeding in finding a better position (twenty-ninth day), [18a].
Quick decay of the teeth, [1].
Shuddering with the pains, [1].

At night, in bed, there occurred deep in the right side of the forehead, in a circumscribed spot the size of a crown piece, a slight digging-shooting pain, which lasted a few minutes (first day), [25g].
Pressure and bruised pain in lower abdomen wakes her at night, for several nights, [1].
Swelling of the mucous membrane of the mouth and the internal portion of the gums, so that the mouth seems narrowed, [1].
At noon, while at dinner, sudden recurrence of coryza (fifth day); occasional attacks (sixth to tenth days), [39b].
Sensation of fulness of blood in the eyes, [1].
No stool since taking Sepia (third day); constipated (fourth day); constipation with urging to stool; no stool for three days (sixth day), [37].
Woke at 4.30 A.M., without apparent cause, and remained awake (second day), [21].
Bad odor from the mouth, in the morning on rising, [1].
Shooting pain, beginning in the cervix and passing up to the fundus uteri, and thence to the right ovary; pain is so severe that it causes nausea (thirty-fourth day), [21].
Vertigo, in the evening while standing, with rush of blood to the heart, [1].

Violent boring pain in a hollow tooth, always occurred in the evening and tormented him until late at night (fourth, fifth, and sixth days), [35]. [As he had no more toothache during the whole time of the proving, he was disposed to attribute it rather to wet weather, then prevailing, than to the Sulphur.]
Contractive feeling in the anus, passing off after fermentation in the bowels, [2].
Sweat very easily while walking in the open air, even against cold winds (twentieth day), [20].
Dryness of the mouth and scraping in the throat, as if food would not go down, [1].
Lancinating pains in the uterus, shooting upwards (fifth day), [20].
Drawing tearing toothache, now in the right, and now in the left side, for hours, and often with intermission for half an hour or an hour; also at night on waking, [1].
*Shooting pain in the temples, close to the eyes, on moving them or on looking at anything (third day), [31].
Sharp stitching pain passing up the vagina into the body of the uterus, somewhat relieved when bending double (eleventh day), [21].
Discharge of greenish-red fluid from the vagina, during pregnancy, [1].
After dinner, several fine stitches in the right concha (fifth day), [25a].
Great thirst for beer, [2].
Very severe pressure in the chest, when not touched, [1].

Before dinner, he observed on the inner side of the lower lip a vesicle, the size of a hemp-seed, filled with a dark blood, but it did not annoy him much, and after dinner was found to have disappeared without leaving a trace behind (second day), [25f].
At 11 A.M. slight pressive headache; the whole head is affected; this pain ceases in an hour; it returns in the evening over the right eye only (seventh day), [15].
Very much thirst during the day, [1], [2].
Call to stool; I felt as though I had lost all power of expulsion; only small hard lumps passed, which did not give relief, at 5 P.M. (after nine hours, second day), [21].
Tearing in the upper maxilla, [2].
Violent burning in the bladder, without desire to urinate, [1].
Cramp in the toes, recurring several days, [1].
Temperature 99 3/8, at noon (fifth day); 99 3/8, at noon (sixth day), [20].
Contracting pain in the rectum extending into the vagina (after six days), [1].
Hungry feeling in the stomach, very soon after meals (two hours), (third day), [40a].
*Dulness of the head, as from rush of blood, especially on ascending steps, [1].
Pressing sore pain in the lower cervical vertebræ, in the evening, while walking in the open air, [1].
The teeth become elongated, so that she can scarcely chew, [1].
Teeth sensitive to cold air (second day), [36].
Stitches and burning at the anus, [1].
While sitting quietly, a severe tearing pain in the left shoulder-joint, lasting but a few minutes, but there remained for a day or two a feeling as if the shoulder were wrenched (sixth day), [27].
Clammy taste in the mouth (one hundred and forty-second day), [45b].
Extreme nervous restlessness, [8].
Stitches in left hypochondrium, [11].
Unusual catarrhal condition after getting wet, violent feverish chilliness, after several hours attacks of fainting, for several days afterwards coryza, [1].
Yawning and stretching, [7a].
Pain in depressors of right side of jaw on voluntarily twitching those muscles (fourth and fifth days), [15].
Dull tired pain in the right shoulder and muscles of the back of the neck (second day), [36].
Pressure in front in the lower abdomen, right side, [2].
A painful tearing at a small spot in the brain, as if something tore loose, during a short spell of cough, [1].
At 3 P.M., the pain in my right side is nearer to the sacrum; it is a dull heavy ache, a pulling sensation (fifth day), [37].
Nightsweat from above downwards, to the middle of the calves, [1].
Drawing toothache, [1].
*Tensive pain in the head, [1].
On lying down, at 11 P.M., six sharp stitches in the left temple, three of which were very severe and painful, at short and equal intervals (seventh day), [38].
Agglutination of the eyelids, only in the evening, [1].
A few hours after having arisen quite well, felt so prostrated and indisposed, that he would rather go to sleep than attend to business, [1].
Shivering until going to bed, and heat of the face, in bed, [1].
Twitching of the upper lid, [1].
The posterior muscles of the thigh are very painful when sitting, [1].
*Lachrymation and burning, in the morning, [3].
Symptoms still return, especially marked about 12 to 1 P.M., and 4 to 6 P.M. (forty-second day), [38].
Food tastes bitter, [1].
Intermittent slight tearing, low down in the left side of occiput, near the neck, [1].
Tickling on the tip of the right great toe, [2].
Dry burning sensation in soles of feet, [9].
The ear always becomes stopped on blowing the nose, [1].
Have a cold, with few but sudden coughing spells; expectoration full and easy only in the morning, after breakfast (twentieth day), [20].
Vertigo and weakness, even to falling, in the morning on rising, [1].
Dryness in the nose, [1].

Nausea at intervals the whole day, also after a meal, with an afflux of watery saliva, bitterish sour taste in the mouth continually, without appetite, yet the food has a natural taste (after four days), [1].
Blister on the tongue and pain as if burned, [1].
Morning nausea, as if everything in the abdomen were turning around, [1].
Gloomy and dull feeling in the head, with whirling dizziness, for four days, [1].
Stitching pain at the tip of the nose when touching it, as if a pointed hair were pricking it, [1].
Sudden pressing headache about the right supraorbital arch, in the forenoon (eighth day), [45a].
Contractive pain in the rectum, and thence into the perinæum and vagina, [1].
It feels dull and heavy over the eyes and in the forehead (fifth day), [37].
Stretching out the neck and straining the cervical muscles distort the facial muscles (eleventh day), [1].
Much pain in the swollen gums of decayed teeth with swelling of the cheek, [1].
The feet go to sleep, frequently when sitting, especially in the morning, [1].
Burning sensation in the margin of the left lower eyelid, towards the outer canthus, [2].
Feeling of sand in right eye (first and second days), [74].
Much itching of the scalp (after sixteen days), [1].
Painful beating in the occiput, [1].
Aversion to sour and sweet things, [1].
Hard stool, fæces covered with slime, at 6 P.M., followed by slimy, bilious, or catarrhal stool, at 8 P.M., and again at 11 P.M. (second day), [23].
Coryza, for three successive days, [1].
All her teeth feel loose, [35].
Vexatious dreadful dreams, [1].

Itching in the right eye (second day); during the day prickling, itching, and smarting in the eyelids (third day); in the morning, after awaking, eyelids gummed together, and a feeling as if fine sand were in the eyes (fourth day), [36b].
Desire for but unable to pass a stool; intense constriction of the sphincter ani (after three hours, fourth day), [44a].
Nose obstructed at night, especially right nostril (twentieth day), [20].
Pressure on the chest, from stooping and deep breathing, [1].
He awakes at night with inclination to vomit, [1].
He is hungry, but as soon as he only sees food his appetite vanishes and he feels full in the abdomen; when he begins to eat, he is averse to it, [1].
Numb feeling in right tonsil (after four days), [1].
After dinner, aching in forehead and stomach (third day), [20].
Slight drawing in the lower incisors (two hundred and forty-third day), [45b].
Drawing pain in the right and left lower back molars, [2].
Tearing in the left maxillary articulation, just in front of the ear, [2].
Pain in the rectum during stool, and afterwards for a long time while sitting (after seven days), [1].
Uneasiness in the legs every evening, with cramp in them, [1].
Aching in the muscles of the abdomen and limbs, on waking (for ten weeks), [24].
Sore throat, with swelling of the cervical glands, [1].
Weakness of the head so that she can scarcely think, particularly in the afternoon, [1].
Pain in the back and in the sacrum, mostly between the lumbar region and the crista illi; more on the right side; a pulling or dragging; feeling strained when walking. -T. F. ALLEN.]
Shortness of breath when walking, [1].
Alternating heat in the head and chilliness in the lower limbs (after thirteen days), [1].
Staggering vertigo, every afternoon from 4 to 6 o'clock, when sitting and walking, [1].
Coryza about noon (second day), [43].
Uneasiness in the abdomen, [1].
At 7.15 P.M., several shoots in the second last healthy molar tooth on the right side (second day), [38d].
Tearing stitches in the thighs when walking, momentarily depriving the lower extremities of all power, and almost paralyzing them, accompanied with chilliness, [1].
Painful sensation of dryness in the nose, with violent coryza, [1].
Spasmodic stitching in the heel, as if the tendons were too short, evenings when undressing and extending the feet, [1].
Ringing in the ears recurring several times during the day (fourth day); occasional attack (sixth to tenth day), [39b].
Falls asleep late in the evening, [1].
Sleepy early in the evening, with pressive dulness of the head (after seventy-two hours), [1].
Vertigo, when moving the arms, [1].
Fetid odor of the (generally sweaty) feet, [1].
Heartburn forenoon and afternoon, for several hours, extending from the pit of the stomach to the throat, in which he has a sourish taste and a scraping sensation, [1].

Violent pains in the left eye, as if it were rubbed against spiculæ of glass, and drawn in towards the pupil. He was obliged to close the eye five or six times involuntarily. This was followed by burning in the eye and flow of tears. The attack lasted about two minutes (fifth day), [17a].
Constant dryness and contracted sensation in the throat, [1].
Dry cough, with vomiting of bitter fluid, even in bed, [1].
Beating in the region of the liver, [1].
Vinegary taste in the mouth immediately after drinking milk, [1].
Offensive odor of nasal mucus on blowing the nose, [1].
Digestion excites heat and palpitation of the heart (after three days), [1].
Drawing in the teeth as from a cupping glass, [1].
Disturbed sleep all night, from unpleasant dreams (third night), [42].
Sour taste in the mouth, in the morning after a good sleep, [3].
Tearing and jerks in the teeth, in the afternoon, at every fourth inspiration; worse when lying down, accompanied with profuse ptyalism, [1].
Something seems to have come before the left ear, so that though he hears everything, he cannot understand the human voice, [1].
Headache as from jolting, after the noonday sleep, [1].
Swelling of the upper lip, also, in the evening, with pain, [1].
Pressing in the pit of stomach (after thirty hours), [1].
Bleeding from the gums on the slightest touch, [9].
Shooting-smarting pains along the inner side of the left arm and leg, while sitting or at rest, at intervals during the day, worse in the evening, from 5 P.M. till late (eighth day), [38].
Pasty taste, in the morning, [1].
In two hours, dull aching in the whole right half of the brain (first day), [25f].
*Pressive headache (even in the morning after rising), mostly on the vertex, as if the eyes would be pressed down, [3].
Pressure in the left ankle-joint, as if the boot were too tight, [1].
Ringing in ears (sixteenth day), [34a].
Wings of the nose inflamed, swollen, [1].
Violent tearing in the lower right ribs, [2].
When falling asleep he was attacked with an internal trembling, and with itching in the thighs, going off after scratching, [1].
Coryza, with diarrhœic stool, [1].
Bleeding of the teeth, [1].
Profuse secretion on lower part of the glans of purulent fluid, having a sourish salt smell, with itching, [1].
In the afternoon, slight tearing pains in the left eyebrow (seventeenth day), [28c].
In the morning, shooting in the tip of the tongue (immediately, second day), [40].
Bitterish sour taste in the mouth (after five days), [1].
Violent fluent coryza (twenty-fourth day); severe fluent coryza, in the morning (twenty-ninth day); fluent coryza, towards noon (fortieth day); fluent coryza (forty-eighth day), [29].
Bitterness in the mouth, in the morning on waking, [1], [3].
Pains in tendons of right foot about the ankle, [1].
Burning in the abdomen, when walking in the open air, [1].
Stitches from within outward in the forehead every day, from 11 A.M. till evening, [1].
A persistent burning in the external canthus of the right eye, and at the same time a sensation as if a grain of sand was in it (after third dose), [38a].
Weakness and dulness of the head during dinner, lasting till evening, [1].
Swelling of the feet, they burn and are very dry, [11].
Appetite uncommonly good (fifteenth day), [43].

During the whole time of the proving I had little appetite; I ate more from habit than necessity; sometimes, in fact, I had a positive dislike to food, especially to supper, so that I ate nothing, [44d].
Much sweat and exhaustion, while walking, [1].
She awakes several mornings at 4 o'clock, [1].
Headache, as if beaten and torn, on coughing, [1].
Twisting pain in right knee, and a kind of drawing pain on inside of same thigh, above the knee, [9].
In the evening, severe cold in the head with headache (twentieth and twenty-first days), [34].
Sour eructations (ninth day), [38].
Digging in the forehead, at night, [1].
Great weariness in bed, with early waking, yet cannot sleep again, [1].
*Dizziness, unsteadiness of the head and body, in the morning, lasting three hours, as if one stood upon wavering ground (third day)
Pain superiorly on the vertex on chewing, coughing, and blowing the nose, [1].
Eructation of wind alone after supper, [1].
In the morning, on awaking, tension of the skin surrounding the mouth (third day); dryness and tension of the outer skin round about the lips, and branlike desquamation of it (tenth day), [29a].
Pointed pimples on the calves, extending up to the knees; they itch, and where the clothes touch, cause a sticking, [1].
He awakes at night with violent anxiety and spasms in the abdomen, then in the mouth, the chest, and hip-joints, with palpitation of heart, [1].
A long-continued pain under the right shoulder (fifth day), [38].
Very warm and oppressed, evenings, [1].
*In the morning, aching pain in the forehead (fourteenth day); slight aching in the forehead (twenty-fourth and following days), [22].
Boring pain in the point of the left testicle, following the pain in the chest (sixteenth day), [34].
Contraction of the chest, in the morning on awaking, [1].
Pressive headache above the left eye, in the afternoon, [1].
Disagreeable odor of the sweat, almost like elder blossoms, [1].
Bruised pain in the thighs, when touching them, with tension therein when walking, [1].
During the menses everything gets black and clouded before the eyes, in the evening, accompanied by great weakness, which passes off when lying, [1].
Pressure in the right nasal bone, in the evening, [1].
Inflammation of the eyelids, with a stye thereon, [1].
Cutting in the upper lip, as from a splinter, [1].
Great protrusion of hæmorrhoids during stool, [1].
Itching on the occiput making him scratch (eighty-sixth day), [45b].
A small ulcer in one nostril, lasting a long time, [1].
A slight headache, the pains running down the back of the head (third day), [22].
Burning in the point of the tongue (soon), [29].
Short sharp stitches in the right chest (after four hours), [2].
Chilly sensation, with nausea, at 11 A.M. (thirty-sixth day); less severe (thirty-seventh day), [21].
Small red pimple on the forehead, roughness of the forehead (first to sixth day), [1].
Dry cough after a meal, [1].

It seems to me that I have taken cold by the sensation, although I have not exposed myself; head troubles me very much; the anterior and posterior nares and the pharynx seem as though they had been skinned; these feelings are mostly confined to the right side; head feels dull and heavy, and there is a thick yellow mucous discharge from the right side, and on putting the finger into the nose, it becomes bloody; the sensation is the same that I once had after snuffing persulphate of iron into the nose, a kind of excoriated sensation (third day), [37].
In the evening, twitching in the eyelids (second day), [20].
Tearing in the head outward at the ear, [1].
In the morning, after getting up, aching and heavy feeling in the occiput, extending into the nape; headache went off in the course of the day (forty-seventh day), [45b].

Bloated feeling of the abdomen coming on about fifteen minutes after eating, and lasting half an hour, at 8 P.M. (fifth day); constant feeling of distension, coming on shortly after eating, especially supper; this symptom was noticed throughout the proving, [26].
Some pain in lower limbs, most in thighs (ninth day), [44a].
Severe pressure in the chest, evening in bed, [1].
Easily strained when at work, and consequent stiffness and tense feeling in nape of neck, [1].
Short breath (immediately), [1].
Cramp in the abdomen (after seventeen days), [1].
Diarrhœa after partaking of milk, [1].
Frequent eructations, [7a].
Collection of water in the mouth, at 9.30 A.M. (third day), [45].
Nausea before each liquid stool (after five days), [1].
Obstruction of the nose, for seven days (after eight days), [1].
In the evening, violent pains in the occiput (fourth and fifth days), [36d].

Since the thirty-second day I have had a vesicular eruption on the scalp, chest, back of the shoulders, and also on the calves of the legs, and on the knee-joints; a few of the vesicles became pustules, and when squeezed yielded a tough sticky matter; but pressure was painful and made them look angry; those on the scalp itched; brushing the hair was agreeable, but combing or scratching made the pustules sore; the brush brings off more scales than usual; the skin of the nose is also peeling (forty-fourth day), [38].
Pain in the left side of the head this afternoon, over the left eye, worse in the evening; it kept me awake a long time after I went to bed (fourth day), [35].
Moving the head from side to side causes a feeling as if the brain mass inside the cranium were moving (fourth day), [38].
Restless all night, tossing and turning (seventeenth night), [20].
Nosebleed, for seven days (after eleven days), [1].
Stitches in the hypogastrium, [1].
Burning in the penis during coition (after ten days), [1].
Pressive headache in the house, with tightness of the scalp, relieved by uncovering the head, [1].
Dull pain over the right eye and in the right temple (third day), [37].
Many dull stitches in the anus in succession, [2].
Aching on the right side of the vertex, with rigor (first day), [18].
Pressure in the throat, even when it is dressed very loosely, [1].
Swelling of the upper lid, with redness and burning pain, [1].
Eructations, tasting like rotten eggs, [1].
Profuse perspiration after coughing, [9].
Tensive pressure on the chest, more on left side, [1].
Tearing in the lower part of the right foot (after eleven hours), [1].
On blowing my nose I have a dizzy sensation (third day), [37].
Dragging feeling in the eyes (fifteenth day), [20].
Burning of the eyes, with redness of the outer canthi and discharge of corrosive tears, [3].
He blows strings of blood from the nose, [1].
Drawing tearing from below upwards in the upper and lower limbs, the whole day, but only when at rest, with great weakness, [1].
A kind of cramp in the nose, [1].
Nausea almost immediately, followed by drawing in the limbs, [1].
Awaking at night with anxious warmth, [1].
The breath has a bad odor, when coughing, [1].
Sensation of nausea and anxiety, when exerting the eyes, [1].
Pimply eruption in the centre of the vermilion border of the upper lip (fourth day), [1].
Very much affected, as if he had been hungry a long time, an hour after dinner, [1].

A sharp pain under the ensiform cartilage, as if a nerve were made tense, in a spot that could be covered by the end of the finger, worse from inspiring and going upstairs (after eight hours); the pain has entirely disappeared (fourth day), [39a].
Sweat of the lower limbs during the day, so profuse that it penetrates two thickness of clothing, [4].
Stitches in the right side of chest and scapula, during inspiration and cough, [1].
Pain in the front teeth, at night, [1].
Dull headache every morning, yet only after rising from bed, [1].
Stitches in the temples, [1].
The hair of the head is painful on scratching, [1].
Sick and feverish all day, with thirst, [9].
Burning of the eyes, without redness, [1].
Simple pain in the liver when riding over rough roads, just under the last ribs, obstructing breathing, [1].
Entire loss of appetite, but constant thirst, [1].
Drawing pressure in the region of the liver, in the evening, [2].
Mouth very slimy, in the morning, [1].
Stitches from the navel to the pudendum, when coughing and gagging, [1].
Face flushed (after five hours and a half), [33]; (second day), [35].
She could not lie quiet at night, on account of great restlessness in the whole body; she had to turn continually from side to side, and dared not close the eyes, as it then became worse, [1].
Sprained pain in the shoulder-joint, when resting the arm while sitting (third day), [1].
The eyelids pain on awaking as if too heavy, and as if he could not hold them open, [1].
Drawing in the left ear, with eructations from the stomach, [1].
Symptoms of a catarrhal fever, with weakness in the lower extremities and drawing in the arms, [1].
Stitches in and above the forehead, [1].
Leucorrhœa, especially profuse, after urinating, [1].
Itching on the scalp (two hundred and forty-third day), [45b].
A dull headache all day (twentieth day); headache (twenty-first day), [22].
She became tired and had to lie down, in the forenoon (after two hours), [1].
Crackling before the ears, as from the rattling of papers, [1].
Urine had a strong odor, but no sediment (sixth day), [21].
Tearing pain in the forepart of the urethra, [2].
Dry short evening cough, with intermittent stitches in the right hypochondrium for several hours, [1].
Throat feels as if it had been skinned (fifth and sixth days), [37].
Painful pressure in the place of a hernia, during violent laughter, [1].
Disagreeable creeping and tension in the scalp (two hundred and forty-third day), [44b].
A sensation of prickling in both eyelids, causing him to scratch and rub them, [36c].
Vertigo, obliging to steady one's self after a meal, [1].
Sudden drawing above the right eyebrow (after two hours, third day), [25f].
Visible but painless jerking in one buttock and corresponding thigh (after eight days), [1].
Quick pulse (100 to 110), at 3 P.M. (second day), [35].
Stitches as with a knife in the right eye, [1].
Stitches in the pit of stomach, [1].

In the morning, after awaking, pain in the left side of the forehead, which lasted till noon (eleventh day); pain in the left frontal region, in the morning (two hundred and twenty-ninth day); in the night, awakened by a rather severe but transient pain in the left frontal region (two hundred and forty-first day); woke, in the morning, with violent pains in the left frontal region, which lasted till he got up (two hundred and fifty-eighth day), [45b].
Pain in the right side of the chest, especially on stooping and lying on the right side, [7].
Burning in the anus during stool (after twenty-one days), [1].
Itching and itching pimples on the joints, particularly on the bends of the elbows, popliteal space, and ankles, worse evening and morning than during the day (after a few hours), [1].
Awoke with a dull heavy feeling in the back of the head, extending down the spine, which passed off about an hour after rising (nineteenth day), [22].
A deathly paleness of the face, [18].
