About noon, burning in the right cheek, as if some drops of hot fluid were thrown against it, lasting four or five minutes; this recurred twice (fourth day), [39].
Eyes feel pulled downward (nineteenth day), [20].
A strange feeling in my head, as if just on the point of falling asleep (second day), [20].

With the burning heat in the throat, fulness and pressure in the head; this gradually increased into a severe frontal headache, more severe over the left orbit (second day); increased (third day); continued four or five days, [32].
Every noise distresses him, [1].
Menses eight days too late (the after effect), (after twenty-eight days), [1].

Abdomen hard and distended, as if with wind (after eight hours and a half); hard and distended on rising and tender to touch (second day); hardness and tension of the whole abdomen, with flatus (after eight hours, fourth day); distension and hardness (eighth day), [44a].

Bowels moved three times (thirty-first day); natural stool (thirty-second day); no stool (thirty-third day); bowels moved twice (thirty-eighth day); painful urging to stool, which was hard and in lumps, and considerable bleeding from the rectum after stool, at 6 A.M.; bowels moved freely and without pain, at 7 P.M.; moved quite freely at 10 P.M. (forty-fifth day); two stools (fifty-third day); one stool (fifty-fourth day); at 6.30 A.M. and 8 A.M. (sixty-second day); three stools (sixty-eighth day); two stools (eightieth day), [21].
*A spot on the vertex is painful to touch, [1].
Jerking pain above the right eye, [1].
Sore throat, with difficulty of swallowing, [10].
Dryness of the throat the whole day, [1].
Nausea, mornings only, passing off after eating something, [1].
Drawing and pressure in pit of stomach, at night (after twelve hours), [1].
He wants to eat continually, and if he only thinks of eating the water collects in his mouth, [1].
Coryza (after fourteen days), [1].
After 11 A.M., frequent attacks of a dull headache, deep in the left side of the forehead when at rest and when moving, which sometimes increased to a drawing-throbbing pain (first day), [25b].
Slight sensitiveness in the right ear, judging by the feeling in the cavity of the tympanum (one hundred and thirty-second day), [45b].
Arthritic drawing in the knee and finger-joints, [1].
Icy coldness in the stomach, with rumbling, [7a].
Severe painful jerking in the forehead, [1].
Fulness in the chest and contraction, which interferes with her breathing, [1].
The mere thought of eating causes nausea, yet with natural taste in mouth, [1].
Eyes hot and dry (fourth and twelfth days), [21].
Contractive pain in the anus and then forwards and upwards into the abdomen, during stool, [1].
Pain constantly between the shoulders and down the back (after second day), [23].
Pressure in the throat, as if he were choked with something which would not go down, [1].

Whirling and staggering, while sitting, after drinking a harmless drink, so that he thinks he will have an apoplectic stroke; this lasted five minutes; afterwards, flush of heat lasting five minutes, [1].
At noon, disgust at meat (fourteenth day), [34a].
Great dryness of the vulva and vagina, causing a very disagreeable sensation when walking, after the cessation of the menses (eleventh day), [21].
Headache in the forehead and vertex, followed by anxiety in the pit of the stomach, with trembling, afterwards violent nosebleed, [1].
Transient dull pain in the forearm (right side), (second day), [36].

Sudden severe pain in the back when stooping, like a blow from a hammer, accompanied by a stitching-tearing pain, so severe that he felt as if he would sink together and lose his breath; pressing the back on a hard substance relieved the pain, [1].
Rattling on the chest until the expectoration is coughed up, [1].
Discharge of prostatic fluid, after micturition, [1].
Tension and drawing in the left shoulder-joint, passing off when moving it, [2].
Noise like boiling water out at both ears, and frequent painful drawing in the right ear (first day), [25b].

The front teeth seem too long, with sensitiveness when pressed upon and in the open air, when there is a jerking pain and tearing extending up into the left temple where also it is painful to pressure, [3].
Rheumatic pressure draws through the teeth and forehead in single jerks, [2].
Free loose discharge from the bowels, after the cutting pain in the hypogastric region; previously the bowels had been regular (fifth day), [27].
With the dull headache drooping of the eyelids; I feel as though I had not sense enough left to lift them (third day), [21].
Heat in the left eye, in the morning, with swelling of the inner canthus, [1].
Menses eight days too early, too scanty, appearing only in the morning, [1].
Both ears feel as if plugged up; am somewhat deaf; obliged to ask that a question be repeated (seventh day), [37].
Pulsating throbbing felt externally on the head, [1].
Swashing, as from water in the ears, with excessive sensitiveness of hearing (to the crack of a whip), [1].
Remained languid for five days (after three days), [23].
Painful tickling under the right thumb nail, [2].
After coition discharge of blood from the vagina, [1].
Short violent tearing from the forehead down beside the right ala of the nose, [2].

In the morning, on waking, headache, having its seat above the forehead in the hairy scalp, where it occupied a space the size of the palm of the hand; it was of an aching pressive character, when off when he rose up, but did not go off till far on in the forenoon (sixty-first day), [45a].
Profuse sweat just over the anus, before and during stool, [1].
Dry tickling cough, with a kind of spasm of chest, both passing off by morning, [1].
Vertigo and nausea, so that everything turned about with her, at night during perspiration, lasting till morning, [1].
Itching on the head, with impatience, [1].
Itching in eyelids and burning in eyes (twelfth day), [34a].
Dry coryza, with prickling headache in the forehead and eyes, constant irritation to cough, and much dry cough during sleep without waking, [1].
Tearing drawing from the outer side of the left hand through the forearm up to the elbow, [2].
Griping in the abdomen almost every morning, for one hour, with nausea, qualmishness, and accumulation of saliva in the mouth, [1].
Pulling and drawing in the top of the shoulder, when at rest, [1].
Glandular swelling on the lower jaw, [1].

In the morning after awaking, tongue thickly furred (fourth and fifth days); in the morning on awaking, dryness and burning of the tongue, which was covered with a dirty whitish-yellow fur (tenth day), [29a].
Waving and confusion in the head returns, in the evening
Cough, day and night, pain therefrom in the pit of the stomach, [1].
Small white blisters inside of the cheeks, [29].
The mammæ have felt sore, like boils, if touched, all day (third day), [21].
Burning in the abdomen while sitting, passing off while walking, [1].
Roaring and singing in the left ear much diminished), (sixth day), [40].
Dislike to the usual glass of beer, in the evening (seventeenth day), [40].
Loud noises in the ears, with the distension of the head (after one hour), [51].
In the afternoon and evening, aching pain in the right ear, in the external meatus, towards the membrane of the tympanum (twenty-eighth day), [45b].
Very frequent eructations (after twenty-four hours), [1].
The teeth pain as if too long, and there is a tingling in them, like a vibration, [1].
Discharge of a few drops of blood from the vagina, fifteen days before the time of menses (after eight days), [1].
Hiccough during the habitual smoking, with contraction of the throat, and sensation as if a plug were in it, producing nausea and accumulation of water in the mouth, [1].
*Pressive headache, especially in the forehead, going off in the course of the day (fourth day), [24].
At noon, good appetite and much thirst (first day); great appetite (second day), [42].
Violent continued cutting, soon also stitching in the urethra, [1].
Great hunger, in the evening, [1].
In the evening, watery colorless mucus from the nose, [33].
Stitches in the left side of the hypogastrium, in the morning, [1].
Itching on the occiput, [1].
Smarting in the rectum after stool, [1].
Drawing and tearing in the teeth, mostly aggravated by cold water, at times relieved by warmth; often with jerking in the tips, [3].
Eruption in the corner of the mouth, with pain from touch, [1].
Pressure in both orbits, [1].
Bilious vomiting, two mornings (after three days), [1].
Pain in the head once every minute, a stitching pain in the head coming up the back at every step, [1].
Lascivious dreams disturb the sleep (fourteenth night), [1].
In the evening, after walking in the cold wind, I had a sore, rough, burning feeling in my eyes, aggravated by gaslight and on attempting to read (second day), [30].
Pressure on the lower part of the right eyeball, [2].
Pulse 70, at 10 P.M. (second day); 85 (third day); 88, in the morning; 86, at 8 P.M. (fourth day), [21].
Face much heated, in the evening, with heat in the head, [1].
Painfulness of the whole back, when sitting bent over while writing, [5].
Profuse nosebleed, several times (after second day), [28].
Pressure on the bladder, in the morning, and urging to urinate, urine passing only after waiting several minutes, [1].

About 5 P.M., while walking in the street, a sudden dizziness and feeling like a drunken person, as though the walk were rising; this lasted a minute or two (eighth day); two slight dizzy turns during the afternoon (twenty-second day), [22].
Itching in the left ear, [3].
Flushes then chills, [9].
Throbbing of the carotids (twenty-second day), [20].
After stool much thirst (second day), [18d].
Severe pains over the eye, alternating from one to the other (second day), [28].
Drawing in the teeth of the left upper jaw, the gums of which pain, as if ulcerated (third day), [18].
Prolapsus recti (after thirty days), (Rl.).
Biting, as from blisters, on the tongue, [1].
Pimple near the nose resembling a blood blister, [1].
The chilliness is felt in evening only, for five days (third day after last dose), [16].
Severe throbbing headache in the temples, [1].
Pain in the ears, in the evening, like otalgia (after sixteen days), [1].
Tingling in the upper incisors, [3].
Exhausting diarrhœa, with diarrhœa-like feel in the abdomen, [13].
Single stitches, at times through the head, [1].
Sleep at night light, with vivid dreams of the events of the previous day, [1].

Itching of the inner canthi, in the morning after awaking; after rubbing, there set in smarting and much lachrymation, and then sore feeling in the outer canthi, which were also somewhat agglutinated, [2].
Stoppage of the right nostril (thirteenth day), [21].
Pains appear on the left side, at 5 P.M. (sixth day), [38].
In the evening troublesome feeling of heat in the eyes (thirty-second day), [18a].

Feet very tender all day; can hardly bear my stockings to touch my feet; after walking awhile they feel better (thirty-first day); corns on toes very sore, and toes very much inflamed and sensitive to touch (thirty-second and thirty-third days); corns very painful (forty-seventh and forty-eighth days), [21].
Hiccough after supper, [1].
Cough, in the evening, before going to sleep, from 8 to 9 o'clock, continually, until she expectorates, then the cough stops, [1].
Nausea several mornings before breakfast, [1].
Dryness of the mouth, and taste of blood, [1].
Boring pain over the left eye, [51].
Pressure in the upper left chest, toward the axilla, mostly during a strong expiration; when touching the part, pains as if bruised, [2].
Painful crawling and gnawing in the left external meatus, [3].
Wearisome sleep (after fifteen days), [1].
Taste of manure in the mouth (after five days), [1].
Headache in the occiput from noon on, a stupefying tingling in it on stepping; she was obliged to sit very quietly for four hours, [1].
Pain near the head of the humerus, at the tendons of the pectoral muscles, bending the arm backwards and from touch, [1].
Upper lip sensitive to touch (second, eighth, and eleventh days), [45]; (sixty-eighth day), [45a].

Some yellowish leucorrhœal discharge, with the bearing down in pelvic organs, in the morning; slightly, bloody and increased in quantity, at 10 A.M.; more profuse, yellowish, creamy, or slightly bloody, at 9 P.M. (ninth day); (none in the morning); slightly yellow and somewhat bloody, offensive slightly, in the evening (tenth day); glairy, amber-colored, slightly offensive, occasionally bloody (eleventh day); sanguineous, in gushes, but not profuse (thirteenth day), [44a].
When awaking, in the morning, overheated, [1].
Great heat, one day, right around lower ribs, with fever, but a moist sweat around body, [19].
He awakes in the morning, at 3 o'clock, and cannot fall asleep again, [1].
Dimness of the vision when writing, so that he could scarcely distinguish anything clearly, [1].
Urine with much white sediment and fetid, [1].
Disposition to sleep (first and following days), [22].
Sensitiveness and burning in the eyes, for several days, [48].
Feeling of prostration (after one hour, second and third days), [42].
Violent stitches in the chest with every inspiration; he dared only to take a short breath; from this the head became affected (after five days), [1].
Smarting sore pain on the inner side of the lids, after midnight, followed by a sensation of a rubbing dryness upon the inner surfaces, [1].

All day long an almost constant desire to blow the nose, though no mucus was present in its front part. The mucus remains sticking in the nasal passage; it is uncommonly viscid, and it is only after great exertion, in the way of blowing, that it comes away in the form of long narrow pieces, which interrupt the free passage of air through the nostrils (twenty-seventh day), [21].
Swelling on the forehead (after four and fifteen days), [1].
Fluent coryza of burning water, [9].
Drawing in the gums over the two upper front teeth, [2].
Beating, very painful headache in the vertex, in the morning soon after rising (after six days), [1].
Obstruction of the nose, indurated mucus comes therefrom, [1].
Doughy taste in the mouth, [1].
The urine deposits blood in the vessel, [1].
Outward pressure in the ears, while straining at stool (after three days), [1].
In the afternoon, itching, burning, and redness of the edges of the lids, and of the skin on the outside of the nose (twenty-fourth day), [29].
Swelling of the gums with sore pain, [1].
The left nostril is frequently too dry, feels swollen, yet without coryza, [1].
Itching in the ear, immediately followed by itching heat in the outer ear, [1].
Headache above the eyes and nausea after eating, followed by heaviness of the head, [1].
9.30 A.M., a slight but decided tingling in the urethra, for about an inch back from the head of the penis (fourth day), [40].
Expectoration from the chest, without much cough and without dyspnœa, [1].

Aching in the vertex, increased in the open air, where it became very teasing, towards noon; after dinner, increased to the feeling as if a heavy weight lay on it; this pain lasted all day in a minor degree, and did not go off till evening (eighteenth day), [45].
Violent drawing in the right side just above the hips, extending up to the ribs and towards the kidneys, relieved after the emission of flatus, [7a].
Hoarseness, he cannot speak a loud word, [1].
Pain darting along the wrist and dorsum of right hand to between first and second fingers; soon a similar pain on corresponding part of the palm of the hand (thirty-second day), [38].
Fine sticking pains occasionally in left lower jaw and the glands underneath, particularly when touched, [1].

At 6 P.M., suffering with a pain or great weakness in the small of my back (fourth day); pain not so severe (sixth day); back still aches and causes nausea, and a faint feeling while standing (seventh day); back still uncomfortable (eighth day), [37]. [The prover explains the backache:
Violent coryza, with rawness in the chest, and cough, with much expectoration, [1].
Profuse yellow discharge from the nose (fourth day), [37].
Convulsive shooting in the tip of the tongue (twenty-first day), [40].
Sharp stitching pain on inner side of left foot and underneath the toes after going to bed (thirtieth day), [38].
Paralytic tension in the right thigh and hip-joint when walking, [1].

In the evening, he perceived on the inside of the upper lip, near the right commissure of the mouth, a small painless elevation, which in a few days changed into a small pedunculated wart, with three free apices (twenty-eighth day). It still remained months after the termination of the proving, [28d].
Burning jerking in the right eyelid, [1].
Frontal headache and pain in the temples returned daily, more marked, morning, noon, and evening (twelfth to twenty-third day), [38].
Stitches in the left temple, [1].
One day, three sudden shoots down right thigh into toes, each time making him lift up the foot and shout, [19].
Feeling of heaviness in the chest, necessitating deep breathing, [1].
After two hard stools, great weakness in the abdomen and entire loss of appetite, [1].
Accumulation of flatus, [7a].
Loss of appetite; nothing is relished, [1].
Going out in the morning into the open cold air produced great discharge of tears from the right eye, painless; seated for awhile in a warm room this ceased (second day), [38].
Anxious dreams of being threatened with rape (after two days), [1].
Crawling sensation in the face, [1].
Ebullition in the left side, like a bubbling, [1].

Much purulent expectoration, with severe cough, with great oppression of the chest and rattling in throat; the slightest motion takes away her breath, and she becomes quite exhausted (after twenty-three days), [4].
Profuse falling of the hair, [1].

Pain in the centre of the abdomen, from afternoon till bedtime; it seemed as if a lump were lying there; the pain extended upward toward evening, accompanied by sleepiness, yet she was not able to sleep at night, [1].
During the forenoon, aching and drawing pains in the occiput (twenty-eighth day), [40].
Fearful attacks of toothache; all the top row feel as if being drawn, [58].
Slight swelling of the right parotid gland, in the evening (third day), [37].
Violent burning in the upper lip just under the nose, [1].

Feeling as if she had taken cold, with soreness and burning in the nostrils and aching in the alæ nasi; the right nostril feels stuffed, yet there is a slight watery discharge, in the evening; nose symptoms abating after going to bed (first day); nose burning and painful, especially at the root of the nose (after two hours); the whole feeling is one of a severe cold in the head (after five hours, second day), [44].
Cough, awaking at night, [1].
An increase of strength, [41].
Burning in the stomach, after eructations, [2].
Slight pain in the region of the transverse colon, and the bowels moved (after twelve hours); still have pain in region of transverse colon (second day), [24].
I am not drowsy this time, as I usually am, during the menses), (eighteenth day), [20].
Gray and yellowish expectoration from cough, [1].
Uneasiness in the whole body (after twenty-four hours), [1].
Diarrhœa after partaking of boiled milk, [1].
Chest is quite raw, owing to much cough and expectoration, [1].
Inclination to sleep, particularly in the forenoon; she must sleep for an hour, [1].

Headache comes on with the heat and gets better with it, but never quite goes; it is as if the occiput were opening and shutting; better by cold water or in open air; worse by bending head down, [16].
Weary pain in left shoulder-joint, [8].
Bruised pain in the tibiæ, [1].
Flying shoots in the left temple, in the afternoon (twenty-eighth day), [40].
At 8 A.M., pressive pain on both sides of the sagittal suture (sixth day), [25].
Severe pressure in forehead over right eye, [11].

Average quantity of urine, 6 ounces five times in twenty-four hours; normal color; no sediment; sp. gr. 1020 (forty-first day before the proving); 1030 (fortieth, thirty-ninth, and thirty-eighth days); A.M., 1022; P.M., 1028 (thirty-seventh day); A.M., 1020; P.M., 1030 (thirty-sixth day); A.M., 1022; P.M., 1020 (thirty-fifth day); P.M., 1030 (thirty-fourth, thirty-third, and thirty-second days); P.M., 1028 (thirty-first day); A.M., 1022; P.M., 1029 (thirtieth day before the proving); sp. gr. 1030; dark red, less quantity, passed only three times (third day); A.M., sp. gr. 1030; P.M., 1030; three times, 6 ounces each times; a yellowish-red deposit adheres to vessel; urine brick-red in color (fourth day); A.M. and P.M., sp. gr. 1030; very scanty, deep red; no desire to urinate; pass but little at a time (fifth day); A.M., sp. gr. 1030; P.M., 1025; as on fifth day (sixth day); P.M., sp. gr. 1025; very scanty; red deposit on side of glass (seventh day); A.M., sp. gr. 1022; noon, 1030; urine very high-colored; it looks like powdered brick (eighth day); the urine remains dark red until the twenty-third day, [37].
*Dulness of the head, in the morning, and pressure in the forehead till noon, [1].
Great lachrymation and coryza, [56].
She feels the pulse beating through the body, particularly in the whole left chest, [1].
With icy-cold hands, warm feet, or vice versâ, frequently, however, both cold at once, [2].
Flow of water in the mouth coming from the stomach, disappearing after eating, [3].
*Vertigo on stooping, [1].
Sensation of heat in the eyes, [1].
Dull pressing pain on a small spot in the occiput, [2].
Have not the bad taste in the morning which is customary during the menses), (nineteenth day), [20].
Pain in the tongue as if burned, for five days, [1].
Tensive pain of the metacarpal joints of the fingers, particularly during flexion, [1].
Burning-contracting cramps of stomach, from a cold, [1].

Pustules on the conjunctiva of the left eye; no pain, but I noticed a mist gathering before my eyes, and in this mist seemed to float black objects looking like tadpoles, with their heads pointing to the centre and their tails radiating, at 7 A.M.; much better, at 11 A.M.; much worse than this morning; the mist causes nausea, at 2 P.M. (fifty-eighth day). Same as yesterday morning, at 7 A.M.; same as yesterday, at 11 A.M.; aggravated as yesterday at this hour, but more painful, at 2 P.M. (fifty-ninth day). Eyes better (sixtieth day). Eyes all right (sixty-first day). Again affected (sixty-fifth day), [21].
Feeling as if the upper lip were swelled (first day), [45].
Pimples on the right cheek, [1].
Distension of the abdomen (after first hours), [1].
Bruised aching pain in the sockets of the shoulders, extending to the elbows; it was intermittent, and generally in only one arm at a time, [8].
General profuse sweat, after dinner, with sensation of heat, [1].
Leucorrhœa, like milk, only during the day, with burning pain and excoriation between the thighs, [1].
Painful feelings, as from a stiff body or a plug, in both sides of the abdomen, which renders stooping painful or impossible, [1].
Bitter eructations, with nausea, [1].
Cramping drawing in the right shoulder and in the whole right side, [1].
Tensive-stitching pain around the hypochondria, impeding every motion, worse when walking, [1].
Constant sweetish taste in the mouth, as from fasting, with frequent hawking up of mucus, [1].
Dryness of the red of the lower lip, with scabs and tensive pain, [1].
Frequent gripings in the abdomen, without flatulence, [1].
Swelling and some redness of the right upper eyelid, in the morning, [2].
Dizziness, like a tingling and buzzing out at the forehead, if she walks rapidly, or moves the head suddenly, [1].
Itching on the eyelids, [1].
Blood-streaked expectoration after a meal, [1].
Inclination to vomit, anxiety, and vertigo, [1].
Small induration at the root of the nose, without pain, [1].
Great dryness of the palate, with much thirst; she is obliged to drink much, [1].

Although he ate a very good dinner, yet in the afternoon, contrary to habit, he became so very hungry that he had to eat again; notwithstanding this, he was again ready for supper (forty-seventh day), [45a].
Tearing, drawing, and stitching from the forehead and the occiput, toward the vertex, [1].
General improvement, [43].
Shooting pain from the lumbar region to the left lung (seventh day), [20].
Violent stitches in the region of the liver, in the evening, for eight minutes, painful also from touch, with constipation, [1].
Arthritic drawing in the finger-joints, [1].

On the right anterior border of the tongue, a hard raised spot the size of a lentil; on moving the tongue, shooting pain in it (eighth day); the swelling and pains in the tongue were greatly diminished, and the following day were quite gone (ninth day), [26].
Vertigo, so that when looking up while walking, he stumbles, [1].
Sweat over the whole body, in the morning, after awaking, [1].
Dry feeling in the nose and fauces, [1].

Abdomen very much distended after the least bit of food; felt some relief from loosening the clothes, but the distension soon returned, causing more distress than before, as it seemed to give the abdomen more room to expand (third day). Abdomen tympanitic, at 4 P.M. (fifth day). At 10 P.M., abdomen very much distended; since dinner, at 6 P.M. (seventh day). Bloated abdomen after eating the least bit of food; discharge of flatus does not relieve it (fourteenth to sixteenth day), [21].
With every movement of the body, nausea, as if to vomit, and such weakness that he had to lie immediately on the ground; in the open air all the limbs felt relaxed, [1].
Pressure in the abdomen, [1].
The scalp pains when touched, as if the roots of the hair were sore (after three days), [1].
In the forenoon, frequent alternation of headache (at one time in the forehead, at another in the occiput), and the previous (gouty) pains in the joints, but only when at rest (fifth day), [25g].

Suddenly struck with a severe sore pain in right side of head (sixth day); it then gradually went round to the left side, till at last of the whole head became like a soft bladder, intensely hot, and covered with wheals, large oblong blotches all over; the pain was so severe, and the head so sore, that he dared not touch it; indeed, he could not lie on the softest pillow; it then went round to occiput, most painful; on eighth night was nearly raving; could not sleep, moaning and tossing about, longing for death, loathing life, could have killed himself without compunction; the last severe attack was in the cerebellum; the organ of amativeness seemed to swell out like two eggs, throbbing and intensely sore; the lumps felt quite soft and puffy, similar to the wheals on forehead, [19].
Water trickles from the nose, [1].
About 8 P.M., great flow of sweetish saliva into the mouth (forty-eighth day), [29].
After a thin stool, smarting sensation in the abdomen, [1].
*Vertigo, in the forenoon (first day), [25e]; (thirty-second day), [43b].
*Redness of the eyes during the day; violent itching in them in the evening, [1].

Nightly headache; an intolerable, constantly increasing pressure in the lower portion of the occiput and in the vertex, with pressure on the eyes, which he must close, and with chilliness, not relieved by any covering, with profuse offensive perspiration, during which he must walk up and down the room (after five days), [1].
Extremely sleepy at noon, afternoon wakeful again, [1].

Dryness of the nose, burning on the outer borders of the alæ nasi, which are very sensitive to touch, in the evening (fifth day); dry feeling and troublesome tension in the nose, in the forenoon (fourteenth day); troublesome dryness in the nasal cavity (sixteenth day); in the nose sometimes dry feeling, and sometimes a discharge of watery fluid from it (seventeenth day); dry feeling in the nose, towards noon (eighteenth day), [45].
Tired feeling all over, which lasted all day (first and third days), [42].
In the morning, after awaking, painful rubbing dry feeling in the borders of the right eyelids (fourth day), [25f].
Aching at back of right eye for half an hour (after some days), [16].
Lentil-sized brown spots on the elbows, surrounded with an herpetic-looking skin, [1].
Stitching-tensive pain in the hypochondria and pit of the stomach, during movement when stooping, [1].
Pressing sore pain in the shoulders, as if excoriated, [1].
Movements of the scalp forwards and backwards, he must press the molars together, [1].
Contraction and oppression of the chest, with stitches therein on deep breathing, [1].
*Painful pressure above the eyebrows, [1].
Pain and weight in the abdomen, on rising in morning (twelfth day); pain and tenderness in abdomen (thirteenth day), [44a].
Feel weak (fourth day), [37].
She feels as if she could easily injure herself, strain herself, sprain a joint, etc., [1].
Frequent painful contractions in the anus, [1].

Stool, which has been free and regular, is to-day, large, hard, and difficult (eleventh day); loose, yellow, watery, at 8 A.M., with pain and some flatulence (fifteenth day); sudden urging to stool with pain in the abdomen, at 6 A.M.; stool yellow, thin, and scanty, with much tenesmus (eighteenth day), [20].
Feeling as of a painful sore at the tip of the nose; this sore came out afterwards like an eruption, but within two days it quite disappeared, [9].
Great heat until midnight (first eight nights), [1].
Sour odor from the mouth, [1].
One-sided deep pressive headache, with pressive pain in the molar teeth, [1].
When blowing the nose, a sensation as if air were forced into the ears, [1].
Fine pricking pains in pit of stomach, [1].
Flatus in the abdomen (first, fourth, and fifth days), [44a].
At 10 P.M., pain in the right iliac region, near the crest, a pulling painful sensation (fourth day), [37].
Tensive pain between the scapulæ, [1].
Very faint all day (after seven days), [16].
Black comedones on the nose, upper lip, and chin, [1].
Considerable congestion of the face, at 3 P.M. (sixth day), [33].
A sore throat, from which I had suffered ever since I had small-pox, eight years ago, is somewhat improving), (fifth day), [38].
Pain in the outer canthus of both eyes (twelfth day), [15].
Strong bearing-down pains, [10].
A dull, heavy pain in the lower part of the ovaries, and pressure to pass water (twelfth day), [22].
Tearing in the right half of the face, [1].
Stitches from within outward in the forehead on loud talking and coughing, so that she was obliged to hold the forehead with the hand, for several days, mostly in the evening, [1].
Swelling of the inner part of the gums, [1].
Pain in the lumbar region (seventh day), [20].
Empty feeling in the head, in the morning (forty-eighth day), [29].
Attacks of tension in the chest, [1].
Much purulent eruption on the outer ear, [1].
Pimple on the tip of the tongue and very sweet saliva, [1].
Slight headache at the left side of the forehead, just above the eyebrow (soon); at noon, troublesome aching on the left side of the forehead (third day), [18].
Pressure in the throat, towards the back, when swallowing food and drink, [1].
On rising from stooping position, vertigo and weight in the head (ninth day), [21].
The lids often close, after rising, in the morning, [1].
Severe oppression of the chest, in the evening, the breathing very difficult, and on lying down much aggravated; she must sit up in bed; accompanied with flickering before the eyes, [1].
Itching in the left eye (second day), [20a].
Cutting-stinging pain in the gall-bladder (after half an hour), [7a].
Burning in the feet, at night, [1].
At noon, when sitting, some vertigo (twenty-sixth day), [45b].
Frequent sneezing and coughing (third day), [20a].
Cough when going to sleep (fourth day), [1].
Large blisters on the right thumb, with itching, [1].
Accumulation of much mucus in the mouth, after midnight, with tickling, obliging frequent hawking, [3].
Frequent gurgling empty eructations, [2].
The teeth feel loose on biting, and on eating feel paralyzed, [1].
Faintness in the morning when rising from bed, as if he would sink, with loss of thought; then chilliness with gooseflesh and yawning for one hour, tongue very pale, pulse weak and slow, [1].
Sensation of a plug in the throat, when swallowing, in the evening, [1].
The urine when passed is frequently cloudy and dark, as if mixed with mucus, [1].
Blisters form easily on the heel, when walking, [1].
The upper lip burns as if it were raw (second day), [45a].
Frequent cracking in the ears, as if a string broke in them, [1].
Sensation of paralysis in the forehead, [1].
Fluent coryza, with sneezing, which she had not had for two years, [5].
Pain in the tip of the nose, when touched, [1].
Chilliness, at 6 P.M.; he must lie down, [1].
The left submaxillary gland and tonsil are very much swollen (fourth day); throat much worse (fifth day), [21].

*From time to time, painful pressing inward from the vertex superiorly deep into the brain, especially late in the evening and at night in bed; the pain compels wrinkling the forehead and drawing the eyes together, [1].

On the lip, near the right commissure of the mouth, there appeared a group of small painful vesicles standing close together (fifth day); the vesicles burst, and left behind them an equal number of small round spots, which, the following day, assumed a lardaceous appearance (sixth day); began to dry up, and were covered with a scab, which fell off in five days (eighth day), [28c].
Sore corroding pain on the upper part of the toes, [1].
Stitches between the scapulæ (after twenty-four days), [1].
On the mucous membrane of the right side of the under lip two aphthæ, which went off in two days (third day), [25f].
The lips become so dry in speaking that they are quite rough, and cause a disagreeable feeling of rubbing (sixteenth day), [45].
The sore spot swells and becomes hot, accompanies by burning pains, [1].
Little pleasurable sensation during coition (second day), [1].
Externally perceptible gurgling in the left side of lower abdomen, over the hip, [1].
During the menses it grows black before the eyes, with weakness; she must lie down, which relieves her, [1].
Mouth insipid, with loss of appetite, [1].
Swelling and suppuration of the glands in the right axilla, [1].
Swelling of both legs (after thirteen days), [1].
Feverish, weak, hot urine, [1].
Headache almost all night, and when I got up this morning, lasting until noon (tenth day), [22].
Grumbling in the abdomen, with eructations (after two days), [1].
Pain all over the bowels, with sense of fulness and soreness, [24].
Burning from the stomach upwards, [2].
Excessive appetite, she was never satisfied; after eating, eructations tasting of the food, [1].
Headache all day, with great mental depression, [36].
*Headache (ninth day), [18a]; (second day), [34], etc.
Orgasm of blood, with congestion of blood to head and chest (after sixteen days), [1].
Noise and whistling in the abdomen, with distension, [3].
Stitches in the pudendum (after three days), [1].
Violent pressure under the left ribs, passing off from lying down, [1].
*Much headache, especially on stooping, [1].
Tingling sensation in the left side of the nose; a strong inclination to sneeze, but I can not (fourth day), [21].
Heat and redness of the ears, [5].
So weak that she thought she would faint (after seven days), [1].
Burning pain in the sternum, when drinking beer, [1].
Drawing in the scapula, intermingled with jerks (after nineteen days), [1].
Taste altered, insipid (third day), [37].
Stitches from within outward at the forehead, so that he must hold it with the hand, on coughing, [1].
Felt worse after sleep this afternoon; great vascular excitement, and felt sore and lame all over; did not wish to move (seventh day), [20].
Itching and stinging in the rectum, [1].
Drawing toothache if anything hot or cold is taken in the mouth, [1].
After rattling of mucus in the chest, severe cough, with expectoration, producing raw and sore pain in the throat, felt one half hour after the cough, [1].
Left tonsil much swollen and covered with pustules (twenty-ninth day), [21].

Aching at the root of the nose (twenty-fifth day); at noon, very troublesome aching pain in the nasal bones (one hundred and twelfth day); during the day, severe aching in the nasal bones (one hundred and thirteenth day); at noon, very severe aching in the nasal bones, and creeping in both temples (one hundred and fourteenth day); during the day, a disagreeable feeling of aching and fulness in the nose, one of the nasal bones was thickened and swollen (one hundred and seventeenth day); in the morning, severe aching in the nasal bones, and dry feeling in the nose. The aching in the nasal bones went off in the forenoon, but recurred at noon in great intensity and went away again in an hour (one hundred and eighteenth day); at noon, severe aching in the nasal bones and dry feeling in the nose, though a drop or two of fluid occasionally escapes unobserved from the nostrils (one hundred and nineteenth day); occasional severe aching in the nasal bones, in the forenoon (one hundred and twentieth day); during breakfast, very violent aching in the nose; the pain extended into the frontal sinus, but did not last long (one hundred and twenty-second day); occasional aching pain in the nasal bones (one hundred and twenty-fourth day); frequent aching pain in the nasal bones, in the forenoon (one hundred and twenty-seventh day); dry feeling and aching in the superior nasal passages (one hundred and twenty-eighth day); towards noon, quite severe aching in the nasal passages (one hundred and thirtieth day); frequently recurring, but always transitory sensation of soreness in the nose (one hundred and thirty-second day); occasional aching in the nasal bones (one hundred and thirty-third day); in the nose, very tiresome aching and feeling of dryness (one hundred and thirty-third day); aching in the nose, at noon (one hundred and thirty-fourth day); occasional tiresome aching in the nose (one hundred and thirty-fifth day); during the day repeated aching at the root of the nose (one hundred and thirty-sixth day); towards noon, tiresome aching in the root of the nose (one hundred and thirty-eighth day); tiresome aching in the bones of the nose, at noon (two hundred and seventh day); aching pain in the root of the nose, in the evening (two hundred and thirty-sixth day); frequent aching pain in the root of the nose throughout the day (two hundred and thirty-seventh day); aching at the root of the nose (two hundred and thirty-eighth day); aching pain in the nose, at noon (two hundred and forty-eighth day); in the forenoon, very severe aching pain in the nose about its root, with dryness of the Schneiderian membrane (two hundred and fifty-eighth day), [45b].
Bruised pain in the eye on pressing it together and on feeling of it, [1].
Blew a very little blood from left nostril (second day), [15].
Itching and biting in the inner canthi, [3].
Grumbling and drawing in the teeth, [1].
The skin of the palm of the hand peels off, [1].
Pressing pain at lower part of right calf, as if cramp would set in, [2].
Itching in the axillæ, [1].
No appetite (third day); anorexia; what she eats has no taste; she has no relish, and the morsel seems to stick in her gullet (fourth day); no appetite (sixth day), [31].
Sensation as if the ears were stuffed, [51].
Bitter taste, in the morning, relieved by eating, [1].
Pain along the sole of the left foot to a point between the fourth and fifth toes (thirty-first day), [38].
He cannot tolerate meat or fish, in the evening; it causes pressure in the stomach, draws the abdomen upward, and delays the stool, [1].
Aching boring pains in the ears, especially the right ear and the temples (seventeenth day), [29].
All the symptoms are greatly aggravated on lying; I must get up and walk about slowly; relieved after supper in all respects (twenty-second day), [20].
In the morning, dryness and tension of the skin of the lips (forty-eighth day), [29].
Hands cold, but moist, almost all the time (twenty-ninth day), [20].
Bruised pain in the knee and tibia, more when sitting than walking, [1].
Swelling and redness of the eyes, with pimples on the lids, [1].

*Aching pain in the forehead and confusion of head, as if he had taken too much alcoholic drink, lasting until noon (after one hour, second and third days); aching pain in forehead, above eyebrows (soon, eighth day); at 6 A.M., after waking, aching pain in forehead, going off after getting up and washing (ninth day); on waking, in the morning, pressive pain in the forehead and occiput (eighteenth day); pressive headache over the eyebrows, almost all day, more or less severe and continued (twentieth day); aching pain in forehead, especially above the right eye, lasting till noon (soon, forty-first day), [22a].

Attacks of vertigo when walking in the open air, lasting from 2 to 3 minutes; it was as if something were rolling about in the head, and made her reel; followed in the evening by headache and humming in the ears, [1].
Considerable desire to urinate, with painful bearing down in the pelvis, in the morning, [3].
The gum bleeds on spitting, [1].
Pain in the shoulder, which was higher than the other from disease, also when touching it, [5].
Drawing on the left side of the lower jaw and in the left thigh, in the afternoon (fourth and fifth days), [44d].
The feet become swollen from much walking, [1].
Crawling in the nose, as in coryza, [1].
Profuse sweat, in drops, especially in the bend of the elbow and knee, in right side, at 4 A.M. (twenty-seventh day), [20].
In the evening, tearing in the right cheek (thirtieth day), [28c].

Every evening, about 7 P.M. (after sunset), heat commencing in head, where it is most felt, lasting till noon next day; hands and face continually hot, but worse in evening; hands feel hot to others; the heat is better in open air, for five days (three days after last dose), [16].
Pressure in the throat, as from a plug, which it seemed to him he must swallow; from hawking or coughing mucus is raised, [1].
Rhus relieved, [19].
Pressure and itching in the eyes and vertigo on stooping, [1].
The commissures of the mouth, especially the left one, smarted as if raw (fourth day), [44c].
On two spots of the vertex there are found very tender scabby elevations, the size of a pea, which last several days (forty-third day), [28c].
In the forenoon, drawing in the teeth, which recurred several times (tenth day), [44f].

Great burning in the canthi, at noon (second day); slight burning in both outer canthi (tenth day); slight burning in the edges of the lids (twelfth, seventeenth, eighteenth, and nineteenth days), [45a].
Profuse sweat on the scrotum, [1].
Dull stitches in the region of the liver (after three hours), [2].
Long-continued erections, at night (after sixteen hours), [1].
Cutting colic after midnight, [2].
Stitching-smarting pains in the left knee and on the inner sides of thighs and arms (sixth day), [35].
Twitching on the tongue, [1].
Throbbing pains in both temples after walking, especially after going upstairs (fifth day), [44].
In the evening, frequent sudden tearing in the left cheek, in the right nape muscles, and in the right tibia (twenty-second day), [28c].
Alternating stitches and griping pain in the intestines, in attacks lasting about ten minutes, [1].
Frequent stitches under the right ribs, [1].
Sensation of stiffness and coldness in the arms, as if they had no blood in them, without any perceptible coldness to the touch, [1].
Many black pores in the face, [1].
Tearing in the lower maxilla, below the incisors, [2].

Swelling of the whole body, face, abdomen, legs, and the arms down to the wrist-joint, without thirst, but with great shortness of breath, lasting three weeks, fever every two or three days, chills and heat alternating, coming on at irregular hours, even at night, the heat accompanied with sweat all over (after forty-eight hours), [1].
Sourish nightsweat, five mornings (after seven days), [1].
Repeated stitches in a spot in front of left chest, in the afternoon (twelfth day), [15].
Frequent awaking at night, many nights in succession (after six days), [1].
Great thirst without heat; drink tastes good, but does not quench the first, and seems to distress the stomach, [1].
Blister on the gums, with burning pain from touch, [1].
Tearing in the occiput, [1].
Dulness of the left side of occiput (after three hours), [2].
Very cold feet, particularly in the evening, mainly in bed, and afterwards, when this passes off, very cold hands, [1].
Tearing in the left upper arm, at a small spot above the elbow, [2].
Stitches through the bladder, a little while before urinating (sixth day), [21].
Lower extremities go to sleep while sitting, [1].

In the morning some chilliness, then the whole day heat of the face and hands, with paleness of the face, without thirst and without sweat, together with pressing pain in the stomach and headache, when stooping, in the forenoon (after six days), [1].
Headache and weariness, while walking in the afternoon, changing in the evening to toothache and sleepiness (after eighth day), [1].
Swelling of the gum, with throbbing pain, [1].
Weak, particularly in the knees, [1].
Red mark across bridge of nose, as if I had been wearing spectacles (tenth day); less (thirteenth day), [13].
Sleeps better towards morning, with aversion to rising at usual time, for five days (third day after last dose), [16].
In the outer canthus of the right eye itching, shooting, and sensation of fine sparks in the skin of the right upper lid (third day), [25a].
Tearing toothache out through the left ear, during and after eating, [1].
Tension in the knee when walking in the open air, [1].
Burning heat in the eyes, [57].
Drawing in the crowns of the teeth, in the evening (eighth day), [44f].
Small dark specks before the eyes; eyes dazzled after looking long at an object (twenty-third day), [34].
Aversion to meat; it makes her qualmish, [1].
Sore pain in throat, when swallowing, [1].
Drawing and tearing in a part of the skin which had once been injured, [1].
Sensation of emptiness in the abdomen, [1].
Itching in the face, on the arms, hands, back, hips, abdomen, and pubes (after two, twenty, twenty-three, and twenty-eight days), [1].

A quiet refreshing rest at night, waking in the morning always with a consciousness of feeling very well; my general condition is exceedingly languid, in the morning; I cannot get dressed until a cup of café noir is brought to me; the third and fourth mornings after taking the medicine I did not care for my coffee, [41].
Sweat of the feet, [1].
At 2 P.M., I have a very severe headache, which runs from my right temple to my left, and extends into my eyes and nose (third day), [37].
Violent tickling stitch on the lower part of right tibia, [2].
Frequent stitches in the sole of right foot (after one day), [5].
The skin of the whole body is painfully sensitive to the slightest knock, [1].
Discharge of bloody mucus after the stool, [1].
Painful ulcer on internal surface of lower lip; pain ameliorated by cold water, [1].
Burning in the rectum the entire day, [1].
Backache almost all day (ninth day); severe backache, in the afternoon (tenth day); backache (twentieth day), [22].
Flickering before the eyes (after forty-eight hours), [1].
Itching on the upper part of the sternum, [1].
Tickling scraping kind of cough, and again a loose phlegmy kind of cough, [9].
Intermission of beats of the heart, with anxiety, [1].
In the afternoon, for two hours, heat on the forehead and drawing in the thighs, like a fever, [1].
Frequent cutting through all the teeth of the right row from a draft of cold air, [1].
Single jerks in the teeth, day and night, when a draft of wind gets into the mouth or ear, followed by a grumbling, causing restlessness, [1].
Transient vertigo to falling sideways, [1].
Sleep at night disturbed, with pain in small of back (after twelve days), [1].
In the morning, when awaking, loss of strength in the upper and lower limbs (after five days), [1].
Yellowness of the face and whites of the eyes, for one day, [1].
Herpes around the mouth, [1].
She awakes at 1 A.M., and cannot fall asleep again, on account of wakefulness, [1].
Vertigo, when she sees a large plain before her, [1].

Tearing in the arms from the wrist to the shoulder, so that he could scarcely move the arm on account of pain; when letting it hang down it became blue and rigid; pains mostly at night, less during the day and when at rest, [1].
Blowing of blood from the nose, at night, [1].
*Throbbing in the head, in the morning, [1].
Burning and sticking in the right side of the occiput, [3].
Single, violent, undulating jerks of pressing headache, quite in forepart of the forehead (after thirty-five hours), [2].
Heaviness in the occiput, particularly in the morning, [1].
Severe cramp in the calves, at night in bed, when stretching out the legs, and days afterward constant tension of calves as if too short, [1].
After breakfast, great flickering and luminous appearance before the eye. Everything appeared to be in a quivering movement. This symptom lasted an hour (one hundred and twentieth day), [45b].
Feeling of dryness in the trachea (after three days), [1].
Eruption of pimples on the upper lid, [1].
At night heat, and from this restlessness, [1].
Great sweetness in the mouth, in the morning on waking, with much mucus, [1].
I noticed a peculiar quite unpleasant exhalation from the body after getting warm in bed (twenty-seventh day), [38].
Dull drawing-tearing pain, as if sprained, in the shoulder-joint (after dinner), [1].
Very sleepy all day, for five days (third day after last dose), [16].
Pain in the small of the back (after five, and sixteen days), [1].

Distressing dry feeling in the nose, after rising; dryness in the nose, at noon (second day); troublesome dryness and sensitiveness of the nose, soon after taking the medicine (fifth day); some sensitiveness and dryness in the nose (tenth day); nose dry and tender, in the morning after waking (eleventh day); dryness of the nose (thirteenth day); tiresome dryness of the nose, in the evening (fifteenth day); great dryness and sensitiveness of the nose (eighteenth day); teasing dryness of the nose, in the morning (nineteenth day); dryness and tenderness of the nose (twentieth day); dryness of the nose, and feeling as if its mucous membrane was swollen, in the open air in the forenoon (twenty-third day); great dryness of the nose (twenty-fourth day); *dryness of the nose (twenty-ninth day); the effect upon the nasal mucous membrane during the whole of the proving was quite peculiar; at one time acrid fluid flows from the nose, and again the organ appears to be as dry and stiff as parchment, and the next moment he has to blow out a quantity of thick phlegm, which is followed by a return of the dryness; dryness of the nose (thirtieth day); distressing dryness and stiffness of the nose, at noon (thirty-first day); dryness of the nose (thirty-fifth day); severe burning and dryness in the nose, at noon when sitting (thirty-sixth day); dryness of the nose and stiffness of its walls (fortieth day); dryness and tension of the nose (forty-first day); dry feeling in the nose, though it is actually moist, in the evening (forty-third day); dryness of the nose, in the evening (forty-seventh day); burning dry nose, in the evening (forty-ninth day), dryness of nose (fifty-third and fifty-sixth days); the nose not nearly so dry as the day previous (fifty-eighth day); great dry feeling in the nose, especially towards its point (sixty-second day); dryness of the nose (sixty-eighth day); great dryness of the nose (seventy-second and seventy-sixth days); dryness and tickling in the nose (seventy-eighth day); great dryness, extreme sensitiveness, almost sore feeling of the nose (eightieth day); dryness in the nose (eighty-first day); dryness and parchment-like stiffness of the nose (eighty-fifth day); great dryness of the nose (eighty-seventh day), [45a].
The head pained, as if raw, and would not bear the slightest touch (second day), [43].

About 2 A.M. he awoke with violent pains in the inflamed gum; they were burning and tearing, and spread all over the head; at the same time a sensation as if the left cheek were swollen, which is not the case; after two hours he became again quiet and fell asleep; gum very painful, in the evening (one hundred and second day); in the morning the gum is still rather tender, but the swelling considerably diminished (one hundred and fourth day); gum more painful (one hundred and fifth day), [45a].
Slight drawing behind the left ear (two hundred and sixty-third day); severe drawing (two hundred and sixty-fourth day), [45b].
For four months after the proving, the Sepia symptoms returned whenever a dose of Nux vomica was taken, [20].
About 2 A.M., he awoke with aching pain in the occiput (third day), [22g].
Intermission of the beats of the heart, after dinner, [1].
Very weak and short-breathed, as in continued fever, [1].
Itching in the pudendum (after twenty-one days), [1].

Having been constipated since the first day, I feel at 9.45 A.M. a sudden violent aching in the anus, relieved by fast walking, and ceasing entirely as soon as the fæces began to pass (never had anything like it before), (third day), [40a].
Tickling in the palate, posteriorly (thirty-second day), [18a].
Left side of tongue and mouth covered with vesicles, causing a stinging pain; tongue coated yellow (twenty-eighth day); tongue clean; vesicles have disappeared (twenty-ninth day), [21].
Pressing and jerking and beating, with heat in the head, as if everything would issue from the forehead and eyes, for three days, [1].
Swelling of the cheeks, with sticking pains, and also pain on touch, lasting eight days, [1].
Pale suffering expression, as after a long illness, with great discomfort, [3].
Pressure in the eyelids, in the evening, [1].
Throat very sore, at 7 A.M. (eighth day), [21].

Severe itching on the right side of the pubis, worse at night on going to bed; becoming moist after scratching, and forming a thin scale, easily pulled off (after a week); this eruption has nearly disappeared (after eighteen days), [39].
Urine thick, slimy, and very offensive, depositing a yellowish pasty sediment the next morning (third day), [23].
Frequent expectoration of mucus from the fauces, [1].
Pain as if bruised in right hip-joint, only when lying on that side, [1].
Expectoration of white mucus of the size of millet seed (after fourteen days), [4].
She felt best when at rest and while lying, [1].
On clenching the fist, the last joints of the fingers feel sore; if pressed, they are quite painful (thirty-second day), [38].

After a walk of two or three miles, just after entering the warm room, giddiness when rising from stooping, when raising up head after bending it down forwards, on the act of sitting down, also after shaking head quickly from side to side, at 7 A.M.; all gone by 7.35 A.M. (twelfth day), [15].
Sensation of hunger, in the abdomen; speedy fulness from a few morsels, [1].

The complaints disappear during violent exercise, such as walking in the open air, fencing, etc. (horseback riding excepted), and appear most frequently and severely when sitting quiet, forenoon and evening, [2].
Itching inflammation of the penis increasing the excitement during coition, [1].
*Dulness of the head, on waking at night, [1].
Swelling of the axillary glands, [1].
Pressure at the stomach, after a meal and from touch, [1].
Reeling, stupefaction, and great weakness, at 11 A.M.; she was obliged to lie down and lay till 3 o'clock, in an uneasy slumber in which she heard everything
He bites the teeth together at night, during sleep, which causes great pain, [1].
Headache in the forenoon, as if the brain were crushed, [1].
Strong erections (second day); from the twenty-ninth day on, however, only short, and with quick emission of semen during coition, [1].
Great thirst, in the morning, after awaking, [1].
When coughing she becomes nauseated, she must retch at times, from which she becomes hot and sweaty, [1].
In the morning, expectoration of salt-tasted saliva (ninth day); after hawking and slight coughing it went off in four days, [38c].
Heaviness of the eyes, [1].
The eyes feel tired and look injected (after five hours, second day); tired and reddened (fourth and fifth days), [44].
She feels the beating of pulse in the head and all the limbs, day and night, but more at night, [1].
Scanty emission of urine (first seven days), [1].
Appetite good, but wants to eat often, [16].
Ravenous hunger, which obliges him to eat frequently; if he does not, he has headache and great lassitude, and is obliged to lie down (after ten days), [1].
Uneasy sensation in stomach, cannot describe sensation, at 7 A.M. (twenty-eighth day), [21].
Loud rumbling in the abdomen, [1].
Sleepiness during the day, she falls asleep as soon as she sits down, [1].
Twitching of the lids for many days, [1].
*Along with the febrile heat there occurred a disagreeable aching pain in the forehead, and great restlessness, which went off when sweat broke out (thirty-eighth day), [32].
Painful confusion of the head, particularly of the forehead, [5].

In the evening had a severe headache, characterized by pressing pains in the temples, which seemed to press outwards, began at 6 P.M., and continued till next morning; have had similar headaches after drinking strong coffee, but had taken no coffee while taking the medicine (second day), [34].
Asthmatic, particularly during palpitation of heart, after mental exertions, [1].
Constriction of the sphincter ani (fifth day), preventing any movements of the bowels (sixth day), [44].
Loud sounds and humming in the ears (immediately), [1].
Dull pain in the left lumbar region (fifth day), [36].
Burning in the roof of the palate, [7a].
Severe dry cough, with stitches in the right chest, [1].
Coryza, for several weeks (after seven days), [1].
The eyes are agglutinated, in the morning, the lids thick and red; afterwards dry mucus in the lashes, [1].

Salivary secretion increased; for a long time he had every now and then traces of blood in the saliva (twelfth day); rush of water into the mouth (seventeenth day); in the evening, great flow of saliva mixed with blood (twenty-sixth day); great flow of saliva into the mouth; bloody streaks in the saliva (in one hour); increased secretion of saliva mixed with streaks of blood, in the afternoon (thirtieth day); in the forenoon, copious secretion of saliva mixed with streaks of blood (thirty-third day), [29].

He raised himself about midnight, as if in delirium, began to laugh; on being questioned he closed his eyes tightly, sat quite stiff, with outstretched arms and hands and tightly set teeth; after drinking a swallow of water he asked what he was to do with so much water in his stomach, yet he drank more, held up his hand bend, as if holding the glass, laughed and said, Now this is strange, this water did not agree quite well; afterwards talked of three doctors who were coming, and referred to persons as if they were standing about, [1].
The borders of the alæ nasi dry, the Schneiderian mucous membrane irritated, as if a coryza were coming on (fifteenth day), [29].
Complete loss of appetite, as if it were contracted in the pit of the stomach, [1].
Very sensitive to cold north wind, [1].
Slight pressure on the region of the stomach causes great pain, [1].
Slight adhesion of the lids, in the morning (ninth, thirty-second, and one hundred and seventh days), [45a].
Red spots on the glans, [1].
Pressing in the vertex (twenty-third day), [20].
*Tearing in the forehead, [1].
Cramplike pains in the calves, and shooting pains in the ankles, [14].
Sore pain and swelling of the gums; they recede from the teeth and bleed from the slightest touch, [1].
Tired feeling, at 9.45 P.M. (second day), [40a].
Blood-red urine, [1].
Jerking in the left lower extremity, [1].
Deep-toned roaring in the ear when lying on it, synchronous with the pulse, for two nights, [1].
Eructation after eating but little, [1].
Stitches in the perinæum, pressing towards the rectum, while sitting in the evening, [1].
Pressure on the spinal column, above the small of back, with rheumatic drawing in the neck, [2].

After dinner, rather severe itching of the lids, especially of the right eye (two hundred and forty-seventh day); great itching on the borders of the right eyelids (two hundred and forty-eighth day), [45b].

During the day, increased frequency of micturition (first day); fulness in the bladder, urging continually to micturition (fifth day); micturition almost every hour during the day (ninth day); micturition more frequent than yesterday, not painful, but with a constant uneasiness, as of great fulness in the bladder (twenty-first day); nearly every hour in the afternoon (twenty-second day); increased frequency of micturition (twenty-ninth day). Urine during the proving, amber-colored; slightly turbid; sp. gr. 1030; strongly acid; bile pigment; marked proof of bile acid, in large quantity. Normal urine; amber-colored; slightly turbid; sp. gr. 1028; no sugar; no albumen; no bile pigment; slight trace of bile acid, [20].
Prickling in soles of feet and pain in the corns, [1].
Felt warm all over; perspiration on chest and neck, at 4 A.M. (first night), [23].
Soon tired, for five days (third day after last dose), [16].
Stitches in the parotid gland, which swelled and produced a tensive pain when moving the head, [1].
Dry coryza (first days), [1].
Reddish herpetic spots above the hips, [1].
Sensation of a plug in the throat, [1].
Stitches transversely through the abdomen, from the right to the left side, as quick as lightning (after thirty-six days), [1].
Digging pain in the eyeball (twenty-sixth day), [30].
Whirling vertigo, in the evening after lying in bed a quarter of an hour, as if he would fall into a faint, everything whirled around in the head, two evenings in succession, [1].
On waking from sleep before midnight, pressure in the left frontal protuberance (ninth day), [21].
Excessive vertigo, in the morning on rising; as soon as he attempts to stand he falls back upon the bed, only disappearing after half an hour (tenth day), [1].
Frequent micturition (after four days), [1].
Difficult awaking, late, with weariness of the limbs, [2].
Putrid taste to the expectoration and putrid smell of the breath coming up with it, [1].
Raw pain in left commissure of mouth (seventh to thirteenth day), [17a].
Taste of blood in the mouth, in the morning after waking (sixth day), [44d].
Restless sleep, with frequent waking, after midnight, [2].
Tearing in the great toe, [2].
Boring, as with a hot iron, in the teeth, [1].
Tearing in the left frontal eminence (after eleven hours and a half), [2].
*Violent pressure in the forehead, [1].
Shooting pains in the teeth (tenth day), [34a].
In the morning dryness of lips, the mucous membrane of which lies in folds; aridity of the commissures of the mouth, which are covered with small whitish scales (fifteenth day), [29].
Fluent coryza, the mucus must be drawn through the posterior nares, [1].
Severe irritation to cough, from crawling in the chest, [1].
Inner surface of lower lip feels sore and is full of painful blisters (after seven days), [1].
Dull pain in upper lobe of left lung (second day), [38].
Short breath when walking, as if the chest were full, [1].
Cramplike drawing below the right mastoid process (fifth day), [25a].

Woke at an unusual hour, namely, at 5 A.M., with aching-throbbing headache in the right half of the occiput, and pain in the left side of the small of the back; the former went off in half an hour, the latter after getting up in bed (second day), [25].

In the forenoon, some burning on the edges of the eyelids (seventh day); slight burning in the external canthi (sixty-fourth day); during the day, severe burning on the edges of the eyelids (two hundred and third day); slight burning of the tarsal edges (two hundred and seventy-ninth day), [45b].
Aching in the head, in the forenoon (twenty-second day), [43].
An incisor tooth seemed elongated, [1].
Boring pains in the meatus auditorius (fiftieth and fifty-first days), [29].
Puffed face (after five, and forty days), [1].
Occasional sharp shooting pains in the eyeballs, during the day (eighteenth day), [20].
Menses five days too late, at full moon (after twenty-two days), [1].
Much perspiration, sometimes hot, sometimes cold, particularly in the hands and feet; constant disposition to sweat, both night and day, [8].
Tension in the calves, [3].
Glassy appearance of the eyes, [1].
On taking gentle exercise, transient rush of blood to the head, with burning and creeping in the skin of the face (first day), [39b].
Itching of the toes, [1].
Inflammation of the eyes, with redness of the whites; stitching and pressure therein, [1].
Inflammation, great swelling, and suppuration of the left tonsil; he could not swallow on account of pain, heat of the whole body, thirst, and burning in the eyes (after eleven days), [1].
Stitches in both sides of the upper abdomen, when coughing, [1].
Want of steadiness and dizzy feeling accompanied anxious state (fourth day), [30].
Frequent sneezing, which always gave relief to the head (sixth day); in the afternoon, frequent violent sneezing (fourteenth day), [33].
No appetite, [8].
Jerking of the limbs, at night, [1].
In the morning, after awaking, itching in the eyelids (second day), which are gummed together (third day); itching much diminished (fourth day), [36].
Burning stinging and smarting sore pain in the heel, while sitting, [1].

Sensation as if the abdomen were bloated, especially across the epigastric region; a sensation of drawing, as if a worm or other animal were moving about there (after six hours, second day); the sense of fulness continued five days, [23].
Drawing in the occiput, [1].
Smarting throughout the urethra, [3].
Bitter taste in the mouth, only when clearing the throat, [1].
Menses three days too late (after nineteen days), [1].
Vomiting of milky water (during pregnancy), although she had not drank any milk, [1].
Toothache in the open air, [1].
Black flies seem to float not far from the eyes (after twelve hours), [1].
Head feels full and hot (thirteenth day), [1].
Redness and violent burning on both cheek-bones, [1].
Hard distended abdomen, particularly in the evening, together with congested state of the superficial abdominal veins, accompanied with stitching pain in the hernia, [1].
Weakness of right wrist, when using the hand (fifth day), [36].
A shoot into under surface of ungual phalanx of left great toe, in the evening after sunset (first day), [15].
Stitches in the forehead as if in the bone, [1].
In the afternoon, pressure in the uterus, as if everything would issue through the vulva (twenty-third day), [20].
Feeling of desire to pass urine more urgent than common, the sensation being referred to the neck of the bladder (third day), [40].
Griping in the lower abdomen the whole day, in quarter-hour attacks, with hard stool daily, three days in succession (after forty-eight hours), [1].
She wakes at 1 A.M., and cannot fall asleep again, [1].
The right ear ached after midnight, after walking in the wind (eighteenth night); earache after midnight, with cold sensation over head (nineteenth night), [20].
A good deal of coryza and sneezing, [56].
Tenesmus in the rectum, with dull pain in the lumbar region (after fourteen hours, second day), [21].
Pressing pain on turning the eyes to the right, [1].
Visible twitches and jerks, with stitching pain, in the muscles of the palm of the hand, [1].
Continuous chilliness, [1].
Jerking of either of the limbs, when moving them, [1].
Stitches in the head after a meal, [1].
Sore pain in the tibia, only during motion, [1].
A tender spot in the left nostril (sixth day), [45c].
Tearing pressure in the upper part of the left chest, near the shoulder-joint, relieved by eructation, but soon returned violently, [2].
Jerking in the vagina upwards, in the morning, after awaking from a dream, [1].
Much distended abdomen, without stool, [1].
Redness of the white of the eyes (after seventeen days), [1].
At 9 P.M., in the undecayed teeth of the left lower jaw, aching pains which last an hour (fourth and fifth days), [22b].
Neuralgic pain over the right eye (I was accustomed to this some time ago, but had not had it lately), (ninth day), [22].
Heat in the testicles, [1].
Griping diarrhœic like feel in the abdomen, followed afterward by exhausting diarrhœa, [13].

During the menses she was obliged to remain in bed for two days, on account of an uneasiness in the body, drawing pain in lower limbs and in abdomen, with rumbling; on the second day, palpitation of the heart, for several hours in the forenoon, accompanied with dyspnœa (after nine days), [1].
Near the outer canthus of the left eye an intensely red, excessively itching and burning spot on the skin; the left palpebral conjunctiva much reddened (twelfth day), [29a].
Swelling and pain in the eyelids, with lachrymation, [1].
Taste in the mouth sweet as sugar, [1].
Painful jerk from the throat to the pit of the stomach, in the morning, when sitting up in bed, [1].
Too salt taste to all food, [1].
A gurgling sound in the chest, [8].
Violent beating in the head and sensation as if the head were in motion, in the evening in bed, [1].
Somnolence every third day, returning four times, the child slept almost the whole day; when it sat down it fell asleep, and complained also of pain in the forehead, [5].

About noon, shining red swelling of the point of the nose, whereby the anterior angle of the left nostril felt thick, hard, and painful to the touch (thirteenth day); increased redness and swelling of the inflamed nose (fourteenth day); the redness of the swelling on the nose is diminished, the shininess of the skin, and the sensitiveness to touch continue (fifteenth day); swelling of the nose as yesterday (sixteenth day); at 6 A.M., on the inside of the swollen portion of the nose is a hardened, transparent, bright-yellow mass, which can only be detached with difficulty and pain (seventeenth day); rapid diminution of the swelling of the nose, of which next day not a trace remains (eighteenth day), [21].
Pain in the eyes several times, with headache and heat in the eyes, [1].
Slight frontal headache, passing around on the right side to the occiput, in the evening, [33].
Continued and violent eructations, in the evening, preceded by great distension of the abdomen, [1].
Awoke at 4 A.M. with a sense of fulness below the pit of the stomach, above the navel (first night), [23].
Sensation of a veil before the eyes, and dim vision for near and distant objects, [1].
Menses several days too early (after forty-eight hours), [1].

During the day two pimples again appeared, one on the vertex, the other posteriorly about the nape (sixty-first day); a painful pimple on the vertex (ninety-fifth day); on the vertex some small elevations of the scalp, quite free from pain (one hundred and seventh day); several small pimples on the vertex (one hundred and twenty-third day); a small painful pimple on the vertex (one hundred and thirty-third day); a painful pimple on the middle of the vertex (one hundred and thirty-fourth day); a small painful pimple on the middle of the vertex (two hundred and thirty-fourth day); a painful pimple on the vertex, in the evening (two hundred and forty-fourth day); the pimple on the vertex gone, but in place of it there appears on the same spot several not very tender elevations the size of a hemp-seed (two hundred and forty-fifth day); elevations gone (two hundred and forty-sixth day), [45b].

Pressure and cutting in the throat, when swallowing, with a coating of mucus in the throat; on attempting to hawk up the mucus the pressure and cutting are aggravated, with a sensation as if the throat were cut with shears, followed by bleeding; dulness of the head, heat over the whole body, fever, pulse 108, followed by a stupid condition, in which he did not know whether he was awake or asleep; during the night frequent waking, with great accumulation of mucus in the throat and distressing dreams; on rising the next morning weakness, sweat on the forehead, and qualmishness, so that he lay down again, [7].
Occasional drawing in the teeth and limbs, especially the right thigh, in the morning (seventeenth day), [44f].
Feeling of tension in the neck (third day), [36].
Lachrymation of the eyes, when walking, in the open air (two hundred and seventy-sixth day), [45b].
Drawing pressure near the spinal column, near the left scapula, at times drawing to the neck, [2].
Stiffness in the lower part of the back, so that he can only with difficulty straighten himself, [1].
Very sensitive to noise, [1].
Stitching-pressive headache continuous in the lower part of the forehead, just over the eye, worse from motion in the house, much better when walking in the open air, [1].
Sore pain on the right side of the lower lip near the corner of the mouth, [2].
(Diminution of the falling off of the hair), (twenty-third day), [45b].
External and internal tearing pain in the left shoulder-joint, [2].

Sensation of fulness in the left axillary gland, in a few minutes leaving the left and appearing in the right axilla (after one hour and a half); the sense of fulness returned about from 1 to 2 P.M., first in the left, then in the right axilla, then to the groin, during lecture; in the evening an occasional soreness in the axilla (fourth day); axillary glands still somewhat sore (twelfth and thirteenth days), [30].
Frequent hard distension of the abdomen, with cutting in the bowels, [1].
Dryness and roughness of the tongue and palate, [1].
Profuse perspiration on walking, especially in the bends of the joints (twenty-third day), [20].
Tearing in the right little toe, [1].
Lips cracked, [1].
Itching on the occiput, in the morning (tenth day), [45c].
Frequent cramp in the internal border of soles of feet, [1].
Drawing in the thighs (after forty-eight hours), [1].
Dimness of vision, as from a fog, with the headache, [1].
Great weakness, at 7 P.M., [1].
Crawling or prickling stitches in the sole and under the toes, more during rest than during walking (after four days), [1].
Jerking in the right arm from below upwards, followed by trembling of the hands, so that he could no write, [1].

About 11 A.M., while writing, the feet became very cold, afterwards the whole body, accompanied with shaking chill; he had to lie down, then became warm, and at 4 A.M., hot, with disposition to sweat, having had a slight sweat during the night over the whole body (ninth day), [1].
Much straining in passing, even the fæces which are not at all hard, [1].
Swollen inflamed nose, nostrils sore and ulcerated, [1].

In the evening, immediately after dose, sweet taste in the palate (thirteenth day); sweetish taste (seventeenth day); in the evening, sweetish taste in the mouth (twenty-sixth day); sweet taste (in one hour, thirtieth day); in the forenoon, sweet taste (thirty-third day), [29].
Shooting pains along the inner side of the whole right arm (fourth day), [36].
Drawing in the hollow tooth extending to the ear, aggravated by cold water, [1].
Feeling of roughness in the mouth and throat (forty-third and forty-fifth days), [22a].
She cannot sleep at night on account of incessant cough (after forty days), [1].
A constant, mostly one-sided headache, as if the brain were torn or sore, on opening the eyes after waking from the midday nap (after thirty-six hours), [1].
Undulating pressure in the inguinal canal, from within outwards, [2].
Slumbering (almost immediately), with sweat of the face, [1].
Excoriated feeling about the anus (fourth day), [37].
He must rise at night and walk about for half an hour, [1].
Appetite much increased (seventh day), [15].
Blood from the nose on blowing it, [1], [2].
Sensation of heat in throat, [1].
Pressing pain in the region of the liver, [1].
Soft painless swelling on the patella; when kneeling the knee is unyielding and tense; the swelling feels numb, [1].
Tension of the abdomen, in the morning (after two days), [1].
Loud grumbling and sensation of emptiness in the left side of the abdomen, every day, [1].
Nose cold and pinched (fourth day), [21].
Itching in the urethra, [1].
Aversion to all food, particularly to meat; he could only eat butter, bread, and soup, [1].
Eyes feel like balls of fire, especially the left, which is much injected (fifty-seventh day), [21].
Profuse leucorrhœa of lumpy mucus, having a fetid odor, with drawing pain in the lower abdomen, [1].
Sensation as if weights were attached to the posterior parts of the eyeballs (twenty-third day), [20].
She could not get warm, although in a warm room the whole day, [1].
Much sweat during sleep, particularly on the head, [1].
Tension in the skin of the face, as if beginning to swell (fourth day), [20].
Rumbling in the stomach, [1].
Heaviness of the head, she could scarcely lift it, [1].
Bloated uncomfortable feeling around the waist (second day), [22].
Left commissure of mouth again painful (first day), [17b].
Aching pain across the loins, worse on moving, [9].

A sore bruised feeling in the right side of the median line of the tip of the nose and of the chin (sixth day); the sensation in the nose and chin increased; the spot on the nose was quite red, but no point; later, the nose and chin symptoms have ceased (seventh day), [30].
Drawing pain in the face, with swelling of the cheek, [1].
Urging to stool in the evening (unusual); stool insufficient and difficult to pass (fourth day); small soft stool in the morning (fifth day); hard difficult stool at night (seventh day), [36].
At night, pressive pain in occiput (forty-fourth day), [22a].
Pressure in the pit of the stomach, [1].
Stitch, as if in the bone, extending from under the right eyelid down to the upper canine tooth, [1].
Head symptoms much worse after sleeping, afternoon (twenty-ninth day), [20].
Tearing pain in left cheek, and thence over the ear toward the occiput, [1].
Painfulness of the whole chest, [1].
Discharge of blood with the stool (after eleven and twenty days), [1].
All night likes to be well covered up, for five nights (third night after last dose), [16].
Stitching pain in the right abdominal muscles, with visible twitches, [1].

Since commencing my proving of Sulphur I have observed a considerable weakness of vision, and very often a feeling of heaviness and aching in the eyeballs. When reading or writing I often feel as if a mist were before the eyes. I must then cover the eyes with the hand, slightly press and rub them, in order to read. Moreover, I must hold the book I am reading a considerable distance from the eyes, for when I hold it close I cannot distinguish the letters. I had previously noticed a slight diminution of my visual powers, but since the proving of Sulphur, the feeling of weight and aching in the eyes, and the weakness of sight rapidly increased, and to a great extent, [29].

Menses began to flow one week too soon (sixth day); dark, scant, and fetid (seventh day); menses began to flow; dark clotted blood (thirty-eighth day); very scant all day (thirty-ninth and fortieth days); very scant and membranous, and very painful (forty-first day); better, but not entirely relieved (forty-second day); menses made their appearance, with pain (seventy-second day); very scanty and pale, and very acrid, no pain (seventy-fourth day), [21].
Burning stitching in the extreme tip of the great toe, [2].
Tension and contraction in the skin of the face, particularly the forehead, [1].
All the teeth become loose and painful, and the gums bleed easily when spitting (sixth day), [1].
Stitches in the right side, when walking in the open air, [1].
