*Rush of blood to the head, like a slight pressure over the head, [1].
Hard difficult stool, also mingled with mucus, [1].
Dull pressing pain in the molar teeth, with pain in the submaxillary glands (after twenty-four hours), [1].
Slight sensitiveness of the whole scalp (one hundred and ninth day), [45b].
Reappearance of menses which had been suppressed for four months (after eighteen days), [1].
Thin pus flows out of the ear, with itching, [1].
Hair came out much, in the morning, on combing it, [44d].
Feeling of looseness of the teeth, in the evening, [1].
Constipation succeeding a relaxed state of the bowels, [8].
Sudden aching tension in the left side of the occiput (eighth day), [25].
A roundish bright-red spot on ball of right hand, with violent itching, not relieved by scratching, evening, [2].
*Vertigo, in the morning, with some nosebleed, [1].
In the morning, itching and smarting in both eyelids (fifth day), [36c].
The food will not go down, [1].
Long unrefreshing sleep (after twenty-three days), [1].
Very weak in the morning, with uneasiness in the abdomen, [1].
Copious secretion of mucus from the Meibomian glands (fifth day), [36c].
Tired feeling, in the morning (tenth day), [35].
Languid dull feeling, at 8 P.M. (twentieth day), [20].
Craving for food (after three hours and a half, second day), [42].

Fine stitching in the scapula, also extending into the side of the chest, only when sitting and walking fast; during moderate walking it ceases, so also when leaning on the painful spot; mostly in the evening and afternoon, [1].
Eructation and hiccough, alternating, [1].
Itching on the eyes, [1].
He must spit a great deal, [1].
The white of the eye reddened (third day); redness of conjunctiva less (fourth day), [36].
Severe pain in uterus and left ovary (seventh day); pains in uterus very severe; pains pass down into the vagina (eighth day), [21].
In the morning he blew some blood-streaked mucus from the nose (thirteenth day), [28].
Accumulation of much mucus in the larynx, which is difficult to cough up, but easy to swallow, even with deep inspiration (after twenty-four hours), [1].
No appetite for dinner (ninth day), [32].
Vibratory contraction in the top of the head, in the evening, [1].
Profuse sweat on waking, at 5.30 A.M.; afterwards, on walking, even against cold winds (twenty-fifth day), [20].
Stitches in the forehead, in the evening, which afterwards constantly became more violent, [1].
Much weakness in the lower limbs, [1].
Immediately after a meal feeling of soreness in throat, like a cramp at the inner side of the cervical vertebræ, [1].
Yellow, glutinous, strong-smelling liquid drops from the nose two mornings and evenings, without coryza, [1].
Profuse sweat in the face, after eating warm food, [1].
About 2 P.M. severe pain in a circumscribed spot, about one and a half inches in diameter, immediately over the spleen, deep; this continued until 3 P.M. (second day), [35].
Falling out of the hair, [1]; (twelfth day), [34].
Pressive headache at vertex, [9].
During a week, spasms as from nervous weakness, lasting a day at a time, pulse somewhat weak, then again spasmodic, [1].
At 5 P.M., fluttering before the left ear (sixth day), [21].
The left auricle is painful, as if sore on a limited spot (one hundred and nineteenth day), [45b].
Pain in almost all the teeth, during dinner, [1].
Troubled with eructations of offensive sour-smelling gases, for five days (after three days), [23].
Looks ill (twelfth day), [34]; (sixth day), [45c].
Slight nausea after lunch (fifth day), [38].
At night during sleep, severe bruised pain and exhaustion in the thighs and upper arm, but only during slumber, on awaking it passed off immediately, [1].
Single sharp stitches within the left ear, [2].
Dryness of the mouth, throat, and tongue, which in the morning were quite rough, [1].
Some flatulence, in the evening (eighteenth day), [20].
Two days before the menses shuddering again and again over the whole body the entire day, [1].
Distressing dry coryza, causing obscuration of the head, especially after eating, [1].
Vision is impeded by fiery zigzags before the eyes, [1].
Severe shooting pain in the left temple from 12 to 7 P.M.; pains also higher up about the anterior inferior angle of parietal bone (ninth day), [38].
She becomes much heated from a little walk, [1].
Burning in the outer canthus frequently during the day for one hour, [1].

Sensation as if an inflammation of the eye were about to come on (second day); in the morning, on awaking, prickling, causing him to scratch, itching and smarting in the lids (third and fourth days); itching and smarting in the lids much diminished; towards evening it went off completely (fifth day), [36a].
The left side of the tongue and throat and left nostril covered with small vesicles (sixth day), [21].
Feverish chilliness, with alternation of heat, till in the night, [1].
Tensive pain in the calf (after fourteen days), [1].
Cutting in the toes as with a knife, at night, mostly when lying on the back, with redness of the tips of the toes; by morning the pain has all gone (after forty-one days), [1].
Great exhaustion in the morning during menses, [1].
4 P.M., chilliness, with heat in the forehead, lasting half an hour, [1].
Felt tired and weak about breakfast time (twenty-fifth day), [20].

Beating in the top of the head, very painful from the slightest motion, on turning the eyes and on moving the head or body, as if it would force outwards, also indistinct beating during perfect quiet, [1].
Dryness of the mouth, after eating, [1].
Nosebleed the third evening during the menses, [1].
Intermitting pressure directly over the right hip, a little toward the spinal column, [2].
Perspired very freely, wetting my clothes around the waist (I perspire very freely at all times), (tenth day), [22].
Three thin acrid stools per day, followed by protrusion of the hæmorrhoids, from which ooze a moisture, and which when sitting are exceedingly painful (after twelve days), [1].
Great appetite, which, however, could not be freely indulged; a small quantity of food caused troublesome distension (second and third days), [17e].
Much itching in the eyebrows, and in the tip of the nose, [1].
Many gelatinous stools, with pains in the abdomen, [1].
Pain in the left side of the occiput, as from congestion of blood, after waking from sleep, [1].
Twitching of both orbiculares palpebrarum, which was relieved by going into the open air (thirsty-sixth day); less severe (thirty-seventh day), [21].
Frequent short paroxysms of coryza, [1].
*Pressure in the forehead, mostly in the afternoon, during the menses, [1].
A white spot before the eyes, on looking into the air, [1].
A few sharp shooting pains in the vaginal orifice (nineteenth and twenty-third days), [20].
Scraping in the throat, in the evening, [1].
Pain, as if sprained, in the small of the back, over the hips, in the evening in bed and afternoons (after twelve days), [1].
After dinner, difficult hearing of left ear (first day), [20].
Slight drawing in the occiput (one hundred and ninety-fifth day), [45b].
Burning in the mouth, with eruption, about it, [1].
Pain across the lower part of the bowels (twentieth day), [22].

Cough frequently dry, whooping, and choking, with pain in the pit of the stomach, and scraping, raw, sore pain in the larynx, which is not felt when swallowing saliva; the cough does not awake her from sleep, but after awaking it becomes very severe and continuous; at times there is a rattling in the trachea, resulting in mucous expectoration, [1].
Painful thrusts in the right side of the head, in the evening while sitting, [3].
Uterine pains very severe; the uterus feels as if clutched and then suddenly released, causing nausea, at 7 P.M. (sixth day), [21].
Disagreeable cold feeling in the lower front teeth, [1].
The middle of the tongue is quite blistered, [11].
He cannot take a deep breath on account of a contracted feeling around the lower part of the chest, [1].
Lachrymation, feeling fatty, from both eyes, [2].
Great pain in both shoulders, [1].
Pressing pain on the chest, aggravated by certain motions, [1].
Stitching pain in the left lung and in the third toe of the right foot at the same time, of the same character, lasting but a few seconds (tenth day), [27].
Face pale during the perspiration (eleventh day), [23].

Urinated freely (after third dose); passed a little urine, 2 ounces, sp. gr. 1031 (at 11 P.M., first day), which presented next morning the following phenomena: Reaction slightly acid; deposit of a white adherent film; sediment at bottom of tube slightly pinkish; the sediment readily dissolved on slight heat (not by a few drops of nitric acid), and displayed under the microscope amorphous particles, and on standing a long time (forty-eight hours), crystals of uric acid appeared. At 8.15 A.M., passed 12 ounces urine, sp. gr. 1029; at noon, 9 ounces, sp. gr. 1023; total amount 53 ounces (a cold day), (second day). The urine of last night had a heavy white deposit, showing the same characters as before; 8.15 A.M. passed 15 ounces, sp. gr. 1021 (third day), [40a].
With the pain in the forehead, dryness and fine stinging in the mucous membrane of the nose, as from a cold in the head (second day), [44a].
Dulness of the head (after twenty-four hours), [1].
Profuse secretion of thick, yellow, purulent nasal mucus, for several days, [3].
Itching in the nose, [1].
Pinching pains in the testicle (first and second days), [1].
Leucorrhœa of mucus, clear as water, [1].
Little appetite, but much thirst, [1].
Obscuration of the head, frequently in the morning, when rising from bed, [1].
Slight stopped up feeling of the ears (one hundred and eighty-fourth day), [45b].
Toothache, which becomes accompanied by swelling of the cheek, [1].
The left lower extremity is jerked upward, in the forenoon, while sitting (after four days), [1].
Tearing in the left scapula, after slight exposure, [1].
The arm goes to sleep when resting the head on it, [1].
Sticking and burning in the outer canthi, with dimness of vision, in the evening, [3].
Headache, with pressure in the eyes, after eating, [1].
Bleeding of the gums, almost without cause, [1].
Painfulness of the hæmorrhoids when walking, [1].
Constant sweating and frequent itching in the left external auditory meatus (first day), [25e].
In the morning, itching in left eye, which is not only aggravated by rubbing, but extends all over the face (fifth day), [20].
Face red during the heat, [16].
Tearing in the upper part of the right side of forehead (after eight hours), [2].
Very disagreeable and acrid bitter taste in the mouth, after breakfast (fifty-sixth day), [45a].
Pressing drawing on the right false ribs, toward the back, passing off from motion or from rubbing, [2].
*Sore pain in both oral commissures, in the afternoon (eighth day), [44b].
Metallic taste in the mouth, like copper (immediately), [33a].
Pain in the abdomen, as if the intestines had been beaten to pieces, [1].
Aching on the eyelids (fifth day), [45c].
She is quite hot, then cold, with great faintness, [8].
She felt that she had a weight pressing on her thighs, momentary, [8].
Dull aching pain in chest, right side, near sternum, fourth and fifth ribs, 12 to 1 P.M.; pains in chest return (thirty-second day), [38].
Stitching and tearing in the heels, day and night, more pain when treading on them than when at rest; they were pale and cold, and felt numb, [1].
Toothache and inflammatory swelling of the gum, in the vicinity of a stump almost entirely destroyed (twenty-fourth day), [34].
Insipid taste, in the forenoon (second and thirteenth days), [30].
Toothache from the slightest draft of air, [1].

The menses, of an elderly female, which had been absent for two months, returned forty-eight days after taking the medicine, accompanied with drawing from the teeth into the cheek, which was swollen, [1].
Sensitiveness of the upper lip, which is quite dry (fifty-fifth day), [45a].

At night, drawing pains in the region of the left eyebrow and aching in the left eyeball, as if it were swelled out and pushed forward; the aching in the eyeballs only went off the following morning, after getting up (twenty-fifth day), [40].

He must urinate two or three times in an hour; pressure on the bladder, yet he must wait a long time before the urine comes, which then passes without pain; if he endeavors to retain the urine, he is attacked with anxiety and pressure on the bladder (after forty-eight hours), [1].
After a meal, pressure as from flatulence deep in the abdomen, to the right; later, in the side it is felt, only when moving the part and bending forwards, [2].
Frequent tingling in the ears (after twenty-four hours), [1].
Turbid clay-colored urine, with reddish sediment in the chamber, [3].
Frequent sneezing, and the sensation as if a cold were coming on, and frequent blowing from the nose of mucus mixed with blood (almost every morning), (first fifteen days), [28d].
Anorexia (second day), [26]; (twentieth day), [37].
Lips always hot, sticking, and burning, [1].
Before the menses sensation as if the genitals were dilated, [1].
No appetite, nothing tastes good to her, [1].

About midnight, a sort fainting fit, lasting for one-fourth hour, accompanied by profuse sweat, with consciousness, but without the ability to talk or to move a finger; in the midst of the paroxysm, he had a sort of dream in which he was fighting with a ghost; he had scarcely recovered from this faint before he fell into a second, with a dream of being lost in a forest, [1].
Tearing in the right thigh, when walking, with pain of the parts from touch, [1].
Dryness of the larynx, in the morning, [1].
Restless sleep, confused dreams, [9].
Some stitches in the crown of the head, [1].
Stitches in the head, over the ears, lasting several minutes, [1].
A kind of stupid weakness in the head while walking in the open air, with gloomy disagreeable, ideas for several minutes; at one time more, at another less, [1].
Very thirsty for cold water, drinking much and often, especially in evening, for five days (third day after last dose), [16].

Violent stupefying headache and shooting in the left side of the chest, lasting more than a quarter of an hour (thirty-second day); during the day, dull headache (thirty-seventh day); in the afternoon, stupefying headache (thirty-eighth day), [33].
Desire for coffee (third day), [18].
On the inside of the nose, especially on the alæ nasi, great itching and feeling as if the nose were swelled (twelfth day), [29a].
Short dry cough, which seems to come out of stomach, [19].
Bitter sourish taste in the mouth, at noon after eating, [1].
Itching on the chest (after four days), [1].
Boils on the thigh (after seventeen days), [1].
Some griping pains in the lower part of the bowels; passed away about 10 A.M. (eleventh day), [22].
Violent stitches in the rectum at night, [1].
Dreams frightful, of murder (sixteenth night), [20].
Severe fluent coryza, with great pain in the occiput, and painful drawing in the hips and thighs, for two weeks, [1].
Superficial drawing and boring in the head, more at night, on account of which she could not remain in bed; about midnight it extended into the temples, ear, and teeth (after six days), [1].
If he only thinks of past troubles, the pulse grows quicker and breath fails him, [1].
The hand becomes numb and goes to sleep if he holds anything tightly or carries anything, [1].
The candlelight fatigues the eyes when reading or writing, by causing a contractive sensation, [1].
Stitching pain in throat, when swallowing, [1].
*Pressive pain in the forehead, mostly in the forenoon, [1].
Local application of warmth relieves the pains, [1].
Salt sour taste in the mouth, while eating, [1].
Plugs in the nose (twenty-third day), [20].
Attack of heat every afternoon, from 1 to 6 o'clock, for several days, [1].
During eructations (in a very warm room), blood rises into the mouth, which he spits out, [1].
Very viscid nasal mucus (after twenty-four hours), [1].
Sweat on the feet, [7a].
Dull pain in the small of the back; tired feeling in the back; on sitting down he had to sit very straight (second day), [36].
Vertigo, in the morning in bed, when rising, as if everything in the room were in motion, [1].
External warmth was unbearable to her during the violent headache, yet she was chilly, [1].
Itching and burning of the eyes (fourth day), [36c].

In the afternoon, dryness of the nose (eighth day); dryness of nose (ninth day); dryness of nose (eighteenth day); dry feeling and aching in the nose (forty-third day); dryness of the nose (forty-seventh and forty-eighth days); tiresome dryness of the nose, in the morning (forty-ninth day); dryness of the nose (fifty-fifth and sixty-fifth days); dryness of the nose, in the morning (seventy-third day); dry feeling in the nose, at noon (one hundred and fourth day); sensitiveness and dryness of the mucous membrane of the nose (one hundred and fourteenth day); tiresome dryness of the nose (one hundred and thirtieth day); dry feeling and aching in the nose, especially its root, in the forenoon (one hundred and fifty-first day); dryness and aching in the nose severe (two hundred and seventieth day); dryness of the nose (two hundred and seventy-first and two hundred and seventy-second days), [45b].
Pricking in the skin, in the evening after he gets warm in bed, [1].
Pain in the tibia as from a bruise, [1].
Unpleasant taste in the morning, mouth dry and slimy, [1].
Short hacking cough, in the evening, after lying down, with expectoration of much pure coagulated blood, once every minute (after eight days), [4].
Nightly emissions, with sexual dreams (after twelve hours), [1].
Loss of breath by every, even the slightest, motion, [1].
Frequent and strong urging to urinate, [1].
Purulent mucus in the eyes (after three days), [1].
Eyes feel very sore, as if bruised (fourth day), [37].
Oppression of breathing in the evening, from pain under the right short ribs, which prevents the slightest motion, [1].
Slight sensitiveness and swelling of the gums on the right side of the lower jaw (sixtieth day), [45b].
4 P.M., I have a singular sensation about the pelvic region, a sort of weakness about the small of the back, pubic bones, and around the anus a dragging pain (third day), [37].

Passed a very restless night (second night); disturbed sleep (third night); do not feel rested, in the morning; sleep very much disturbed by laborious dreams (fourth night); very tiresome dreams (fifth night); very restless night, full of dreams; awaking often in fright (sixth night), [21].
Footsweat, particularly at the toes, for two weeks, [1].
Tensive pain in one side of the neck, as if it were swollen, [1].
Slow stitches in the left groin, from below upwards, during stool, [1].
Severe chilliness, lasting one hour, after which thirst, evening (after thirty-six hours); and morning (after forty-eight hours); he must lie down in bed, [1].

Feeling as if the bladder were full and its contents would fall out over the pubis, with constant desire to press them back; this feeling of distension of the bladder is quite different from the pressure downwards, as if everything would be pressed through the vulva (eighteenth day), [20].
Pain in the right side of the abdomen, [1].
A short tensive aching in the left side of the occiput (eighth day), [25].
Illusions of vision, as if her skin were yellow, [3].
Stitches in the penis, [1].
Pain at the upper part of the sternum, when coughing, [1].
Tearing and smarting as from pepper, posteriorly on the right side of the tongue, [2].
Grumbling in the abdomen, while lying down (after ten days), [1].
Inclination to cold feet, [1].
The glans is hot and itching, with soreness of the prepuce, [1].
Distortion of the left pupil, [1].
Hands hot, but moist, [19].
Cramp in the thigh, when walking, [1].
The anterior part of the palate is painful as if burned, [1].
Violent bellyache, so that she must bend herself double, [1].
It is hard for him to get up in the morning, as he has no desire to rise, [2].
Daylight dazzles the eyes and causes headache, [1].
Much cough, with expectoration, only before midnight, as soon as he gets into bed, not during the day (after fourteen days), [1].
Very tired and sleepy during the day, yet at night he sleeps well, [1].
The headache is better when lying down near an open window (three days after last dose), [16].
Diarrhœa, the first days, [1].

Violent stitches outwards over the left orbit, with complete drawing together of the eye, for three successive days, after arising in the morning, continuing until noon, somewhat relieved in the open air, [5].
Cracking in the knee-joints, [1].
Breathing much shorter, [1].
At night, great flow of water from the mouth (sixth day), [25].
Constant feverish shivering with the noonday rest, [1].
Stitches and cutting in the hollow of the knee, [1].
Stoppage of the nose (second day), [26].
Eyelids heavy, with much frontal pain, [9].
Easy bleeding of the gums (fourteenth day), [34a].
Cramp in the second toe, [1].
Great protrusion of hæmorrhoids, when walking, [1].
Little appetite, yet he relishes what he eats, [1].
Itching on the left nipple; it bleeds occasionally, and seems as if it would ulcerate, [1].
Flickering before the eyes when looking into light; he sees a zigzag circle of colors, [1].
Pains in various parts of the body (second day), [28].
*Tearing as with a saw in the head, [1].
Disturbance in the head, so that she thought she had lost her reason, [8]. [Revised by Hughes.]
Heaviness in the feet, when walking, [1].
Burning and easy fatigue of the eyes when reading, [1].
Headache in the forehead, as from catarrh in the head, [1].

Severe pelvic pain, commencing in the sacrum, passing forward and down to the right knee, at 7.30 A.M.; the only relief I found was pressing against something hard, which relieved all the pain, but by crossing my limbs the pelvic pain was relieved, but the pain in the knee was much aggravated (third day), [21].
Shooting pain in the right temple (second day), [25f].
Left arm down to wrist feeling heavy and very cold, but hands hot, for five days (third day after last dose), [16].
Momentary stitches around the right lower ribs, towards the pit of the stomach, relieved by empty eructations, [2].
Yawning and stretching, in the morning, in bed, [1].
Violent cutting in the abdomen, in the morning, [1].
Dull frontal headache, at 3 P.M. (second day), [35].
Cannot bear reflected light from bright objects (twenty-third day); annoyed by reflections from bright objects (twenty-sixth day), [20].
*Some blows through the whole head, [1].
Leucorrhœa, as clear as water (after twenty-two days), [1].
General languid feeling of the whole body (fifth day), [35].
The mucus brought away on blowing the nose has streaks of blood in it (twenty-seventh day), [28c].
Swelling of the eye, with headache on the same side, [1].
Pressure in the stomach, in the evening, followed by headache, [1].
Trembling of the thigh and knee, without chilliness, with jerking in the muscles of the thigh, [1].
Abdomen much puffed up after dinner, [1].
*The vertex is very sensitive when touched, and when not, [3].
In the morning when waking, weak feeling, as from nausea, [2].
Pressive weight in the head, in the temples above the forehead, as if the head were too full of blood, as during a severe chill, [1].
Much yawning noon and afternoon, after taking a walk, [1].
Some transient stitches behind the left ear, in the evening (twenty-fourth day), [45a].
Throbbing headache, in the evening, [1].
Pressure on the upper part of the sternum, like a weight, [1].
*In two hours, when in bed, he had a violent rush of blood to the head, and felt all the arteries in his head beating (first day), [23].
Pressive pain, as if on something sore, in left side of occiput, [1].
Constant headache, [66].
Sharp tingling pains in the tips of the fingers (twenty-sixth day), [38].
The urine when standing becomes turbid and offensive, with white sediment (first to fourth day), [1].

Suffered from constipation, which caused bleeding, and weight and pain in the rectum (twenty-third day); stool with less pain (twenty-fourth day); during the past ten days I have suffered much from constipation and from piles, with severe pains across the lower part of the abdomen, extending down the inside of the thighs, both abdomen and thighs feeling sore to touch (fortieth day), [22].
Violent throbbing headache at night (after twenty days), [1].
Pressure in the eyes as if sleepy, every evening, without sleepiness, [1].

In the afternoon, in addition to a frequent alternation of the already-described pains in the head and joints, there occurred a violent cramplike tensive pain close to the right mastoid process (when at rest), which seemed to pierce into the deepest parts of the bone; it lasted for a few seconds, and then made way for a shooting pain in the right temple (second day), [25f].
Vision as through a veil (twentieth day), [34].

Almost uninterrupted heat of the whole body, with redness of the face and sweat of the head and body, accompanied by severe headache, like a heaviness, also palpitation of the heart and trembling of the whole body; after the heat, chilliness and coldness, with deadness of the hands, lasting four days, [1].
Drawing-stitching pain in the internal ear, from within outwards, [1].
So exhausted from a half hours walk, that he became sick at the stomach and could not breathe; the air-passage seemed drawn together as far down as the pit of the stomach, [1].
In the forenoon, smarting in the nose and left eyelid (fifth day), [42a].
A cold spot constantly on the top of the head, [1].
Pressing in the left ear for a quarter of an hour, in the morning when awaking, [1].
Severe dry coryza (after four and six days), [1].
*Aching in the frontal bone (first, second, and third days), [29b].

A distinct chill at 9 A.M., followed by fever, with chilliness across the stomach and bowels, and chilliness between the shoulders; the sweat that followed the fever was exceedingly offensive and pungent; her feet, which had always been subject to perspiration (not offensive), now gave forth a most offensive odor (third day). One hour after a dose she felt a coldness between the shoulders, and then a general chilliness over the body, followed by sudden loss of strength and weakness about the chest, and she broke out into a profuse perspiration over the chest and neck; the hands and feet became cold as ice; her face pale; she thought she should vomit, but was relieved on getting up and moving about (eleventh day), [23].
Yellow leucorrhœa (after twenty-four hours), [1].
Stitches in the left chest, when coughing (after six days), [1].
Stupefied feeling in the head, with tightness on the chest and weakness of the whole body, [1].
Heat and swelling of the margin of the anus, [1].
In the morning on awaking, and after dinner, aching and sore pain in the gums of the lower jaw, on the right side (ninety-eighth day), [45b].
Pain in the submaxillary glands, as if bruised; also painful when touched, [1].
Paroxysms of obscuration of the eyes, while walking in the open air, with violent pressure and beating in the head, nausea and weakness (sixth day), [1].
Aching pain at the coccyx, just before the action of the bowels; it was intolerable, and shot across her with such severity that she had frequently to lie down and cry, [9].
On moving, at 6 A.M., pain in abdomen, with sudden urging to stool (eighteenth day), [20].

After stool, severe stitching pain in the transverse colon, beginning in the splenic flexure and passing to the hepatic flexure, and there passing off slowly; much aggravated by walking, but relieved by sitting down (second day), [21].
Violent nosebleed, in the morning on blowing the nose, [1].
Inflammation of the throat, [1].
Turbid urine with constant desire to urinate, [10].
For half an hour teasing aching in the left ear, about noon (sixth day), [44d].
Inflammation in the nose (after nine days), [1].
Pain in back and sacrum (eleventh day), [44a].
Bitter taste in the mouth, with dulness of the head and ill-humor, [1].
Drawing pain in a sound tooth, when the air got into the tooth, not when in the cold air, [1].
Scalp for a long time thickly covered with scabs, [39a]. [Up to the age of fifteen I had been frequently troubled with ringworm.]
Violent colic and faintness before the menses, [1].
Deepseated, tensive, dull pain in the lumbar region (right side), (third day), [36].
Itching on the outer side of the sole of left foot, [2].
Itching of the anus, even during the day, [1].
In the evening, violent shooting in the upper lid (fourth day), [42a].
Rush of blood to the nose, especially in the open air, [1].
Bitter taste of all food, with very coated tongue, [1].
Radiating pains up the back of the neck and occiput (three or four days after ceasing to take the medicine), [29a].
Dizziness in the head, in the afternoon (soon, sixth day); dizziness, in the morning, soon after getting up, that lasted till 5 P.M. (seventh day), [44a].
Sore pain in the ear, [1].
Constant dull heavy pain in sacrum and abdomen, extending to thighs and legs (ninth day); some pain in sacrum and hips, not severe, in the afternoon (tenth day), [44a].
High fever, with rash, [10].
Gnawing in the bones in front of the left ear; also on swallowing, [3].
Frequent eructation after eating and drinking, [1].
It had almost entirely disappeared, [39a].
Burning in the left ala nasi, lasting for several minutes, and frequently recurring, in the morning (second day), [18d].
About 3 P.M., feeling of fine sand between the right eye and lid (second day), [36c].
Drawing pain in the shoulder-joint, in the morning in bed, lasting one hour after rising, [1].
Cramplike penetrating pain in the right mastoid process, in the morning (fourth day), [25f].

Pressure and heavy weight in the ovaries, and a pressure to pass water (after one hour, eighth day); (I usually pass water twice a day, night and morning); increased pain in the ovaries, dull and heavy (after second dose, eighth day), [22].
Twitching of the lower lid every day, [1].
*Pain, as if the brain were beating against the skull, always on nodding the head, [1].
Creeping sensation on the inner margin of the left orbit, [2].
Dull aching frontal headache (left side), (fifth day), [36].
Very sleepy at 9 A.M. (sixteenth day); 8 P.M., sleepy, with chilly sensations in the back (twentieth day); great drowsiness, at 9 A.M. (twenty-third day), [20].

In the morning, taste clammy (fourteenth day); clammy taste (seventeenth day); awoke with clammy taste in the mouth (twenty-sixth day); clammy taste, morning, noon, and evening (twenty-seventh day); clammy taste, in the morning (forty-eighth day), [29].
Dull aching pain over the whole head, lasting nearly three hours, and then gradually going off (after half an hour, ninth day); less troublesome (tenth day), [22a].
Stitches in the right side, in the morning, after a half sleep, [2].
Sensation of coldness in the stomach, [7a].
A sensation under the skin of the face as if dashed with cold water, with perceptible coldness of the face, in paroxysms, lasting a few minutes, [1].
Old symptoms reappear, towards evening (ninth day), [38].
A large blister on each upper arm with violent itching, [1].
At 5 P.M., had a slight chill; at 6 P.M., flushes of heat, the skin getting slightly moist (fourth day), [33].
At noon, after walking much, I felt hungry without much appetite; without feeling satiated, the latter part of the meal was not relished (second day), [30].
Jerking motion in the left biceps of the upper extremity, lasting an hour, in the evening (seventh day), [20].
Tongue coated white, [1], [29].
Pressing pain on the lower left ribs, even from touch, [2].

On waking from a lewd dream, found my abdomen covered with semen; it was the first time for a long while that I had had an emission (third night); had a seminal emission, unconscious of it until I waked; no dream; did not wake until morning (sixth night), [27]
Ravenous hunger, and if it is not appeased, water accumulates in the mouth, [1].
Restless in bed, in the evening, he wakes very early in the morning, [1].
Vertigo, only when walking in the open air, she must be led, [1].
Fainting fit, in the forenoon (after twenty-three days), [1].
Woke at 3 A.M., could not sleep again for an hour or two; at last went to sleep lying on face (twenty-second night), [20].
When sitting he is sleepy, and when reading he falls asleep, [1].
Menses fourteen days too early (after a few hours), [1].
*Headache only on ascending steps, [1].
Vertigo, while sitting; reeling while standing, [1].
Protrusion of a humid painless hæmorrhoid from the anus after a natural stool, [1].
Intense itching of the skin, [10].
Profuse general nightsweat, from evening till morning, [1].
Sleeplessness at night, on account of rush of thoughts, [1].
Severe pain in the shoulder-joint (could cry out), as if it would tear off; pain is relieved for one fourth of an hour by much belching, [1].
Undulating pain in the upper part of the femur, [2].
A sore bruised feeling in the left elbow, in the region of the ulnar nerve (sixth day), [30].
Severe pain at the cardiac orifice of the stomach, when food is descending, [1].
Woke with hands clasped, lying on right side; right hand felt numb, possibly from lying on it (eighth day), [15].
Severe dry coryza, with roaring in the head and ears (after twenty-four hours), [1].
Rawness in the chest, as of raw flesh, [1].
Wine-red spots on the neck and under the chin, without sensation, [5].
Violent coryza (after fifth and seventeenth days), [1].
Burning in the anus, [1].
Spasm of the bladder, [3].
Agglutination of the eyes, two mornings (after twenty days), [1].
Tension in the elbow, as if too short, [1].
Much scurf on the head (for forty days), [1].

Pulse, A.M., 84; P.M., 80 (forty-first day before the proving); P.M., 84 (fortieth day); A.M., 83; P.M., 80 (thirty-ninth day); A.M., 80; P.M., 78; (thirty-eighth day); A.M., 72; P.M., 73 (thirty-seventh day); A.M., 76; P.M., 78 (thirty-sixth day); A.M., 75; P.M., 75 (thirty-fifth day); A.M., 76; P.M., 72 (thirty-fourth day); A.M., 73; P.M., 78 (thirty-third day); A.M., 74; P.M., 77 (thirty-second day); A.M., 73; P.M., 75 (thirty-first day); A.M., 74; P.M., 72 (thirtieth day before the proving); A.M., 90; P.M., 80 (third day of proving); A.M., 82; P.M., 80 (fourth day); A.M., 80; P.M., 75 (fifth day); A.M., 74; P.M., 75 (sixth day); 1 P.M., 80; 6 P.M., 74 (seventh day); A.M., 74 (eighth day), [37].
Colic, in the morning, quite low down in the pelvis, pressing outward, twisting and contractive, [3].
Griping cutting in the bowels, with groaning anxiety, as if an involuntary stool would pass, [1].
Great faintness, with heat and then coldness, [8].
Feels very faint when walking out of doors, in the evening, for five days (three days after last dose), [16].
Constant aching pain in the back of the neck (right side), generally better after dinner, in the evening (third day), [36].
Internal chilliness in the warm room the whole day, for several days, [1].
*Sticking headache in the temples, [1].
Restless sleep, for several weeks, with many dreams and tossing about, later quiet sleep, [1].
Shivering several times a day, without chilliness, [1].
Tearing just under the right knee, anteriorly (after thirty-two hours), [2].
Hands generally cold, but moist with perspiration (fourth day), [20].
Tearing around the knees and malleoli, only when sitting and lying, [1].
Smarting pain as from dryness of the margins of the lids, [1].
Ulcerated nostrils, which had troubled me for some weeks, were much relieved), (second day), [24].
All parts of the body on which she lies or sits are painful, [1].
When at stool, profuse flow of saliva into the mouth (second day), [18d].
Swollen dark-red gums, with painful throbbing, as if beginning to suppurate, so severe that it was scarcely endurable, [1].
Occasional sharp shooting pain in the left lung, on expiration (eighteenth day), [20].
Aching-boring pains in the temples and ears (seventeenth day), [29].
Lascivious dreams, with erections, disturbing his sleep at night, [11].
Abundant discharge of water-colored urine (second day), [1].
Dulness in the head, with pressure in the eyes, aggravated by walking in the open air, [1].
Drawing and sticking in the nape of the neck, even when at rest, arresting the breath, [1].
Jerking in the lids, mostly in the afternoon, [2].
Violent drawing pain in an incisor, lasting till 11 P.M., followed by sleeplessness till towards morning, [1].
Pressure in the right eye, as from a grain of sand, aggravated by rubbing; felt most sensitively when pressing the eyelids together, [2].
Painful turning and crawling in the temples, [1].
Redness of the face and perspiration after dinner, [1].
Sick pale look, in the morning, with dim red eyes, [1].
I notice that my lips are cracking; they feel very dry (fifth day), [37].

Heavy pressing pain over the left eye, extending towards the side of the head, about 3.30 P.M.; sensation of great fulness deep in the left orbit, at 4 P.M.; headache confined to the left side, better in the evening; made worse by shaking the head; better in the open air; when I went to bed, 11.30 P.M., very slight headache (first day); occasionally darting pains, extending from the left eye over the side of the head towards the occiput; the pain in the left orbit and left side of the head continued all day long, as described yesterday, a heavy pressing pain or fulness, with occasional darts through the eyeball and side of the head; headache better after meals (second day); about 8 o'clock, had some pain, as yesterday, and it lasted all day; no particular time of aggravation; headache aggravated by mental labor (third and fourth days); awoke in the morning with slight headache, which grew worse towards 9 A.M., lasting so for about an hour, when it abated (fifth day), [31].
Many black spots before the eyes, [1].
Intense headache, frontal and temporal, [12].
Severe stitches in the occiput, extending toward the vertex, [1].
Tearing in the first phalanx of the right index finger, [2].
Sudden transient deafness, as if from a plug in the ear, [1].
Bloated feeling in the lower part of the bowels, with dull aching in the ovaries, and a return of the heavy feeling in the head, with sleepiness (fourth day), [22].
Dryness of the lips, [1].
Sensitiveness of the eyes to daylight (in two hours, fifth day), [36c].
Stoppage of the nose, violent sneezing (twentieth day); coryza continues (twenty-second and twenty-third days); diminished (twenty-fourth day), [34].
Dark redness and heat of the face, especially on walking in the open air, [1].
First great distension of the abdomen, then severe rumbling and motion therein, [1].
Numbness of the fingers of right hand, evening, [1].

I got up in the morning with boring pain over the right eye, and rheumatic pain in the region of the insertion of the temporal muscles of the coronoid process, which was entirely relieved for a few minutes after eating and while eating; this pain was worse on the right side, although it slightly extended to the left side in the same region, and into the right temporal region (fifth day), [27].
*Sensation of heaviness in the crown, [1].
Heat in the feet, at night, [1].
Pain in the right groin, near Pouparts ligament, following the pain in the left testicle; this remained constant; I never felt this symptom before (sixteenth day), [34].
Colic pain in upper part of abdomen, above umbilicus (after eight hours and a half); occasional pains (fourth day), [44a].
Burning in the urethra, [1].
Leucorrhœa, with itching in the vagina (after three days), [1].
Hard, dry, concussive cough (third day); continued four or five days, [32].
Rush of blood to the head, even during a soft stool, and after riding in a wagon, [1].
Great swelling of the lower lip, in the morning, [1].
Very painful inflamed swelling of the nose, [1].
Before the menses, burning in the pudendum, [1].
Screaming, at night, during sleep, [1].
Much itching in the weak ear, daily, [1].
Felt sleepy after eating, at 4.30 P.M., and went to sleep, sleeping until 7.30 P.M. (second day), [35].
Breathing difficult rather than short, [1].
The teeth are very painful when touched and when talking, [1].
Complexion showed a remarkable change; it had a dirty earthy appearance (sixth day), [29a].
Cold knees, at night, [1].
Loss of appetite (fourteenth day), [16]; (ninth day), [22b]; (seventeenth and following days), [27]; (fourth day), [44a].
Tearing in the knee and elbow-joints (after sixteen days), [1].
Small painful sore blisters in the mouth, even slightly salted food causes biting, [1].
Burning of the upper lids, [1].
Intense headache, with sensation that his head and ears were suffered, [51].
Sensation in the left lower extremity as if a mouse were running up and down, [1].
Severe stitches in the anus, particularly when drawing the anus inwards and from external pressure, [1].
Swelling of the inner mouth and gums, with burning in the mouth extending into the throat, [1].
Sick all day in my room (second, third, and ninth days), [20].
Pain, as from subcutaneous ulceration, in the external auditory meatus, when putting the finger in it, [1].
Violent cutting transversely across the abdomen, as from flatulence, passing off from motion, accompanied by cutting in the left testicle, [1].
Sleepless at night, without anything to complain of, only she cannot lie quiet (after twenty days), [1].
Frequent awaking at night, on account of drawing pain, extending from the molar teeth to the forehead, [1].
Passed a great deal of flatus all day, which did not relieve (second day); a great deal of flatus from vagina and rectum, without relief (third day), [21].
Pressure on the stomach, as from a stone, [1].
Headache, at night, as if the skull would be torn open, [1].
Painful distension of the abdomen, while riding in a carriage, [1].
Pinching in the throat, from larynx upwards, [1].
Stitching pressure in the left great toe, more during rest than when walking, [1].
Pinching pain in one side of the head, in paroxysms, [1].
Starting in the noonday sleep, [1].
Burning sore pain in the upper part of the left chest, even from touch, [2].
*Tension in the forehead, [1].
Dryness of the eyes, [1], [3].
Much yawning and stretching, [1].
Attacks of crawling in the thighs down to the toes, frequently lasting one-fourth of an hour, a number of days in succession, [1].
A kind of creeping feeling occasionally felt in the head, especially on the parietal and occipital regions (one hundred and eleventh day), [45b].
Transient aching in left eyeball (fifth day), [36].
Emptiness and lax feeling in the abdomen, after stool, [1].
Drawing-aching pains in the occiput to the nape, in the forenoon (one hundred and fifty-eighth day), [45b].
Looks ill; has double rings around the eyes (two hundred and seventy-eighth day), [45b].
At noon, for half an hour, great itching of the left eye, with lachrymation (ninetieth day), [45b].
Violent cutting in the anus and rectum at night, [1].
She groans and grunts at night, during sleep, without remembering any bad dreams, [1].
Headache, most severe towards evening, particularly when shaking the head, [1].
At night, during frequent waking, stitches in the tip of the elbow, [1].
*Headache, with nausea, [1].

Attack of nausea, in the forenoon, after taking a walk, black before the eyes, had no appetite; heat before dinner, with pain in all the limbs; the nausea continued, he had headache, and in company, weakness, even to fainting; every trifle affected him and he was easily startled, [1].
Weakness and aching in the thighs, especially when going upstairs (eleventh day), [44a].
Smarting in the right eye, in the evening, with inclination of the lids to close against one's wish, [1].
Tongue red and clean; the papillæ elevated; it feels as if burnt (twenty-second day), [20].
Itching pimples on the scalp (first fourteen days), [1].
Frequent trembling of the whole body (after ten days), [1].
Pale yellow urine without sediment by day or night, [2].
Sore pain in the rectum mostly between the stools, and like an outward pressing, even when lying, in attacks at regular intervals, accompanied by hæmorrhoids, painful when touched, [1].
Very feverish (fourth and following days), [21].
Irresistible desire for sugar, [1].
Dryness and soreness in throat; at night it feels quite parched, [11].
Drawing pain in the back teeth, aggravated by inhaling cold air, [1].
Drawing cold feeling in single upper incisors, [1].
Burning in the eyes, with redness of them (thirty-third day); redness of eyes much diminished (thirty-fourth day), [16].
Painful smarting of the eyes, [58].
Painful eruption on the tip of the nose, [1].
Stitching headache in both temples, in the evening, [1].
Sensation as if drops came from the bladder (which was not the case), particularly when at rest, [1].
Cracking in the ear, or like the bursting of bubbles, [1].
Drawing and stitching in all the fingers of the left hand, [1].
Putrid-tasting mucus on the tongue, [1].
Empty feeling in the stomach, [1].

8 ounces of urine A.M., 18 ounces at noon, 10 ounces 10.30 P.M.; total, 36 ounces; sp. gr. 1022, A.M.; 1015, noon; 1022, 10.30 P.M. (thirty-fourth day); 12 ounces, A.M.; 8 ounces, noon; 12 ounces, 10.30 P.M.; total, 32 ounces; sp. gr. 1020, A.M.; 1014, noon; 1022, 10.30 P.M. (thirty-fifth day); 9 1/2 ounces, A.M.; 8 ounces, noon; 10 ounces, 10.30 P.M.; total, 27 1/2 ounces; sp. gr. 1016, A.M.; 1020, noon; 1015, 10.30 P.M. (thirty-sixth day); 8 ounces, A.M.; 20 ounces, noon; 7 ounces, 10.30 P.M.; total, 35 ounces; sp. gr. 1015, A.M.; 1014, noon; 1024, 10.30 P.M. (thirty-seventh day); 9 1/2 ounces, A.M.; 10 ounces, noon; 12 ounces, 10.30 P.M. (4 ounces, 1016, midnight); total, 35 1/2 ounces; sp. gr. 1020, A.M.; 1010, noon; 1016, 10.30 P.M. (thirty-eighth day); 10 ounces, A.M.; 11 ounces, noon; 10 ounces, 10.30 P.M. (9 ounces, 1026, midnight); total, 40 ounces; sp. gr. 1018, A.M.; 1016, noon; 1024, 10.30 P.M. (thirty-ninth day), [39a].
Hoarse, this evening (third day), [37].
Painful pimples on the forehead, [1].
Moist scalp, [1].
Uneasiness in the limbs (after six days), [1].
Beating in the side of the head on which she lies, [1].
If she eats a little too much, the next day she has a horribly sour, offensive taste, [1].
Much oppression, particularly when walking, [1].

Heaviness and confusion of the sinciput (after twenty minutes, twelfth day); heaviness, confusion, and dulness of the sinciput, morning, noon, and evening (twenty-seventh day); frequent awaking, with feeling of weight and dulness in the sinciput (thirtieth night); dulness and confusion of the sinciput (nine one hour, fiftieth and fifty-first days), [29].
Stitching pain in both sides of lower abdomen, [1].
Drawing pains in the corns, in the evening, [1].
Very thirsty, in the morning, [1]; (fifth day), [20].
Uneasiness in the abdomen, as if diarrhœa would set in, passing off from emission of flatus, [1].
Burning pain above and beneath the eyebrows, every afternoon, [2].
Pimple near the right nostril, which afterwards formed a large scab, [1].
Itching on the eyeballs, [1].
In the morning after awaking, palate dry (fourth and fifth days), [29a].
Drawing pain in the knee-joints, evenings, [1].
Fever and sickness all day, with thirst, [9].
Very restless sleep, she felt that she had a weight pressing on her thighs, momentary, [8].
*Lachrymation in the morning, followed by dryness, [1].
Violent cutting in the stomach, extending up to the breast, with constant motion of flatus, which cannot find exit (after four days), [1].
Orgasm and congestion of blood to the chest, as if hæmoptysis would follow, [1].
Stitch in the right mammary gland, the worst when getting cold while walking or riding, yet she could neither see nor feel anything wrong there, [1].
About 10 A.M., a pretty violent drawing in the left temple, which only lasted a short time (second day), [25f].
Fluttering noises in the ear, [1].
Smarting pain in both eyes, [1].
Frequent attacks of cutting pains in the abdomen; she must draw herself quite together for a couple of minutes, [1].
Giddiness in the head, she can scarcely carry it, [1].
Dryness of the inner surface of the lids, [1].
Burning pain to the left and below the navel, [2].
Sensation of swelling and ulceration on the left side of gums, especially the upper jaw, at noon (third day), [18].
Rheumatic drawing in the left side of the head, [1].
Pressing pain at the root of the nose, [1].
Congestion to the anus soon after dinner (after five and twelve days), [1].
Cutting in the rectum in the afternoon, drawing towards the lower part of abdomen, followed by unsuccessful bearing down and pressing to stool, [1].
Thirst, [76].
Accumulation of flatus in the abdomen, immediately after walking in the open air, [1].
Bitter taste in the palate and throat, in the morning on waking, relieved by coughing up mucus, [1].
Very dry tongue, in the morning, [1].
Screwing-together pain in the left side of the head, [3].
Slimy diarrhœa, with distended abdomen, [1].
Sudden hoarseness (after seven days), [1]
Pressive contractive pain in the top of the head (the first days), [1].
Nosebleed two afternoons in succession, at 3 oclock, followed by pain in the nose on touch, [1].
After lying down, slight drawing in the right ear (twelfth day), [28c].
Redness of the eyelids and conjunctiva (fourth day), [30].
A couple of jerks in the right temple near the ear (fifty-fifth day), [45a].
Painful thrust in the head when coughing, [1].
Copious secretion of earwax (fifty and fifty-first days), [29].
Sweat every other night, [1].
He sees only one-half of an object clearly, the other half is obscured, [1].
Intense headache, in the morning on waking and after getting up, [1].

Violent headache on getting up; weight on the forehead; this pain is aggravated in the open air and when walking; a little later it becomes seated in the forehead and is pulsative (twelfth day), [15].
Diminished number of erections (curative effect), (first days), [1].
Vertigo, with qualmishness, [1]; (fifteenth day), [34a].
Tenesmus in the anus, with sensation of soreness, in attacks at intervals, [2].
Milk causes much distress; it is vomited curdled, [1].
Headache on waking; better after moving about (third, fourth, and fifth days), [24].
The swelling of the legs up to the knees increases during sitting or standing, passes off when walking, [1].
Distension of the abdomen, with diarrhœa and gripings, [1].
Hard stool, with cutting in the rectum, [1].
Red swelling on the forearm, with pain as from pressing on a suppurating boil, [1].

Tearing in the head, mostly in the sides and forehead, at times with drawing and sticking and ulcerating pain, and especially relieved or removed by moving the head, by pressing upon it, and by free air, [3].
Pressive headache, at 10 A.M.; towards 5 P.M. it increases; it feels as if the base of the brain were tightly compressed by a band (eighth day), [15].

At noon I notice soreness in location of a former congestion of liver (nineteenth day); the sore spot is felt on turning or reaching (twentieth day), and on moving suddenly (twenty-first and twenty-second days), [20].
Drawing in the teeth (eleventh day), [44f].

Slight adhesion and burning of the eyes, in the morning (eleventh day); burning in the eyes at noon (thirteenth day); burning of the eyes and lids, in the forenoon (fourteenth day); occasional slight burning in the eyes (seventeenth day), [45].
Tingling in the forearm, [1].
Stitches deep in the chest, [1].
Pupils much contracted, [1].
Pressure in the stomach, from morning until 1 P.M., [1].
Swelling at the orifice of the external auditory meatus; pressure near antitragus causes stitching pain, [1].
Feet cold and damp all day, feeling as though I stood in cold water up to my ankles (my feet are usually dry), (eleventh day), [22].
Pressure on the shoulder, at night, which felt as if it had gone to sleep and was sprained, [1].
Burning in the face and throat, without redness, [1].
Sharp pains in each ovary and pressure to pass water; the pains ceased after passing water; later in the day a dull heavy pain in left ovary (first day), [22].
Pain as if burned, on the anterior part of the palate just back of the teeth when touching it with the finger or tongue, [1].
Gurgling to the right of, near to the small of the back, [1].
The canthi of the eyes red and inflamed, slightly adhesive, and exuding a little (fifteenth day), [29].
Discharge of blood from the vagina, only when walking, [1].
A small spot in the lower part of the head, by the nape of the neck, hurts at times, and especially after scratching a sore burning, [1].
Feels dull and drowsy, [28a].
Pinching pain in the vertex and in the upper part of the occiput, with sore feeling, which at last became a burning, [2].
Frequent stitches pass under the hypochondria transversely through the epigastrium, so severe that she could cry out, [1].

Headache only in the sinciput, mostly toward the forehead; pressure on the brain passing off in half a minute, returning eight or ten times in an hour; it would then remain away for an hour or an hour and a half, returning the next day but not so severe (after twenty-three days), [1].
Vertigo, every afternoon from 3 to 5 o'clock, everything turns in a circle around her, when walking, sitting, and lying, [1].
Coldness over the whole body, [7a].
Boring pressing in the teeth and on the head externally for only a few minutes after eating, [1].
Rush of blood to the head (after five days), [1].
Intolerable itching inside of the nose, which is sore on scratching (after two days), [28].
In the evening, tiresome drawing and tearing (as during the first proving) in the left temporal region (second day), [39a].

In the course of the day the right nostril was sensitive to the touch and somewhat reddened (eleventh day); the whole of the right ala nasi and especially the septum narium was inflamed and painful to the touch; merely touching the hairs in the nose caused violent pain (twelfth day); inflammation of nose continues (thirteenth and fourteenth days); nose not so red and sensitive (fifteenth day); nose scarcely at all tender to touch, and covered with bran-like scales on the parts that had been inflamed (sixteenth day), [27a].
Speaking caused fatigue, if continued for any time (twelfth to twenty-third day), [38].
Heaviness in forehead and temples (after two hours), [38].
Very giddy at times, with dislike to all work, [1].
The arms go to sleep, even to the hands, particularly painful when they lie under the covers, in which case there is also a painful stiffness in them, [1].
Pressure to pass water with the pain in ovaries (eighth and twelfth days), [22].
Pressure in the stomach at night, for three successive nights, [1].
Sensation as if the vulva were enlarged (twenty-third day), [20].
*Feeling as of some heavy weight on vertex, [66].
Drawing and tearing in the scalp (one hundred and second day), [45a].
Violent pressure from without inwards below and in front of the right and left ear, [2].
The distress was all relieved on eating supper (ninth day), [20].
After a second stool, stiffness and sensation of hardness in the back, and tightness in the pit of the stomach, with oppressed breathing, [1].
Much matter in the eye, in the morning, for several days, [48].
At night, when going to sleep, lightning-like flashes before the eyes (eighth day), [38b].
Anxious trembling, with cold sweat on the forehead, [1].
Much chilliness and internal restlessness, in the morning, when awaking (after twenty-four hours), [1].
Smarting in the urethra, when urinating, [1].
Smarting in the forepart in the orifice of the urethra (after thirteen hours), [2].

Small painful pimples here and there on the scalp (eighth day); pimples gone (ninth day); several small pimples on the scalp (fifty-fifth day); in the evening, painful pimples here and there over the scalp (one hundred and thirty-fourth day); several small pimples on the head (one hundred and thirty-eighth day); small pimples on various parts of the scalp (one hundred and forty-seventh day); the pimples on the head are almost all there still (one hundred and fiftieth day) on the scalp, several small spots covered with scabs (one hundred and fifty-sixth day); the scabs on the scalp are loosening (one hundred and fifty-eighth day), [45b].

A sore spot in the abdominal walls, just to the right of the median line and three fingers' breadth below the umbilicus (eighteenth day); tender to pressure and from movement of muscles in walking (nineteenth day); sore spot noticed on pressure or sudden turning (twenty-first day), [20].
Pressive pain, as if sprained, immediately under the left shoulder-joint, in the back, [2].
After blowing the nose, discharge of yellow water from the nose, with cutting headache in the forehead, [1].
Coated tongue, [1].
Repeated flying tearing in both cheeks (thirty-first day), [28c].
Face pale and collapsed, with an expression of great anxiety, [51].
Heaviness in all the limbs, [1], [7a].
Stiffness of the nape of the neck, [1].

After a glass of beer, feeling of dryness in left nostril, and sensitiveness of the mucous membrane on inspiring the air of the room; the latter sensation went off almost entirely in the open air (nineteenth day), [22a].
Throbbing through chest and abdomen, as if the heart occupied the whole body (tenth day), [20].
The lips are sore, smarting, and disposed to crack, [9].
Pain in the abdominal muscles during motion, only at night, [1].
Great swelling of the face, without redness, [1].
Twitching at times on the malar bone, at times on the chin, [1].
Since taking the medicine, any break of the skin or a burn makes a sore which lasts a long time, an unusual thing, as my skin generally heals quickly (twelfth day), [22].
Spasmodic drawing in the jaws, [1].
Distressing itching in the nose, which is still stuffed (eighteenth day), [34a].
Hard and inflamed boil on right nates, [9].
Burning stitches in the heels wake her, several nights (after five days), [1].
Sudden paralyzed feeling in one leg, lasting two hours, [1].
Hiccough after a meal, lasting a quarter of an hour, [1].
Great aching between shoulders and under the left scapula, extending into the left lung, worse on expiration (fifteenth day), [20].
Vanishing of sight, [1].
Shooting in the inner sides of the tips of the fingers (fourth day), [38].
Averse to motion, with desire to stretch, and very sleepy, on waking at 6 A.M.; dulness all day and aversion to motion (twenty-second day), [20].
*Sensation of heaviness in the head, and dulness, as if he would fall forward, relieved while walking, but then a fine sticking in the head, [3].
Vertigo, worse soon after taking medicine (probably the effect of the alcohol), but lasting in a slight degree all day (second day); slight vertigo (immediately, ninth day), [22b].
Pains in hips and thighs, extending to near the knees (sixth day), [44a].
Stitches in the sides of the abdomen, for one hour, followed by difficult breathing, [1].
Heat in the tips of left toes, shooting like an electric spark through the left side up to the head, there leaving a troublesome weakness, lasting one half minute, [1].
The natural tension of the facial muscles gone, so that her features appear distorted, as if worn out by long suffering (fourth day), [31].
Itching of the lids, obliging him to rest them every moment, in the afternoon; the eyes can scarcely endure the light at all, in the evening (twelfth day), [15].
Slight burning in the septum of the nose, in the morning (third day), [45].
Sour taste in the mouth (after twenty days), [1].
Noise in the right ear, [1].
The least exercise fatigues, even going upstairs (after seven days), [16].
First a slight tickling in the left temple, then a sensation as if the skin were being drawn upwards, [2].
Tingling in the ears; at times in one, at times in the other, and difficult hearing with the tingling, [1].
Discharge of much more urine than would correspond to the quantity of drink taken (after thirty-six days), [1].
Drawing tension, like cramps in the calves, from the malleoli to the knees, [1].
Grumbling and motion of flatus in the abdomen, as in diarrhœa, [1].
Very tired in the morning, when rising from bed, [1].
One-sided, sharp, pressive headache beneath the left parietal bone immediately after supper, [1].
Wandering pains continue and seem to increase; particularly drawing and expanding pain in the side of the neck, [28a].
Stitches in the left eye, [1].
Gnawing and weakness in the stomach, which ceased at supper (twentieth day), [20].
Sleep disturbed through frequent cough, and from pain in the feet, [4].
Dulness of the head, as from violent coryza, with reeling, [1].
Burning pain on the tongue, [1].
Eruption on pubes increased (fourth day).
Inclination to sigh (after two days), [28].
Stitches in the middle joints of the fingers, [1].
Symptoms of threatened catarrh (fourteenth day); symptoms at height (fifteenth day); catarrh declined (sixteenth day), [16].
Dry, scaly, rough upper lip and margins of the nose, with burning, [3].
Swelling of the feet (after twenty-seven days), [1].
Painful sensation of hunger in the stomach, [1].
He awakes in the morning with great dyspnœa, and covered with sweat, lasting four hours, [1].
Hot lips, [1].
Yellow expectoration, tasting like rotten eggs, [1].
Thirst for several hours, immediately, [5].
Leucorrhœa increases, when she has frequent eructations and retching, she then becomes pale in the face, [1].
Sleep pretty good, but not refreshing; I spent hours enough in bed, but they did no good, [35].
Lassitude, at 9 A.M. (twenty-third day), [20].
Leucorrhœa, with stitches in the uterus (after twenty-five days), [1].
Emissions weak and watery, [5].
Fluent coryza, like water, [1].
Pressing pain in the upper abdomen, afternoons, [2].
Spasmodic contraction on the right side of lower abdomen, [1].
Very sleepy, inclined to sleep at any time (after seven days), [16].
Tearing stitches, so severe as to make him cry out, in the left thigh when at rest, afterward ulcerative pain at the same place, [1].
The water accumulates in his mouth in large quantities, like waterbrash, but passes off after eating, [1].
Distension of the abdomen and emission of flatus, when taking a walk, [1].
Burning in the face, recurring several times during the day (fourth day); occasional attacks (sixth to tenth day), [39b].
Sense of giddiness
Jerking of the leg when falling asleep, [1].
Burning and stitches in the corns, [5].
Swelling of inguinal glands in left thigh, painful on walking, [10].
Compression in the upper part of the head, the entire day, with great dyspnœa (after eleven days), [1].
I could scarcely open my eyes, which were agglutinated, with forcible closure of the lids; in the evening the light obliges me to shut them (fourteenth day), [15].
Fainting during a slow ride, [1].
Scurf in the eyebrows, lasting eight weeks, [1].
Pressure on the vertex after mental labor, [1].
Pain in the feet when walking in the open air, as if the tendon at the ankle was sprained, [1].
Sensation of fog in his head and dizziness, which makes him sad; ideas indefinite, with irresolution, [1].
Cutting pain in the nose, and discharge of thin fluid from it, in the evening (seventh day), [45].
Dry feeling and tensive pain in the left side of the palate, gradually extending to the right side, and lasting two days, in the morning (second day), [18d].
In the afternoon burning shooting beneath the lids of the left eye, as though sand had got into it (second day), [25c].
*Dulness of the head, after walking in the open air, [1].
The pain was relieved after eating, at 4.30 P.M. (second day), [35].
Hard pressure in the pit of stomach, as from a stone, even when fasting, but more severe from eating bread, [1].
He sleeps at night only from 10 to 4 o'clock, [1].
Corrosive itching of the scalp, [1].

In the evening swelling at the wrist-joint, at the bend of the elbow, and around the ankle-joint; the joints are stiff during motion; in the morning the swelling was gone, but the parts were painful to touch, [1].
Chilliness, commencing in the throat, three or four times, in the evening, for five days (third day after last dose), [16].
Rheumatic drawing in the testicles, also along side in the thigh, [2].
Urine unusually turbid, [11].
Rumbling, with distension of the abdomen, [7a].
Transient dull drawing pains in the right forearm and thigh (third day), [36].
Dulness in the sinciput (after three hours and a half), [2].
*Headache pressing out at the forehead, [3].
Drawing extending from the right hip to the sole of the foot, the entire day (after eight days), [1].
Menses anticipated one day the first month and two days the second month; afterwards they came at the proper time, [24].
Singing before the ears, [1].
Drawing pressure under the right scapula, at one time more in the back, then again in the side, especially felt when siting with the arm held out free from the body, [2].
Burning-pressing pain in the corn, even in wide shoes, [1].
Cutting in the rectum during stool, with discharge of some blood, [1].
A slight burning feeling in the eyes, and a desire to close them; they feel sore to the touch (nineteenth day), [22].
A kind of occipital vertigo, [55].
Acrid smarting on the forepart of the tongue (after thirty-two hours), [2].
Boring above the root of the nose, [1].
Heaviness in the feet extending to the knee, from early in the morning, [1].
Scraping cough; it seems as if it had settled on the chest, [1].
Much footsweat of intolerable smell; the toes become sore, [1].
Painful stitches in the left temple, returned at 6 P.M. (thirty-first day), [38].
Jerking of the right leg at intervals during the day, followed by trembling of the right hand, so that he could not write, [1].
*Headache in the vertex as from pressure on the top of the brain (ninth day), [1].
Drawing pain in the knees, [2].
Cramping pain in hip-joint, she must walk about to relieve it, [1].
Burning in the rectum during the latter part of a soft stool (after six days), [1].
Great dryness of the tongue in the morning when awaking, as if burned, [1].
Noises in the right ear, [3].
Pressure in the pit of the stomach, passing off by a fermenting movement downwards (after three hours and a half), [2].
Inclination for coition, with great emission of semen, with but slight voluptuous feeling, followed by tension in the abdomen, extending to the spermatic cords (fifth day), [1].
Itching of the occiput, in the evening, [1].
Profuse footsweat, but without odor and not causing soreness, [1].

A watery fluid runs out of the nose (fifth day); considerable mucous discharge from the nose (fourteenth day); fluid frequently flows out of the right nostril (twentieth day); after dinner, a water fluid frequently flows from the nose (thirty-second day); watery discharge from the nose (thirty-fourth day); watery discharge from the nose occasionally (thirty-fifth day); in the forenoon, frequent blowing of thick mucus from the nose (forty-ninth day); blowing of mucus from the nose, in the morning (fifty-third day); much secretion from the nose (sixty-third day); copious secretion of thick mucus from the nose (sixty-seventh day); blowing of thick mucus from the nose (ninety-eighth day); some fluid comes out of the right nostril (one hundred and forty-seventh day); frequent blowing the nose, and coughing (two hundred and nineteenth day); catarrhal symptoms somewhat less (two hundred and twenty-first day), catarrhal symptoms continue in a milder degree (two hundred and twenty-third day); a fluid runs out of the left nostril (two hundred and thirty-first day); blowing from the nose of thick mucus; catarrhal sufferings, at noon (two hundred and sixty-ninth day); much mucus blown from the nose (two hundred and seventy-fourth day); blowing from the nose of thick mucus (two hundred and seventy-fifth day), [45b].
Dimness of vision and weakness of both eyes, with innumerable confused dark spots floating before the eyes (in two hours), [25f].

Sticking headache at various times, at times continuing at night with tearing in the lower jaw, or followed by bruised pain in the side of the head, mostly for a short time, relieved by compression of the head, at times obliging to lie down, [3].
Absolutely no taste to food, everything tastes like straw, [2].

Stitching beating in the roots of several teeth, with burning in the gums, renewed when entering the room after walking in the cold air, also after eating and biting, particularly when anything arm touched them; this condition lasted for eight days, after which the tooth began to turn black and decay, [1].
No appetite, all things seemed tasteless to her, [1].
*Every step is painfully felt in the head, [1].
Aching pain in forehead and occiput, especially when stooping, about noon (second day), [43].
Putrid after taste from beer, [1].
Pressing pain on left forearm internally and externally at the bend of the elbow, [2].
After urinating at noon, discharge of milky moisture from the urethra, [1].
Burning in the mouth, in the morning, without thirst, [1].
In the afternoon after a meal, indolent and sleepy, [1].
Tension in the left thigh and leg, like pain when parts have gone to sleep, extending to the sole of the foot (after twenty-four days), [1].
Soreness in the abdomen, as if the menses would appear (after four days), [1].
Eruption on the face, a red roughness of the skin, [1].
Dull aching headache, at one time deep in the forehead, then in the occiput, but always alternating with gouty pains piercing through the joints of the extremities (first day), [25g].
Black spots before my eyes all day, passing in all directions (third day), [21].
Suffused look of the eyes, in the morning when awaking, with smarting in the canthi, [2].
Considerable pain in the right knee (fourth day), [21].
About midnight, awaking with chilliness, great anxiety, jerking and spasmodic drawing in the thighs, the chest, and the maxillæ, lasting half an hour, [1].
Great sensitiveness of the tips of the left upper teeth, worse from cold water, with shooting pains, even in the morning, [3].

Frequent attacks of contractive pain in the right side of the abdomen, worse in the morning; following this, more severe constrictive pain in the stomach; thence the pain extends to the chest; relieved by eructations, [1].
Loud snoring during inspiration, [1].
Green halo around the candlelight, [1].
Trembling of the eyes, [1].
Drawing in the left side of the lower jaw, in the morning after getting up (thirty-first day), [44f].
Vertigo, as if from intoxication (soon, second day), [22c].
Daily griping in the abdomen, without diarrhœa; at the same time much flatus accumulates; relieved by eructations, [1].
*At night, in bed, rush of blood to the head, with heat and confusion of it (first day), [25b].
*Great dulness and confusion, [1].
Several fits of sneezing, in the morning after rising (fourth day); several violent sneezes in rapid succession, in the evening (tenth day), [45].
The back teeth become loose and seem too long, with simple pain on touch, and on eating, [1].
Urging to stool, but passed very little; am not constipated, but seem to have lost power, at 6 P.M. (tenth day), [21].

Tingling at the meatus urinarius (second day); considerable tingling in the urethra, as in the first proving, only more severe, between 1 and 2 P.M. (third day); some tingling (fourth and fifth days), [40a].
Dulness of the whole head and unsteadiness of it, with tension of the muscles of the throat and back of the neck, [1].
The teeth seem too long, [1].
Reappearance of the menses (of an elderly female), which had been absent for several months (after twenty days), [1].
At 9 A.M., felt suddenly sick, with distress in the pelvis, which increased during the forenoon (second day), [20].
Dryness of the tongue, which, after a quarter of an hour, gave place to a slimy taste in the mouth (fourth day), [25f].
Arthritic drawing in the knees, [1].
Grumbling and moving about of flatus in the abdomen, in the evening, [1].
Flashes of heat all over the body, about 8.30 P.M. (twenty-seventh day), [38].
In the morning, after waking, also at intervals, feverish shivering, with short breath, as from internal heat, which, however, did not exist, [1].
Right shoulder lame and stiff (twentieth day), [20].
In the morning, weight and hot feeling in the occiput (fourth and fifth days), [22b].
Vertigo, on waking at night, [1].

Sp. gr. 25 (five days before proving); 22 (four days before proving); 25 (three days before proving); 28 (third day of proving); 25 (fourth, ninth, and eleventh days); sp. gr. urine 30 (from thirteenth to nineteenth days), [22].
Bitter taste, soon after eating, [1].
Painful pressure on the malar bone and beneath the eye, [1].
Flow of water into the mouth (in half an hour, first and second days), [35b].
No appetite, and yet the food has the proper taste (third day), [30].
Toothache and throbbing in the gums during the menses, [1].
Sore pain in the nose, very painful during every inspiration, [1].
Jerking in the left lower lid almost constantly, [1].
Submaxillary gland is swollen, pressing on it produces pain, [1].
Eyelids heavy, in the evening, [1].

Following the perspiration, headache in the right side of the head and face, not severe, but with a surging sensation in the forehead, like waves of pain rolling up and beating against the frontal bone (after forty minutes); pain in head more severe; still on the right side (after one hour and a half); somewhat abated after eating dinner (after two hours); increased again in ten minutes; severe pain in the head, extending somewhat to the left side of the forehead, with the flush (after two hours and three-quarters; less severe (after four hours); slight increase (after five hours); pressive headache, all the time, in the evening, most in the frontal region, lasting till midnight, but abating after going to bed (first day); headache returned, but not so severe as yesterday; pain in forehead quite violent (after three hours); violent pain in the head, mostly in the forehead and malar bones, with heat in the forehead (after five hours); headache relieved by rest and sleep for three hours, in the afternoon (after eleven hours, second day); some headache and pain in the face, but not marked, unless she thinks about it, then the pain is quite severe (after three hours); headache abated (after nine hours, third day); general dull headache all day, with pallor of face (fourth and fifth days); headache abating (sixth day), [44].
At night feverish heat, with anxious fancies and fanciful dreams, with sweat of the head, [1].
Tongue rather white-furred (forty-third day), [22a].
Chilliness, with shivering, repeated two or three times (within a minute), [15].

Creeping-tingling pain in the upper arm, worse from motion and stooping, passing off during rest and when lying in bed; the pain extends to the shoulder-joint, and causes an uneasiness in the arm for three days (after twenty-four hours), [1].
Continued erection after coition, and after nocturnal emissions, [1].
Redness and flushes of heat in the face, [1].
Great increase of sexual desire (first five days), [1].
The eyes are painful to touch when closed, [1].
Had a lewd dream (third night), [27].
Vinegary taste in the mouth all day, [1].
About 4 P.M., after a glass of beer, pressive pain on the left eye (nineteenth day), [22a].
Tension at the bend of the ankle-joint, as if too short, when walking (first days), [1].
Itching on the bends of the elbows, [1].
Much blood with stool, preceded by cutting in the rectum, [1].
Little micturition with much thirst (after three days), [1].
Heaviness in the stomach, with dull pain about the abdomen, [1].
Dryness in the mouth and throat, in the morning on awaking, she could not utter a sound nor speak (after six days), [1].
Epistaxis, and in one case, a man of 60, nose bled every day, after the third day of taking the medicine, something which had not occurred since childhood, [76].
Constant chilliness, day and night, with pinching pain in the abdomen for several days, [1].
*In the morning slight frontal headache (fourth day); in the morning aching in the forehead (fifth day), [22c].
In the forenoon on inspiring cold air, tearing pain in a lower healthy incisor tooth (thirty-sixth day), [33].
Drawing pain in the occiput, so violent, while chewing, that he was obliged to stop eating, [2].
Stitches in the elbow-joint, [1].
Cough, with stitches in both sides of abdomen, upper part, [1].

Sore pain in the whole nose, especially in its septum, the slightest touch increased the pain, in the evening (second day); sore feeling in the nose, in the morning after rising; at noon pain very severe and an acrid fluid flowed from the right nostril (fourth day); the nose, especially its left outer edge, is very sensitive to touch (seventh day); in the morning after waking, very tensive sore pain in the nose, especially at its point; feeling as if the nose was swollen; its internal aspect is covered with small scabs (eighth day); the edges and septum of the nose rather sensitive (tenth day); sensitiveness of the septum of the nose (eleventh day); sensitiveness and dryness of the nose, at noon (thirteenth day), [45].
From 10 A.M. to 6 P.M., throbbing pain in the left temporal region, which was aggravated by walking, and at 6 P.M. suddenly went away (fourth day), [44c].
Uncommon urging to urinate (as in the former proving), (third day), [40a].
When chewing it seems as if the jaws could not be opened, and as if the joint would crack, [1].
Sensation of contraction of the chest, in the morning (after seven days), [1].
Inflammation of the eyes, which cannot endure cold water, [1].
Tearing pressure around the pit of the stomach, [2].
Very disagreeable taste, for an hour after breakfast (fifty-seventh day), [45a].

Fulness of the head greatly aggravated on lying, at 5 P.M.; distress as of a pressing outward in the forehead, and a feeling of sinking in the vertex; sensation as if the brain moved in waves, with a sensation of hunger (twenty-second day), [20].
Two mornings in succession, on awaking, the eyelids were tightly drawn together as if pressed on by lead, without agglutination, [1].
Slight tearing on the right malar bone, below the temple, [2].
Bitter-tasting mucus in the mouth, worse in the morning, [1].
Itching in the rectum and anus, [1].
The limbs from the knees downward ache badly during the afternoon (third day), [22].
Have had a sense of nausea all the morning, with no desire for food; think I will not dine to-day (sixth day), [37].
Wakeful and excited the whole night, and through the whole day feels vigorous, [1].
A vesicle on the left border of the tongue (thirty-third day), [33].
Soreness and inflamed feel of labia, externa and interna, [10].
A thick painless lump on the lower jaw, tense on chewing, [1].
A wart seems to be forming on the outer side of the hand, [1].
Sticking headache (after eighteen days), [1].
The head jerks and twitches forward six or seven times, with full consciousness, in the morning, [1].
Pressure in the eyes at night (after two days), [1].
Burning and pressure in the eyes; in the morning they were agglutinated and the whole face swollen, [1].
Throat dry, worse evening (nineteenth day), [20].

On waking from nap, at 7.30 P.M., pain in the lumbar region, more on the left side; pain in the lumbar region all night of a dull aching character (second night); pain in back better this forenoon; pain in the lumbar region somewhat but not much better, in the evening (third day); pain in the back all day, more of a dull ache (fourth day); still some pain in the back (fifth day). Never had any form of backache before I took this medicine, [35].
Foul taste in the mouth as from an old catarrh, [1].
