Bruised pain in the right malar bone, even at night, [3].
Alternate cold hands and feet (several days after ceasing to take the medicine), [29a].
Desquamation of the skin from the inside of the cheek, [1].
In the forenoon, itching and burning in both eyes, followed by great watering of the eyes (third day), [39].
*Stitches in the head and out at the eyes, [1].
Transient aching pain over the right eye and going into the eye (third day), [36].
During eructation stitch in the pit of the stomach, in the left side and between the scapulæ, [1].
Tearing cramp pain extending from the hips to the foot coming on suddenly when walking, lasting eight or ten minutes, [1].
Itching in the whole face, [1].
Stitches in the anus after the morning stool, lasting until afternoon (after seven days), [1].
Slight aching in the region of the kidneys (third day), [40a].
Several jerks in the liver, [1].
Red herpetic spots on both sides of the neck with much itching, [1].
Pressure mostly in the forehead and eyes, finally nausea, with spitting of much saliva, [1].
Shooting above the left eye (twenty-third day), [34].
Dreadful gnawing frontal pains, [66].
Foul taste in the mouth, in the morning, [1].
Soreness of the left commissure of the mouth (sixth day), [17c]; (second day), [17d].
Every night, on retiring, I have a pain across the lower part of the bowels; relieved by passing urine; felt it only when lying down (thirteenth to sixteenth night), [22].
Sexual thoughts, without erections (fourth day), [1].
Violent itching in the outer canthus of the left eye, with sore pain after rubbing it, [2].

Dull drawing-throbbing pain deep in the right side of the forehead, which was at times more violent, and again less so; it lasted half an hour (in two hours); a slight threatening of headache on the left side of the forehead (after four hours, fourth day), sudden, oft-recurring, dull drawing pain in the left side of the forehead, which (in the house and out of the house) alternated with a similar pain, now in the right side of the forehead and now in the right parietal region (after four hours, fifth day); sudden, oft-recurring, dull drawing deep in the left side of the forehead (soon, ninth day), [25].

Violent toothache in a right upper back tooth after eating; the pain extending thence to the forehead and head, also to the cheeks and into both rows of teeth on the right side, disappearing after going to bed in the evening, [7a].
Much pain and weakness in small of back, [8].
Great thirst, and always more thirst than hunger, [3].

Appetite diminished (twelfth and thirteenth days); little appetite (seventeenth day); the appetite was diminished, and after taking but a small quantity of food, he had the feeling as if the stomach was overloaded (twenty-sixth day); appetite diminished, in the forenoon (thirty-first and thirty-third days); appetite diminished; he ate rather from habit than from necessity (thirty-eighth day); appetite diminished (forty-eighth day); little appetite (fifty-second day); at noon the appetite was very poor, and after eating, there was a troublesome feeling of fulness in the stomach and aching in the scrobiculus cordis (fiftieth and fifty-first days), [29].
Weakness of sight, she sees things only sideways, [56].
Dimness of vision, in the forenoon (first day); all the forenoon, unusual weakness and dimness of the eyes, followed by frequent dry tussiculation (third day), [25a].
Disagreeable bitter taste in the mouth, in the morning, [1].
On the right side of the scalp, over the parietal bone, a very painful pimple forms (eighteenth day), [45].
Stitches frequently in the left side of the head, in the afternoon, in the occiput in the evening, [1].
Frequent paroxysms of pinching pain in the liver, [7a].
During the day, frequent cramplike tensive pain in the muscles of both mastoid processes (second day), [25d].
During the whole menstrual period she could not sleep on account of tearing in the back, chills, and heat, with thirst and painful contraction of the chest, [1].
Red, almost sore, little indurations, going and coming, on the inner side of the prepuce and glans, tickling when touched, [1].
Burning in the upper lip and the edges of the lids, in the morning after rising (fourth day), [45].
Grumbling in the front teeth, [2].
Heaviness in the abdomen, [1].
During the day, aching in the forehead (eighth day), [18b].
Slight burning in the upper lip (forty-fifth day), [45a].
Bitter bilious taste in the mouth, when fasting, though food has a good taste, [1].
Loose cough, especially at night, [7].
Great exhaustion and indolence, [7a].
Slept several afternoons (after two days), [1].
Daily jerking under the eyes, [1].
Drawing pain seeming to be external on the forehead back to the occiput, in single drawings, [1].
When he sees food his mouth waters, and he has an appetite, [1].
Stitches in the heels and corns, during the day, [1].
In the morning on awaking, sensation of dryness in the mouth (fourteenth day), [29].
The left side of the tongue is covered with blisters (fourth day); much worse (fifth day), [21].
During the first part of the proving I slept soundly, but now sleep is restless (forty-fourth night), [38].
Acidity in the mouth, and acid eructations after drinking milk, [1].
Itching on the borders of the eyelids (eighth day), [44b].
The left jaw very little painful (two hundred and eighty-fourth day), [45b].
The menses, which had always been very regular, came on seven days too early (after twenty days), [1].

Great distress in the stomach, it is sensitive to the pressure of the clothes, and there is an aching and throbbing, relieved by slight eructations; in the afternoon the distress is worse; it is sore and sensitive as a boil; even walking is painful from the jarring; this almost entirely ceases after supper; some flatulence in the evening (fifteenth day), [20].
The hair of the head so more and tender that he could not comb it, [19].
Movements of the scalp from the nape of the neck over the vertex to the forehead, [1].
10 P.M., a chilly sensation in back and right shoulder, running downwards; chilliness in the back, if lying on either side, removed by lying on the back (twenty-first day), [20].
When awake in the night great distress in the stomach (gnawing aching in pit of stomach), with sensitiveness; could not bear weight of clothes (twenty-first night), [20].
In the evening, sudden, very painful tearing in the left upper eyelid (twenty-third day), [22a].
Vertigo, when rising up in bed at night, [1].
Passed an ordinary amount of urine twenty times in thirty minutes, at 2 P.M., [17].
Dreams, not exhausting, the whole night, [3].
In the afternoon (when driving in his carriage), headache in the whole of the left side of the cerebrum (third day), [25e].
While at stool, a painful raw sensation in the anus (sixth day), [37].
Before the menses acrid leucorrhœa, with soreness of the pudendum, [1].
Burning and stitching in the ulcer, particularly at night, [1].
Less appetite than usual, at noon (seventy-third day), [45b].
Some pain in the forehead, with the dryness and stinging in the nose (second day); slight frontal headache (twelfth day); frontal headache, and below temples (thirteenth day), [44a].
Stitching in the sole of left foot, even when sitting, [1].
*Heaviness in the head (fifteenth and seventeenth days), [34a].
Sensation of hunger, with the sensation as if the brain moved in waves (twenty-second day), [20].
Biting of the eyes and lachrymation, every evening, [1].
Severe cough, in the evening, [1].
*Heaviness of the head, so that every motion was disagreeable, [1].
Tearing in the left ear, extending into the head, [1], [3].
In the evening, sudden drawing on the right side of the lower jaw (third day), [44].
Tearing in the first phalanx of right thumb, [2].
Feeling as if the head were stuffed, as the pain in the eye ceased, in the evening (third day), [35].
Rending pressure over the right hip from before backwards, [2].
Pressure in the right hip-joint close to the body, coming on gradually, getting to its height, and then gradually going off, [2].
Copious sweat of the male genitals (after three days), [1].
About 2 A.M., painful dry sensation in both eyes (third day), [25g].
Heaviness in the feet when taking a walk (after a few hours), [1].
Lachrymation in the open air, several days, [48].
Burning in the lower half of the legs, at night in bed, she had to uncover them, [1].
Attacks of flushes of heat, as if hot water were poured on one, with redness of the face, sweat of the whole body, and anxiety, without thirst, yet without dryness of the throat, [1].
Digging sensation in the upper teeth, [1].
Aching and heat in the head, about noon (twenty-first day), [43].
Painful contraction and pressure in throat, [1].
A ringing roaring in the head coming out at the ears, [1].
Stitches in one of the breasts, [1].
*In the evening, dull pain in the whole head, which lasted till late at night (fifth day), [24].
Nose much stopped up (sixteenth day), [34a].
Aching pains in the left frontal region on going upstairs (seventh day), [44a].
Painful heat in the head, frequently, with flushes of heat over the body, [1].
Convulsive beating of the heart, with great anxiety and trembling of the fingers and lower limbs, [1].
Pressure in the throat in the region of the tonsils, as if the neckcloth were tied too tight, [1].
In the morning, after waking, pain on the left side of the lower jaw, and swelling of the gum around a tooth, as if a gumboil were about to come (one hundred and first day), [45a].
Severe bruised pain in the left upper arm, [1].
Profuse morning sweat (after three days), [1].
A peculiar roaring in the ears, [1], [7d].
*Heaviness of the head while sitting, lying, moving, and stooping, [1].
Burning in the right flank, [2].
Dreams full of dispute, [1].
A toe-nail, which had been crippled for years, suppurated, and in its stead a new and healthy nail formed, [1].
Palpitation of the heart, with anxious feeling, which necessitates taking a deep breath, without any influence on the spirits, for several days (after twenty-two days), [1].
Severe itching on the tibiæ, [1].
A back tooth is painful to touch, [1].
Slow pulse, 56 to 58 (after thirty-two days), [1].
Heat in the mouth, and much thirst, at night, [1].
An inflamed pimple above the left eyebrow (one hundred and twenty-seventh day), [45b].
Sleep disturbed, through vivid unpleasant dreams (after sixteen days), [1].

The skin of the head is again covered with many white scales, difficult to get away (one hundred and eighty-ninth day); on combing the hair, a quantity of scales fall from the head (one hundred and ninety-third day); many scales on the head (two hundred and thirty-second day); a large number of scales on the head, especially the vertex (two hundred and fifty-third day); accumulation of scales on the scalp (two hundred and sixty-ninth day), [45b].
Stitches in the vagina every three or four seconds, and after a quarter of an hour a similar attack, [1].
Head stupefied (eighty-third day), [45a].
Heat and dryness of the margins of the lids (twentieth day), [20].
He awakes at night in a fright and screaming, [1].
Sight dim, and an appearance as of a mist before the eye (third day), [35].
Redness of the white of the eye, in the morning on awaking, with burning, smarting, and pressure, [1].
Have always had a strong appetite, but while taking the medicine, had but little inclination to eat, [27].
First a smarting, then a cutting, and at times also pressing sensation in the left side of throat, [2].
Eructations, with efforts to vomit (after twenty-six hours), [1].
Chilliness for many nights, [1].
What he eats tastes like nothing, like bad wood, [1].
Burning smarting of the lower lip, [3].
Pain in the hip, worse from walking, [28a].
Continual inclination to stool, yet passed but little, [1].
Itching pimples on the chin, [1].
Violent palpitation of the heart and beating of all the arteries, in the evening in bed, [1].
Great bitterness in the mouth while eating, [1].
Arrests breathing when standing still, [1].
Great stoppage of the nose, for several days; on blowing the nose clots of blood are at times discharged, [1].
Throbbing in the head (temples), on the neck, and about the heart; everything in it throbbed and trembled, [1].
Much eye-gum on the ciliæ, in the morning, after waking (ninth day), [44d].
Sticking pain under the right false ribs, with the short, dry, evening cough, [1].
Itching in the ulcer, [1].
Some dimness of sight (after some days), [6].
Great desire for wine, which he previously did not drink at all, [1].
Pinching jerks in the head, in the morning when rising, [1].
Tensive pain in the dorsum of left foot, making it impossible for her to walk on the pavement, [1].
Herpetic eruption on the lips, [1].
Dull stitches in the whole head, lastly in the occiput, making him feel quite inactive, [1].
Foul filthy taste of different kinds, [13].
Coryza, which he formerly never had; he snuffles continually, [1].
A full feeling in the head, [28a].
Falls asleep late (after a few hours), [2].
Pressing headache in the hot forehead, in the evening from 7 to 8 o'clock (after fourth and fifth days), [1].
Toothache in paroxysms, for two or three hours, followed by burrowing; cold is better tolerated than warmth, [1].
Two stools and always with some tenesmus, [1].
Many itching pimples on the legs, [1].
Pain in the abdomen, in the afternoon, as if the intestines were being torn out, [1].
All the pains came suddenly, leaving more gradually but very soon, except the pain in the face and shoulder, [27].
After dinner flatulent distension of the abdomen, relieved by eructations, continued until evening, when it disappeared, without emission of flatus, [1].
Tension at the anus after stool, [1].
